Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Blondie_0
Reviews.Content: Stayed as family of 3 in a one bed apartment - large open plan living & dining space, large bathroom & balcony, all well equipped/furnished. Large family pool, small quieter pool & hot tub all very good with activites for kids (& parents) throughout the day & ample sun loungers. On site shop/cafe which was reasonably priced for snacks etc. Ample underground parking. Staff were helpful & we were allocated a room with a view of the disney fireworks in the evening (as requested). It would be a little remote if you didn't have your own car but we did so this wasn't a problem & mean't we were only minutes from all the attractions (& a walmart for stocking up) but could return to a tranquil base easily. We would stay at this resort again without issue as we thoroughly enjoyed our time there and the freedom of the apartment as opposed to a hotel room whilst not compromising on facilities is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: abixable
Reviews.Content: We were offered a 3 night stay in a luxurious bedroon suite for $167.00. Instead, we got a long and narrow room (studio) very bare and sparse, small window - no balcony, 2 chairs and no couch. One very small refridgerator, microwave and sink. No carpeting and the layout of the bathroom was very difficult because the toilet was located behind the door when it was open. Additionally, the power kep going off and times we returned with no A/C because it has gone off. The clock radio never worked. No person greeted us upon arrival and we had to carry all our luggage up to the 14th floor since there were no trolleys available.

Reviews.Title: “Parc Soleil vs International Drive”
Reviews.Author: anagreeneyez
Reviews.Content: We are owners at HGVC on International Drive but decided to try out the new Parc Soleil. At first we were all excited but after the first day we wished we were at the International Drive location. The pool is beautiful with the water slide, that my daughter enjoyed but that's it. It seems as though they also do more activities for the kids at ID than at Parc Soleil. I bought tickets from the Concierge for Islands of Adventure and realized when I got to the park that we paid $11 more per adult and $6 more for our daughter ~ as if the parks don't cost enough as it is. The food at the restaurant is very good but the bar itself is very small. The one on ID is def. much nicer with a great resort feel. The rooms were very nice but again, ID is much nicer. The ones at ID have jacuzzi tubs in the bedroom, no jacuzzi tubs here. The kitchen is also smaller here. We ordered a high chair and pack n play from house keeping, which was great that we didn't have to travel with them, only thing they took a while to come. Regarding what everyone is referring to as the resort being in the middle of nowhere, it does feel like this. The resort is by itself down a lonely road. I'm sure this area will be built up soon, but for now there isn't much going on in the immediate area. It is close to all attractions and driving distance to stores and restaurants, etc. This is another reason we prefer the HGVC on International Drive. The outlets are right behind it and there is a path that can take you right to them so there is no fighting for a parking spot on a busy day. Publix is right across the street along with Outback, Mcdonald's and other restaurants. ID also has a Pizza Hut on location along with a kiddie spray area, the run through kind. There is a projected plan for 7 buildings total... I hope they plan to add more pools or at least one more bc as of right now there is almost not enough lounge chairs for the 2 buildings they have, let alone 5 more buildings with many more ppl. We would stay here again but not in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: VanVlerah
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here at this hotel for 3-4 nights. It is/was a new(er) hotel and that always makes it nice, as all of the furnishings and rooms were rather spotless. The amenities were very good and the location can hardly be beat if your aim is toward the touristy areas of Orlando (Lake Buena Vista). We ordered room service twice, and both times it was very good and surprisingly quick. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful One-Bedroom Suite”
Reviews.Author: KKD_Newtown
Reviews.Content: We were offered a three-night stay at the Hilton Parc Soleil for a total of $150 in exchange for participating in a two-hour vacation club pitch. We extended our stay to five nights for an additional $119/night. The room was spacious and beautifully appointed. The kitchen is stocked with place-settings for four. There is a washer and dryer in the kitchen. The pull out sofa is large but a little to firm - one of our kids complained. The bathroom was very large with double sinks, a large soaking tub (a nice reprieve after hours of walking throught the parks!) and a separate large shower. Two towers are built and Hilton is in the process of expanding the property with three additional buildings. There are two pools - one had a water slide that our 6 and 8 year old thoroughly enjoyed. The service was good - we found them to be accomodating and efficient. There is a restaurant by the pool that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. The pancakes were huge and delicious! The hotel is located about 15 minutes from Disneyworld. The hotel is gated and you need to insert your room card in order to enter. The gargage is located beneath the hotel - it felt very safe. The vacation club/time share pitch was hard sell - While we were not interested in purchasing a full vacation club, we did end up buying a seven day package to use within the next 18 months at either Orlando, New York or Las Vegas. We would stay at the Hilton Parc Soleil again!

Reviews.Title: “Parc Soleil”
Reviews.Author: krtmom
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 visited the Parc Soleil over Easter Break. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite that had plenty of space The extra bath was a necessity for our 2 teenagers. The hotel is beautiful and has many amenities. My children especially enjoyed the pools and waterslide. We requested a pool view( which we had--of the quiet pool) and we could also see the fireworks as this unit was on the side of the building. I only had one issue with service--We were contacted in advance about our upcoming stay by Jodie ( a resort concierge liason) who asked us several questions including if we were celebrating any special occasions. I informed her that we were celebrating our daughter's17th birthday and she even replied needing to know her name--but absolutely NOTHING was done. Not a big deal but don't go to the trouble of asking if it doesn't really matter! They did however follow thorugh with our request for foam instead of feather pillows due to an allergy and promptly attended to an air conditioning problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PowellSharon
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Parc Soleil. There were three of us (DH, myself and 21 year old daughter). We had a 1 bedroom and daughter had the sofa bed. All the beds were comfortable, facilities were generally very nice. Location was actually a positive for us since it allowed us to avoid some of the worst of the local traffic. GPS was confused about the location however and signage is a bit weak. Plus: Lots of space for us all. Exceedingly large bathroom with two sinks and access from both the living room and bedroom. Once we declined the timeshare presentation request they left us alone. Some negatives: Shower had a strange tendency to splatter all over floor outside if we weren't exceptionally careful which was annoying. Kitchen was a bit limited in dishes and silverware requiring us to run the dishwasher daily since there was only service for 4. We were also promised a call when our room was ready (we had arrived before 10am and left to go visit Disney) but the call never came. We also received several phone calls before the trip trying to get us to go to a timeshare presentation which we declined.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Close to Everything!”
Reviews.Author: tabby1881
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review of Parc Soleil. We just stayed here for five nights on a time share exchange. We loved it! We had a one bedroom unit on the 12th floor of building two. Our balcony overlooked a huge vacant lot. Not the most scenic thing to look at. But then, look to the horizon and you can see Magic Kingdom in the distance. We watched the Wishes fireworks every night except for one right from our balcony. We were at least 5 miles away, but we could see the fireworks perfectly. When we looked to our right, we could see Universal, Orange County Convention Ctr, The Fun Spot, etc. from a distance. 5 miles or so. Looking to the left, we could see in the distance Epcot, Swan & Dolphin, and Tower of Terror. We could also see a bit of Downtown Disney. The pool area was wonderful. We enjoyed the quiet pool even more. Pools & whirlpools were open from 7-11 daily. There was a washer & dryer right in our unit. Nice little market near the pool along with a cafe. We never went to the cafe though. We found the location to be great. We were able to use the backroads (Palm Parkway) to get to Disney or Universal. Sea World was just around the corner. There is absolutely nothing within walking distance of the resort, so a car is most helpful. The resort was also close to the Premium Outlets just on the other side of I-4. Very easy drive to get there. The closest attraction for us was Downtown Disney. Staff of the resort was very friendly & helpful to us. Very nice place. We were called once to see if we would like to attend a sales pitch. We said no thank you, and we were not bothered again. Covered parking in garage is available. I would not have liked to stay on one of the lower floors as some of the balconys were right above part of the garage that was open air. We didn't have any face cloths in the room at first. I called house keeping the next morning and asked for some. I said no rush. Then I went downstairs to walk around the pool area. The face cloths were in my room by the time I came back upstairs about half an hour later.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing suite, great staff, love the pool!”
Reviews.Author: rwzparveen
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at parc soleil last year on our honeymoon and all i can say is that it was a great experience! The staff were so friendly, the concierge was extremely helpful and i fell in love with the suite! It was like our little home, we tried out the sofa bed which was great. We loved the whole experience and want to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost A Good One”
Reviews.Author: Insuldad
Reviews.Content: Frequent Hilton Customer. Bad mistake staying in Studio. Attempted to upgrade with no success. HVAC System is so loud. Bad design for sure. This property almost gets to Resort Status, but looks like budget cuts were made on pool lounging chairs (not comfortable), cheap flooring and cabinets. Pool is nice. Had to put a stop to timeshare wake up calls. Good try maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Better stay this time.”
Reviews.Author: ef2001
Reviews.Content: Our most recent stay here was much better than the last. We had hot water in our room, something we were without for five days last time. Thankfully we also had a Dinsey view which is a plus for watching the fireworks. Overall, it is a somewhat quiet resort; just be sure to avoid a pool view if you're looking for relaxation. In my opinion, the restaurant isn't worth it; just take a short drive to 535 and grab a bite at one of the local spots.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Chris N
Reviews.Content: My Fiancee and I stayed here for about ten days. The resort and suites are fantastic and the grounds are immaculate. We had a one bed suite with a full and spotless kitchen. Location is again excellent yet quiet as it is not surrounded by busy roads and other hotels. Our suite had a view of the Magic Kingdom and Epcot (albeit in the distance) and saw some of the firework displays. Why anyone would want to stay in just a hotel room when you can stay at a place like this for a similar price is something I just can't understand. Conclusion - Wonderful. You wouldn't be disappointed by staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cdietz19
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the Parc Soleil over spring break and had a wonderful time. The on-site amenities surpassed our expectations with the open air restaurant/bar, tables by the pool side and most importantly, the Activity Center. Our 9 and 7 year olds had an EXCELLENT time in the activity center during our stay. They became friends with other kdis at the resort and were able to escape us for time with other kids. Since its so close to the pool we were able to stay by the pool enjoying ourselves while they were busy. In addition, the pool has a water slide which single handedly exhausted our 7 year old son each day. The resort is in close proximity to all Orlando activites which was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: RHS1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for spring break in a 2 bedroom. It was great to have a full kitchen and washer/ dryer. The bathrooms are huge. Both bedrooms had a king size bed plus a king size sleeper sofa, which was comfortable. Our room was on the 14 the floor facing the pool. Friends who had the fireworks view preferred the pool view we had. The restaurant has good food and friendly service. The main pool is perfect for young kids, our 4 year old could easily navigate the entire length of the pool. The activity center had ping pong, pool, wii, ps3, games and computers. There were daily activies for kids like hula hoop contest, bingo, snow cones, tie dye t-shirts and water slide races. The resort was close to Disney, Universal and Seaworld probably 10 minute drive to parks. The only drawback is there is nothing within walking distance and area desolate because whole resort is not built yet. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, not finished developing”
Reviews.Author: ksjoan
Reviews.Content: This is a nice enough hotel. It's part of the Hilton Grand Vacation time share group. The pool was nice, slide, several hot tubs. Some activities. Massage at the pool available. Hair braids. There are only two towers built. There are plans to build several more. There are some grills, a tennis court and basketball goal. There is a pond that is about a half-mile walk around - nice for walks. The rooms are clean, nice and new. Typical Hilton layout. Only King beds. If you want two-bedroom you get attached to a studio - and again only king bed. With two teenage boys we had to utilize the sofa couch. It is yet to be seen what this resort will be like when it is built out. I really don't think the pool will be big enough to accommodate all the people when all the towers are built. Right now, it is a bit in the middle of a big empty field - but it is close to everything. Restaurants, etc. Also - it was easy to get to both Disney World and Universal from this hotel. There was only one hotel - out by the pool. The food was good, not great, but good. We ate there for two dinners. The service was not great. We had four different people wait on us one night. One other night - it took 20 minutes to just get a menu. It was not crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Toothmom3
Reviews.Content: We are HVC members and have stayed in both of the other Orlando resorts. This one is very nice. Closest to Disney I think. It has the best kids activities center of the 3. Good pool for young kids because most of it is shallow. Service has been great. We called twice for sheets, etc. and they were very prompt.

Reviews.Title: “stay here, you will enjoy it!”
Reviews.Author: Babakati
Reviews.Content: Just finished an 8 night stay here, and to some it up, it was an excellent experience. last year we stayed at the sister property, the Tuscany one, we liked Parc Soleil better. Our 1 bdrm suite was huge, with a great balcony facing the pool(which I requested) that had great views from the 11th floor. I was worried about some of the concerns that reviewers had, i.e poor sound insulation, well, that is true, but I don't think it was any different than any other hotel or apartment building for that matter. I am a light sleeper and I value room quietness, I had no issues. We found the restaurant by the pool to be fairly priced with great food, especially the kids menu... The location was perfect, no traffic by the hotel entrance!!!!! 3 minute drive to downtown Disney entrance and a 5 minute drive to seaworld... As others have mentioned here, the staff was excellent. Hilton grand vacations club do an excellent job with kids activities, in my book they are the ones to beat. We will definitely stay here if we come back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “This place was awesome”
Reviews.Author: southbound35w
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in a Disney world dump unless u like worn out nasty rooms like Disney world has. This place is the nicest place I have ever stayed at. The restaurant was great. The water park was great. The room we had was way beyond our expectations. Even when u pull up to this place u feel like ur at a 5 star resort where celebrities would be. This place look awesome when u pull up and this was the best stay ever for us and if we ever in the Orlando area again we will be staying here. Five stars for this place!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Stay and AMAZING Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: mvail1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are from Canada and stay in Orlando at least twice a year.This year we were lucky enough to stay two nights at the Parc Soleil by Hilton for 2 nights with some friends who are owners.We just got back and wish we could have stayed longer! The grounds were immaculate and the two bedroom suite was spacious and was like brand new. The view of Disney fireworks at night was a plus.As well as the proximity to ALL Orlando attractions.I must say that the staff were all great and a special credit for the brilliant and "at your service" staff including Housekeepers as well as security services officer Pete.Although we were familiar with the area, Pete still had great tips on where to eat that we never knew about and as someone from Buffalo made us laugh as he was able to swap hockey stories with us.Truly more of a concierge than security officer.Pete, thank you for making our trip so special! We plan to return here in the fall and are already looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful family place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Michelle d
Reviews.Content: Our family travels to Orlando at least once a year, and I plan where we stay. We have stayed in hotels, motels, rental homes, and onsite at Disney. So I think I am more than qualified to give a good honest review of this hotel. First of all, due to my mix up, we arrived a day early. And it was Spring Break. As I stood at the check-in, I was frantically wondering where on earth we would end up, because the hotel was full, and so were many others due to the time of year. Luckily, they moved us into the penthouse for one night until our reservation began the next day. For a normal rate, not the penthouse rate. Everyone at the front desk was very gracious. In fact, every employee I encountered during this stay was very friendly and helpful. Staying here gives you the best of both worlds. You get the convenience of a condo, but the amenities of a hotel. We had a 2 bdrm unit, fireworks view. That was so nice. Most evenings as we got the kids ready for bed we enjoyed watching the EPCOT and Magic Kingdom fireworks. My kids loved the hotel. They really enjoyed the game room, and the pool. There is a nice water slide that they had fun on. Even my teenager had a good time. She actually showed an interest in doing the things the hotel would offer every day, something we normally don't see from her. The hotel plans several things per day to keep kids and their parents entertained, such as a Mario Kart contest, a tie-dye shirt session, music trivia by the pool, a not-so-newlywed game, etc. There is plenty to keep you occupied right here. And the on-site restaurant is very good. The pool is heated to a comfortable temperature, and there are 4 hot tubs scattered around so you are not crammed in one with a ton of people. The pool also has a beach entry, which is great for toddlers. And there are some small fountains at the entry that the little ones can splash in. But you also have the condo convenience of bringing in your own food, cooking it there, etc. As for someone complaining about the maid service, they tell you that there is none unless you stay for 7 days then you get one day of cleaning. If you rent a house or condo normally, there is never any maid service. BUT, if you need new towels, they will gladly come and trade them out. We had 6 people in this unit, and each room had a king bed, including the couch. I have never seen a king size fold out couch before. This worked great! Yes, you need a rental car. But you need that anywhere you stay in Orlando unless you are onsite at Disney and have no plans to do anything else. It was actually nice being away from the maddening crowd. To be so close to Disney, yet have no crowds or traffic around was something we have not experienced before. Also, it was nice having a parking garage. One day it was raining, and we comfortably walked to our car and got in, unlike in other places where your car is exposed to the elements and you run for it and get soaking wet. The beds were very comfortable, and the pillows were great too. I did not like the provided shampoo, it had a very manly smell. I smelled like my dad after I washed my hair! The elevators are very speedy which is nice. No long waits there. We stayed in bldg 100 and had no issues with sound from neighbors. There is a nice mile-long path around a pond, and I saw people on it at all hours. All in all, I was very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “OVER RATED”
Reviews.Author: MiMi143
Reviews.Content: I really can't believe so many people are getting taken in by this scam. What you have are two high rise underfurnished hotels that are luring people in for a cheap rate to hear their speal on how great it would be to become a "part owner" of this complex. First of all, with all of the other hotels, and especially the Disney properties, why would anyone invest in this? Oh, that's right, you get to "travel" all over with your points to stay at other properties. You could do that anyway without your points, HELLO!! This place is way away from all of the hustle and bustle of Orlando. That may be a good thing, until you have to venture out. The gated entrance is nothing special. I guess the garage parking is good for summer heat. The hallways are wide, but stark of decor. We stayed in a "King Studio" that was zilch of any luxury. Cheap wood laminate floors greet you. Then there is the "mini kitchen" with a mini fridge, bare minimum utensils/dishware and minimal storage space. Then there is a king bed two end tables, wall lamps, bistro table and two chairs, console and flat screen tv, teeny closet. There is no where to place your luggage (no racks) so you have to lay them on the floor. The closet barely holds anything. The bathroom, while large, has no place to hang a towel, sit down, get dressed. Oh did I mention we had to run the water for more than 10 minutes to get any hot water? Did I mention that housekeeping is slim to none - we had to call after 6pm to report no cleaning done? Add to that the HVAC that sounds like a jet taking off. Oh, and when anyone flushes, you think there is target practice going on in the surroundings! Yet, I have seen ratings here and other sites that still give this place 4-5 stars. Why? You get better accomodations at many other Hilton properties, as well as other hoteliers. Don't get sucked in with this "key investment to your future vacations!" It is a joke, and definitely not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Resort for Theme Park Visit or Staying and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: melissaMoorhead_MN
Reviews.Content: We were given the opportunity to stay at Parc Soleil to take part in a 90 minute time-share presentation. In all, we stayed for 5 days and 4 nights. It was funny reading other reviews of this place before we left . . . . I warned the kids about the speed of the water slide . . . and our kids actually got stuck going down because the water pressure was so slow/low . . . so I think that they have been reading feedback and have turned it down?? Also, there are LOTS of things close by for shopping and eating . . . it is immediately surrounded by fields/future construction sites for Hilton Grand Vacations, but by no means is it in the middle of nowhere. It was just a few minutes from all of Disney. It is very close to Downtown Disney and many other restaurants. I think the longest it took to get to any of the parks was 15 minutes . . . and that was because of bad timing at traffic lights. We ate at the restaurant on site and used the on site market to buy some breakfast items so we could eat in our room each morning. Good food at fair prices at the restaurant, and elevated prices at the market, but not so elevated that it made me want to leave and go grocery shopping somewhere else. You are paying for the convenience. The rooms/apartments were very nice. We had a two-room suite in tower one, which was essentially a one-room suite with an adjacent studio suite that opened up to the main living room area of the one-room suite. It was huge. Two-bathrooms, full kitchen (and a small kitchen in the studio). More space than we really needed, but it was really nice to have with three kids. The best part about the room, was the washer and drier. So nice to be able to pack less and be able to wash clothes! The kids activity center was wonderful. No joking, our kids wanted to leave Disney early so they could get in on some of the events and activities going on at the Resort . . . There was so much for the kids to do: wii, playstation 3, arts and crafts, hair braiding, karaoke, ping pong, pool, family water Olympics, basketball, tennis, board games . . . you name it, they had it. I think they even offered a SCUBA class in one of the pools. For every activity that the kids participate in, they get stamps in their resort passport. Once they have so many points, then you can cash them in for a prize (similar to Chuck E. Cheese prizes). The 90 minute time-share presentation itself was very enlightening . . . they do the time-share thing very differently . . . you work with points and not weeks . . . . But at any rate, besides that 90 presentation, we were not pressured or asked about joining Hilton Grand Vacation Club again. The only bad thing I have to say about Parc Soleil, is that just after we checked out on our final morning, we realized that we left our boys two brand new light-sabers in the cupboard above the fridge. It was too late for us to turn around and go back, so I called and asked them to mail them to us. I knew exactly where they were when we left and gave that info to the lost and found office. They said they would be willing to mail them, but that none were found in our room or in the specific place I asked them to check above the fridge. Basically, I don't fully trust the cleaning staff, and they must have stolen them. So be sure to use the safes inside the closets for valuables, and TRIPLE check your room before checking out.

Reviews.Title: “not one bad thing i have to say”
Reviews.Author: Andreamelo
Reviews.Content: staff friendly, great clean rooms, games room for the kids is awesome, pool area worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “Always a nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Beth0313
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in several hotels around the Orlando area and this seems to be our favorite. It's always clean, there's activities for the kids, the staff is helpful and friendly and the pool area is awesome. The only downside is the studio room doesn't have a bath tub for the baby. We have to get the larger room with the kitchen and living area. We love this hotel though!

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck for family Disney trip!”
Reviews.Author: melliepooh80
Reviews.Content: I will start off by admitting i am known to be a bit of a "hotel snob" but all in all this place did not disappoint. We stayed for a week here at the resort. Beautiful! Reasonably priced! Excellent location! A 5 minute drive to Disney and main streets filled with restaurants and stores so the people that said the location was far away from necessities need to reevaluate.Our one bedroom suite had everything you could need. The bed was super comfy, the pools were great, the staff was fantastic. Our room was next door to the laundry room on our floor which made me very nervous considering some reviews saying the walls were very thin and we didn't hear a peep from outside our room the entire stay. We stayed in tower 2 the newer one which was very modern and clean and we had a lovely view of the pool below as well as parks and fireworks in the distance. There was one mention of a time share presentation at check in and then one phone call later that day but that was it. We did not experience any pushiness at all that some mentioned. There was a strong food smell in the parking garage that some people mentioned but it didn't bother us at all aside from the fact it made us hungry :) I was very happy with the recycling bin located right at the door in the parking garage before you enter the building. Was very nice to see. The elevators were super fast which was fantastic! With anything however there is room for improvement so a few suggestions... Our biggest beef was one nite in the pool they were bringing out the inflatable movie screen and were going to play one of my daughters favorite movies, Rio. We were planning on eating at the restaurant beside the pool, outside so we could watch the movie. There were SEVERAL tables outside with dirty plates and empty glasses on them and when my husband inquired he was told some families were "still using" the tables. Well we were in the pool for 2 hours and nobody sat there once so why not give another family a chance? Was really not impressed with that. As far as I'm concerned if you want to "keep" a table for hours you should be sitting at it, and ordering food, drinks etc. Also lots of ppl taking up tables sitting for a few hours after having a drink or meal. Can't you sit in one of the million lounge chairs instead and let another family have a turn? Surely there can be a better way to serve people. We ended up ordering in from a restaurant. Another thing was water pressure in the shower was poor. For someone with very thick hair like myself it takes forever to get the shampoo out. Was very excited to see two shower heads in the shower as well only to find out one did not work :( And lastly, one small suggestion is to put some kind of step stool in the washroom. Being a family resort it would be a great investment. the sinks were too high for my daughter to reach anything so we ended up pulling an ottoman in from our room to help. Would be a good idea. All in all we were far more impressed then not and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton's big mistake paid off for us in the end”
Reviews.Author: ohnostargazer
Reviews.Content: We bought a Hilton Grand Vacations Package for 3 nights at a Hilton in Orlando. I made the reservations and had our timeshare appointment set up months in advance. After being at Disney's Fort Wilderness campground for almost 2 weeks, we were looking forward to a nice hotel room. When we got to the Hilton we booked, they couldn't find our reservation. After checking everything and being on the phone for a while with Hilton Grand Vacations, the lady on the phone told me we had to go to another hotel. She sent us to Parc Soleil, a little further away from Downtown Disney than I had wanted or planned. After an hour of all this and then driving to find the Parc Soleil, we got there, a little worse for wear. When we walked in, everyone was very nice, the hotel itself looked very nice. They were having problems with their computer system when we were checking in, and the young girl helping us could see we were frazzled, so she offered us some water and snacks while the manager tried to fix the problem. After a few minutes we were all checked in and given directions to our room. We parked in the parking garage and headed up to our room. When we got to our room, we were pleasantly surprised. It was a studio room (the original hotel was a plain HIlton and we were supposed to get a room with 2 double beds and that's it). It was very spacious. The bathroom was huge, there was a lot of open space. There was a table and 2 chairs, a king size bed, a nice big window that we could look out of and watch the fireworks at Epcot. There was also a little kitchen area which included a sink, micorwave, fridge, coffee maker, toaster, and some dishes, dish towels, and dish soap. The next day we checked out the pool area, the restaurant, the market, and some of the activities. The restaurant and marker were a little pricey, but you can expect that somewhere like this. The pool looks nice, but isn't as big as it looks once you get in and see there's an area roped off for the slide and with the fountains running, it really reduced the size of the pool. On a side note, after reading other reviews that says the waterslide is pretty intense, my husband went down it and said it is pretty fast, so it may not be great for young children. We did the timeshare presentation, which they told us was only 45 minutes, but of course it was much, much longer. The lady was pushy even though I was promised it wouldn't be pushy (like I would actually believe that). While we were waiting for our presenter, we were given hot dogs, chips, donuts, snacks, and drinks though, which was nice. We did a few activities, mainly snow cones and Bingo, which was nice. I like having some activities around the resort to do, even though we don't have kids with us. Overall, the hotel is very nice and I would definately stay there again if the price was right. Right now they only have 2 buildings, but are planning on 5 more in the future. The hotel is literally in the middle of a field right now. There's nothing else around, but everything is very close. Downtown Disney and all the surrounding stuff is only 5-10 minutes away. I really liked staying here. It really was a vacation. One of the days we were there, we didn't even leave the resort (which is rare for us). Even though you can see the highway from the hotel, there wasn't any noise from it, at least in our building.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: N C
Reviews.Content: I booked here at the last minute thinking it was a standard Hilton Hotel. When I went to check in I was asked if I was an 'owner'...I immediately thought the price I got was going to force me to do a timeshare tour. I was informed about the tour and the benefits, but never pressured. I respectfully declined and said that I was only in town for 2 days, the manager was kind enough to upgrade me to a suite (slow time, and I'm diamond). The rooms are amazing...I thought about moving in and never going home. Staff is friendly and helpful also...would definitely go back! well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Simonadamien
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at Parc Soleil for the last two years and love it. We have two young kids (5 and 3) and find it perfect for our circumstance. It's a perfect home base to visit the orlando attractions - it's close to everything. The pool slide is also nice leverage to use to get the kids to behave while visiting stuff - they love it. There's a nice play room for rainy days as well as a nice sunshaded outside play park. The food is good and is priced fairly. The hotel is cleaned and very well maintained. The price is fair for what you get. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, the value at this price? Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: atlbritt
Reviews.Content: I am short on time so have to make this quick, but will definitely come back to Parc Soleil. I did not want to go home. Truly luxurious and gorgeous 1 bedroom suite - more like an apartment. Great bathtub - I used every night there. Beautiful pool and grounds. Walking trail, water slide, playground, super clean and friendly. I was treated like a valued guest and the staff remembered us at the cafes. Did not even go to a theme park because we had so much fun at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Parc Soleil”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelChicago
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay for 3 nights because HH contacted us to sit through the timeshare presentation and in turn gave us a really great rate. My husband, 2 yo daughter, and I stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath lockout. The accommodations were very nice, clean, large, and well appointed. The towels were thick and soft and the beds were comfortable. Traveling with a 2 yo, it's always nice to have a washer and dryer in the room. The pools were also very nice and kept at a comfortable temperature. We didn't eat onsite since there were so many restaurants close by in what we heard referred to as "restaurant row" along Sand Lake Rd, about a 5 minute drive from the resort. There were several grocery stores also within 5 minutes, and a nice Whole Foods (which is where we did our shopping) just a few minutes away. I would guess it's safe to say that we're sushi snobs, and we found a great sushi restaurant just off of Sand Lake, called Nagoya Sushi. They accommodated our daughter very well and the food tasted great and was very fresh. It also was a quick and easy drive for us to get to Downtown Disney, Hollywood Studios, and Magic Kingdom. The property does sit all by itself. Initially it was a little off-putting, but we ended up appreciating how quiet the area was and we had a nice open view from our balcony. Also as others have mentioned, you do hear noise from your neighbors. I couldn't hear talking or tv noise, but I could hear someone above us moving chairs around and walking with hard soled shoes. Part of the problem is the hardwood floors. After we noticed the noise, we just tried to be mindful of what we were doing in order not to bother the people below us - no big deal. We always travel with a white noise machine for our daughter, so in her room we couldn't hear anything. As I said, we did sit through the timeshare presentation. It wasn't anything terrible at all and took about 90 minutes. The sales person was friendly. He certainly did his job by trying to get us to buy. We are respectful of the fact that that's how he puts food on the table for his family, so we listened to what he had to tell us but then told him we weren't interested. He stayed friendly and there was no high pressure or rude behavior from anyone we encountered. I would stay at this property the next time we visit the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: Cathy P
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort though not quite finished. Rooms were spacious. Bathroom was beautiful, glass shower, soaking tub and glass sinks. Kitchen fully applianced and very convenient.Only issues we had were the market place store and restaurant iare too pricey, best to go to a restaurant and the local Publix, We ordered breakfast and dinner and I found the food very salty and the maid knocked on my door 3 different times in an hour to clean.Probably should have had the do not disturb sign on the door. .

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping, maintenance, security & sound issues.”
Reviews.Author: Gothiclion
Reviews.Content: I usually try not to write bad reviews, however, this last visit on 2/19 was absolutely the worst. We've stayed at this resort most every time we've visited Orlando in the past few years--about eight to ten nights a year--and only once did we not have any problems. Everything from not getting the room we reserved, housekeeping not having the room cleaned when we returned after 6 p.m., some of the linens for the sofa bed missing, our room not ready for check-in till well after 6 p.m., loud music at the pool and lax safety precautions. This past visit last weekend topped them all. For the first time, I reserved a studio room because it was only my husband and myself and I was using Hilton Honors points to pay for it. My only requests when I check-in is that I have a high floor away from the elevators. My choices were either ground floor or a room on the 14th floor. I chose the higher floor and found I was about 20 feet away from the elevators, but on an end where there wouldn't be much traffic. Since this was my main concern, I gave no thought to the ringing of the elevators. My first mistake. After entering the room, I found that the safe was locked and missing one of the numbers on the keypad. I wish that at that point I had asked for another room, but didn't want to take my chances on the ground floor room and the noise. When leaving the handicapped parking on the first floor of the garage that evening for dinner, we found that two cars were parked in a no-parking area that was reserved for maintenance and/or to also allow a car to back-up out of the handicapped parking spaces in this dead-end parking area. Luckily, we had earlier backed into our space and therefore, didn't have to drive in reverse to exit the parking garage. This isn't anywhere near the first time that security has allowed people to park in spaces where it wasn't allowed. Upon our return around 11 p.m., we pulled back the bedding to find a large depression in the center of the bed--a sinkhole of about 6 inches. I called the desk to notify them of the problem and was told that they would send maintenance up to check it out. Upon removing the mattresses from the bed, it was found that the center support for the bed was broken as well as two of the three lateral support beams. After attempting to jerry-rig the center support, the two maintenance men left to see what they could do about fixing or replacing the lateral support beams. After they left, we inspected what they had done and realized that as soon as we put any weight on the bed, that the center support would then give way and again, bend any support beams in place. I called the desk again and was told that there were no rooms available at all in the building we were in and that if we wanted another room, we would have to transfer to the other building on the property. I told her that was not satisfactory and would wait to see what the maintenance people would do. When they returned, we showed them that their "repair" would not work and they finally agreed. I could not believe that on this entire property that there wasn't another bed frame they could bring up to replace ours, but there wasn't. They ended up pulling out what was left of the base and we placed our mattresses on the floor. Since it was now well after midnight, I thought that we might now get some sleep but then again I was wrong. With the television off, one could easily hear the pinging of the elevators ALL NIGHT LONG! Although I usually check out via phone, this time I went to the desk and complained about all the problems we had. I was told "Sorry about that" and that was it. In summary, the grounds are pretty, the suites are large and spacious, and the room rates are usually pretty good for what you receive. However, when your room isn't ready at check-in time, it isn't the room you reserved, when you can't find a parking space in the evening in the garage for your building, your room isn't made up upon your return from a long day at the parks, you only have 4 bath towels in a 4-person suite, you don't have the proper bedding for the sofa-bed, the safe won't work, the bed is broken, and the loud elevator keeps you up all night, just to name a few of the ones I easily remember, NO ONE WILL CARE because they know you will be back because the grounds are pretty and the suites are large and spacious and the room rates are pretty good. Personally, I'm going to start checking out other hotels in the area because this one doesn't believe in keeping up the Hilton reputation of good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...too bad the timeshare ruins it all!”
Reviews.Author: soonerntexas
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club. We stayed here last year and really enjoyed it. We bought a "VIP" package to come back and stay here again instead of using our points. We did not want to buy anymore timeshares and told the sales lady this several times before we went in our trip. The day before we left, I was awoken at 7:45AM by a sales lady tellin me we should come to a tour and we would get all of these prizes. We ha plans and tickets for Daytona. I told her I would ask my husband when he got back. He did not want to go and we had no time. So, imagine my surprise when I was in Daytona and got a voicemail that if we did not go to a meeting we would be charged $500!!!! I called Amy back, and by the time Amy called me back, she said it was "too late" no more appts. we're available and she was charging us $500 (because we're owners!!!) This is how they treat their owners and guests!!! You pay them $20,000 + and they just want more and more!! This is working against them because we will now NEVER buy anything else from them!!! STAY AWAY from the timeshare/sales people and you will be ok! *** As a special bonus, upon checkout we were stuck in the elevator upon checkout. It's too new of a place to have mechanical issues already! I'm 39 and have never been trapped in an elevator before. It's very scary, my 6 year old is terrified of elevators now!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and fun - great water slide and pool”
Reviews.Author: 7seekers
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom/2 bath for 10 nights and felt incredibly spoiled. It still had the "new" feel and was very clean. HUGE rooms and plenty of storage for clothes. We could watch the Disney fireworks in the distance from our balcony. My son lived in the pool in the evening after the long Disney days and I relaxed in the jacuzzi. The staff would serve your meals/drinks by the side of the pool and the kids could watch movies at night poolside. This was a great location ... close to lots of amusement parks. We traveled last January (2011) to miss all the crowds in Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accommodations, but very isolated.”
Reviews.Author: morrisn
Reviews.Content: The accommodations at Parc Soleil are very nice bordering on extravagant. We stayed in a one bedroom suite overlooking a pond and an undeveloped area. From our room we could see the fireworks at Disney’s Magic Kingdom at night. The resort currently has two high-rise buildings, two pools, a bar/restaurant, and a small convenience store. There is also garage parking available. If you chose to stay here, be forewarned that there is nothing with-in walking distance of the resort. Once there, you are pretty isolated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for all parks!”
Reviews.Author: kgoley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a quick winter getaway to Orlando and stayed at the Parc Soleil. We just had a studio room (king bed/small table/kitchenette) which was fine for us. Later I saw one of the larger condo units and was very impressed and thought it would be the perfect place for a family - plenty of room to spread out and each bedroom had its own bath. The approach to the hotel is a little disconcerting - it's apparent that much more was being planned for this property but it hasn't been done yet. We were told later that when the economy crashed, Hilton decided to not add to this property but to purchase and upgrade others while the prices were good. However, you soon realize that this property really does have everything it needs, even if it looks barren as you approach. We were most impressed by the proximity to every park we visited - a few miles and a few quick turns and we were there! There is also a Super WalMart a few miles down the road for groceries. The pool area is very nice and though the menu in the main restaurant is very limited, the food was good. We visited on a weekend which was very quiet so I cannot speak to the crowds or noise level. Overall, if you're not staying in the parks (my first choice) then this is a great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Marrcham
Reviews.Content: This hotel could have been perfect except for one thing - soundproofing. It's been mentioned in other reviews. Other than that as we were fortunate to not have any noisy folks around us but if you do, I feel bad for you. The first thing I have to say that was my favorite thing was the ample counter space in the bathroom - yeah! Just came from 2 hotels where there wasn't any. Small kitchen area was a bonus and we used it for breakfast although we did go to their restaurant the first morning and it was very good and reasonably priced. Pools are very nice, ample loungers which were very comfortable and even being replaced while we were there. Service was excellent everywhere on the grounds that we went. Very nice place and would go here again. A word of warning, his is a time share type place where they are trying to sell you units but other than one caller who was persistent but polite, we weren't bothered again. I would recommend this hotel. At the current prices you're getting 5 star accommodations for very little.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!! Highly Recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: agelessteresa
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at Parc Soleil! Beautiful pools! The rooms are very luxurious.The staff are very warm and friendly.Wonderful location!

Reviews.Title: “We love Parc Soleil!”
Reviews.Author: MCO_Addict
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Orlando we decided it didn't matter where we stayed, we figured we'd be out all day and only needed somewhere to sleep so we booked ourselves into a less expensive hotel and set off on our vacation. We were wrong. It matters. After a couple nights in the cheap place we were knocking at the door at Parc Soleil begging them to find us a room. Luckily they fit us in and we were able to enjoy the rest of our vacation in our cute little studio with a super comfy bed and convenient kitchenette. We had a great time laying by the pool and playing tennis and returned to our clean and well maintained room each evening to relax. We both agreed, saving a couple bucks in a cheap hotel is just not worth it. Next time we'll call Parc Soleil first and enjoy our vacation from the first day. Oh but could you turn up the heat on the pool a bit please? It can be a little chilly and that is the only downfall to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Quick trip”
Reviews.Author: citygirlky
Reviews.Content: This trip was a quick one. The hotel made it to be a nice trip. Check in was easy and uneventful. The rooms were clean and aesthically pleasing. The restaurant was good and the pools are beautiful. The only true complaint I have is that I was not able to get cell service in my room. I had to go stand in the courtyard. Overall the experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, but not a great place for families.”
Reviews.Author: sltex38
Reviews.Content: Walk in pool with water slide was wonderful, we loved it. The employees were all excellent, the service was great. The room was nice, but not well designed. We had to figure out how to fit a crib and extra cot into the room, which we did, but despite a two bedroom there was only place sittings for 4, did not work out all that well. No work station for my computer, had to scoot a chair over to the coffee table. Generally they have a nice work desk with a computer chair, but not here. Lots of old people here (like me) which was fine, but many seemed to be snow birds and were not very happy at having kids around. I would suggest families consider either HGVC Seaworld or International Drive, much better for kids. Also this place is all alone, no stores, gas stations or restaurants. It is Orlando so there are things close, but this is the ONLY building standing in a huge open field, the economy kind of messed this one up. Finally, the rooms are clean, the staff is nice, the pool is the best of all of them, if you are a couple or all adults, stay here (you can see the fireworks).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you need to just getaway from everything....”
Reviews.Author: CKH4221
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, the only downside is the location. I would prefer to stay at the Tuscany , you can walk to the outlet stores and grocery store. The pool was great, nice 1/2 mile walking path, great fitness center. The food in the poolside bistro/ bar was decent, the wait staff was friendly. However the market/deli was extremely overpriced. The suite was nicely decorated and very clean. The only complaint I had was we were a late check in and the pull out bed was not made up, it made for a very late night for our 7 year old getting to bed. Overall it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice features but not aging well”
Reviews.Author: AcuraTl10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Parc Soleil Hilton Grand Vacations Club twice. Once two years ago when nearly new, and the second visit just last week. I have a family of four, with two kids age 5. First, the staff is superb in the lobby, in the pool area, and in most places around the hotel. It is hard to beat their level of service and I would equate it to a top tier resort. The pool area with its two pools and five saunas is well maintained and kept up. The one water slide is very fast - so fast it scared my five two year old daughters. Great slide, but young kids can be frightened by it. The playground next door is also a great facility, as my girls loved it with the well padded astro-turf. They may trip and fall down, but when they are ready to cry, they realize, "Hey, that did not hurt!" The elevators in the buildings are quick and efficent. The hallways are nice as is the lobby. The rooms are another story. The furninture we noticed after our first visit was a little beat up. After the second visit, much more beat up. It is nice but not holding up well. In addition, the cleaning staff has been cut back on (probably because the time shares are not selling well - more on that in a second). So cleaning for a seven day stay is only one day. The other six days they will make the beds and change the towels if you ask. The problem is the kitchen. We came and it was barely clean. The dish drainer by the sick was absolutely fility. It took two calls for someone to come up, look at it, and tell us they would bring up a new one. The new one the drainer was clean, the silverware pocket had food in it! We gave up. Dishes and silverware were in the main tray to dry. It is unfortunate as the rooms have some nice touches. Televisions in every room, in the one bedroom unit, you get a tub with a faucet in the ceiling as well as a separate shower. In the studio, you get a standard hotel room but with the high end tile that comes in the one bedroom, losing the bathtub and one of the two sinks. The one bedroom has a full kitchen. You can make anything you want in it and in addition, they have grills outside you can use. We used them one time buying the charcoal at Winn Dixie for $3 (or you can buy it from Hilton at the nice store they have on site for $7). You call up the staff and they put out the charcoal when you are done so you don't start a fire. Again, the excellent service. We got the sales pitch both times to buy a time share. However, for the high prices to sign up and then the maintenance fee every year you pay for about $1000 or more, it does not make sense finanically no matter how you cut it. Right now, I can go online to hilton.com and use it like a hotel now since they cannot sell the units. The one bedrooms are for about $200 a night, the studios a litlte more than $100 - or a standard hotel rate. So I can stay in that hotel in a one bedroom for 5 nights for $1000 - or about the maintenance fee for a week per year if I purchase the time share - not counting that $10,000-$20,000 I have to pay up front. To save two days on a on bedroom hotel room per year, or $400, it is going to take me a very long time to make up those thousands I put down up front. They try to sell you on the "guaranteed vacation for life," but basically you are locked into Hilton or their partner properties, and the payoff can take as long as 50 years. So you never break even on this "vacation investment." Your kids might beneift if you bequeth it to them,but then they are saddled with the annual fees. So for a short visit and if you can deal with the declining quality of the rooms, everything is great. For a long term investment, stay far away.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay”
Reviews.Author: Gracie99uk
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed at the Parc Soleil (April '10 and May '11 previously). Yet again we booked the 1 bedroom suite accommodation and were very pleased with our choice. The room is a really good size ... so spacious that when we return home the first couple of days our house seems really small :) We had a problem with the hot water (none in the shower) and called guest services. They sent a repair man immediately and the problem was fixed within half an hour. We were also given "Sorry for the Whoops" cards offering each of us a free frozen yogurt which I thought was a nice touch. Towards the end of our holiday we needed the toaster replacing and once again service was impeccable ... a new toaster straight from its box delivered literally within minutes of the request being made. Housekeeping was generally good but one day they did forget to empty the bin under the kitchen sink. The pool area is great although I still maintain (see my first review) that the pool enterainment is too loud. There is no escaping the noise from it (can't use the adult only pool with a 20 month old) which can be annoying ... even more so in the evening when I believe it must have been a karaoke night judging from the extremely BAD singing floating through the air. Despite this annoyance I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel especially for families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Ana paula E
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 days last january....its a big hotel...very good units....big, nice and new!!! Our 1 bedroom apartment was excellent for me and my 3 kids.... It was a very nice experience....its close to everything!! Nice heated pool...good food at the restaurant....

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: WWJD?LOVE
Reviews.Content: I am back at The Parc and again could not be happier. The value and service and ammenities cannot be beat! Nicole from housekeeping is more like a friend that wants you to enjoy her hospitality! Love it Here! The Kid Zone crew is the BEST!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls but nice place”
Reviews.Author: BeachHunter_8
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a month in America where i stayed here 4 nights, on arrival we were met by security whom let us in and we drove to recpetion where the check in was super easy and very polite and we were give a map of how to park and where our room was. On entering our room it appeared clean with plenty of space, the bathroom was huge but no bath only a shower but it worked well so no problems. The bed was nice and comfortable but there was no real wardrobe space so we lived out of the suitcases mostly. The air conditioning was so noisey we just turned it off. Overall the room was fine but as the aircon was so bad we turned it off and turned on the fan on the celing and WOW we were covered in white dust and fluff, it seemed to come from the top of thefan and under the bed when the fan was blowing but of course we turned it off asap. What i did find that over the 4 days i had a dreadful sore throat which i thing was caused by this dust. Hopefully they will clean fans in the future. Ignoring the dust the biggest problem is the walls were just not sound proofed, i knew what people were discussing in any room to the side or above/below and toilet or shower was so easy to be heard, infact we would be woken by direct neighbours flushing. My wife was in the bathroom on one occasion and she accidently had a conversation with the neighbour through the wall thinking she was talking to me through the door, i was in hysterics as i could hear both from the bed :) but seriously the sound proofing was a big issue. Moving outside the room the lifts were good and normally no waiting. Outside there were 2 big pools and 2 hot tubs that I think were open until 11pm which was nice. There was also a restraunt we used where the prices were very good and the staff were so polite the only downside is the food was so so slow to come on the first night but on two other nights it speeded up a bit but still slow. If it was just on staff this should be 5 out of 5 but the room noise and serious dust issue was not good.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joel K
Reviews.Content: The facility is beautiful; the lobby is luxurious & check-in was easy. The staff was friendly & knowledgeable. We spent 3 days in a luxurious 1 bedroom suite & never left the property. The food, service & aumbiance in the restaurant was superb. There were numberous activities for children & adults.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of both Worlds”
Reviews.Author: hll333
Reviews.Content: Orlando is known for its theme parks, and they certainly are great places to visit, but it is also great to have some time away from Mickey, Harry Potter and Shamu. Parc Soleil is a remarkable hotel, so peaceful, quiet, and with every service and amenity you could want. It is only a few minutes from any fo the three big attractions, Disney, Universal, and Sea World. you can enjoy your days at the parks and then are able to "go home" to this fantastic place, relax, and refresh for the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms - inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: VanVlietTraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great The pool looks great for kids. Not much else to do onsite. It is a drive to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Douglas Did It”
Reviews.Author: tommyl024
Reviews.Content: What a way to start a mini trip but to stop at the pool bar restaurant on a non-pool Florida day and have Doug the waiter provide excellent Cosmos, Dewars and soda, Bloody Mary's, great food suggestions, and wonderful dialogue about the Hilton's newest property the Parc Soleil. Although the grounds were beautiful and extremely clean,disappointed with the Health Club. The acvtivity room for the kids provided some adult opportunities, but mostly geared to the younger set. Great place to run , walk, or read around the lake. Service was good and the staff generally knowledgeable except for the front desk glitch of not having our pre arranged requests even though I had an e-mail showing acknowledgement of these. If the weather permits, look forward to an enjoyable vacation swimming in the nicely appointed pools.

Reviews.Title: “There's a difference between the hotel and the vacation club”
Reviews.Author: SteveSto
Reviews.Content: All the elements are there just like a hotel and the staff is very friendly, and there are lots of positives and a few not so. There are some things that seem just not quite the same as staying in a Hilton Hotel. The quality of construction seems a little less, the finishes are a little less, the amenities are not as complete. Now, I am a frequent traveler and used to getting upgrades and perks, so I may not be the best judge of this. I have never stayed in a vacation club before. Positives: food in the restaurant is very good. Rooms are spacious. Pool area is excellent. Good activity center. Location is pretty good. There's 1 tennis court. Maybe there should be 2. Property is very clean and well-maintained. Studio room had microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker (but no sweeteners and it took 4 calls and 30 minutes to get some). Learned about their time share system - not what I expected and if I didn't travel so much already, could be very interesting. Bottom line: worth a stay and consideration for their vacation club.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for adults & kids without the "Disney" effect”
Reviews.Author: melnatl
Reviews.Content: I will give the "Toastmaster" review of this location. I will start with the good. Areas where they can improve then another good. First "good": This is hands down this is a beautiful resort. You receive a good impression when you first drive up. It's gated which is great. There is a beautiful circular drive way. Well appointed lobby as they say! This is far away from the Disney part of Orlando where you will not see glaring lights or Mickey and Minnie all over the place. You truly get a resort "feel" when you stay here. Areas where they can improve: The place where their restaurant is located does not have doors too keep cool air out. There are two doors on the side. In the summer time,this will be appreciated. For January and probably February, it's a bit chilly and you will need a jacket or a heavy wrap to wear if you decide to eat dinner there. Somehow our food stayed warm but I wish they had designed doors. What they do have are those "garage door" type enclosements. If they pull them down then it would give the appearance of the place being closed. The food choices though are pretty good and reasonable for a resort of this caliber. You will find the staff at this eatery to be cheerful (even if they appear to feel the cold too...they just smile through it) and also very knowledgeable of the dishes being served and the wine list. Another good: Yes you may be invited to sit through a sales presentation but you might not be sorry if you did. My husband and I want with our pre-planned game faces on of "no matter what they show us...we are not buying". We sucked! We bought. We were overwhelmed by their well appointed one bedroom and two bedroom options. We found out we were staying in their efficiency which is actually a third bedroom. Each bedroom has a bathroom so no awkward sharing. This is a great option for parents or families that travel with in-laws or friends. If you have kids (especially) girls who cannot stand sharing bathrooms or bedrooms, you will be the best parents ever if you get the bedroom. Speaking of kids, yes they do run around. This resort does provide an adult swim area and hot spa pool. You can let the little ones swim or if they are doing another activity on the premises you can enjoy the adult pool. They also have a fabulous workout facility with enough treadmills for all. There is also a private jogging path. No worries of dodging cars or running in an unfamiliar area. It's well lit at nite but as a female I still would not do it alone. You may now want to buy but talk to Felix. He is as "unsaleman" as they come. Nice guy and not pushy. I've sat through some of these previously and for some reason this was not a horrendous experience. If you have grandchildren but don't want to stay on a Disney property then I would recommend this place. It's great if you know you will be bringing the kids or grandkids for a while to the Orlando area. When you add the cost of a regular hotel vs. this place plus all the space you will get...it's worth sitting through the presentation. BTW-their kitchens are great so you can really save on food. Try it you won't be sorry annnnnnnd you can take points from this place and put into your Hilton Honors account so you won't lose them!

Reviews.Title: “Resort in itself!”
Reviews.Author: EssexSeasider
Reviews.Content: Firstly, nice hotel but AVOID the sales people. You will be asked to join the Hilton Grand Vacations club. You waste 2 hours of your day and they became quite aggressive when you don't buy. To be fair we chose to go to the talk as we wanted cheap park tickets! The hotel is so big took awhile to find our room! The restaurant is fairly priced and the facilities are good. The rooms are self catering so we went to the nearby Walmart to stock up! You do have to drive or get a taxi if you want to leave the hotel to go anywhere as it is not near enough the attractions to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are great!!! (beware of the hard sell!)”
Reviews.Author: RoamingGnomette
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property several times and enjoy the physical room/suite. The facilities are nice, however parking can be interesting sometimes. Beware of the hard sell that begins at check-in! Never think that ANYONE is going to give you anything for free (or even at a great savings) without asking something of you in return. Just a heads up! Eventho the surounding area is not the most picturesque, the grounds are beautiful (i.e. pool, lobby area, walking area around pond) and, if you are on the correct side, the Disney fireworks are awesome!

Reviews.Title: “PEACEFUL, RELAXING, EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Heisler49
Reviews.Content: Moved here from Homewood Suites for final night in Orlando due to road noise at Homewood. Reception could not have been more helpful in arranging a quiet balcony room with view of Disney foreworks at night. Thank you Randy. Had a one bedroom unit with full kitchen, living room and one bathroom. Unit was very spacious, comfortable & well appointed. The Parc is about 3 years old & so everything is still fresh. Has a very handy 'deli' on site. Free on site parking, garage or parking lot. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Accomodations and Staff”
Reviews.Author: archdent
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at Parc Soleil (we are HGVC owners with home resort at Sea World Int'l Center) over Christmas/New Year holiday 2011. We wanted to try out this resort, since we had previous stayed at all of the other HGVC resorts in Orlando. We were pleasantly surprised with this property. We asked for a fireworks view and got a unit in the 2nd building where we were able to watch the fireworks from Epcot and Magic Kingdom every night. Since we were there through New Year's we got an additional full night of fireworks in every direction. The amenities at this resort are wonderful. My kids have grown up in HGVC are are familiar with the activities centers, but this one is set up for maximum entertainment. The gym is state of the art and is open 24/7. There is a great view from the gym of the pool area. They provide headphones to listen to the televisions which are embedded in the equipment. There are Pilates balls and free weights as well. Our unit was on the 6th floor and did overlook the parking garage if you looked downward. This is only a problem if you are on the balcony a lot and you hear some noise from people getting out of their cars and such. I can see it possibly being a problem from lower floors. The restaurant and bar area were good. We ate a fixed price menu for Christmas Day and it was excellent. We only had one little snag with housekeeping (they didn't clean our room when they were supposed to), but when we brought it to their attention they came up right away and did a tidy-up. Came the next day and did a complete cleaning plus they sent a basket from the marketplace with cheese, crackers, water, tea, fruit, etc. and an "I'm sorry" card signed by the entire staff. The activities crew here is a real stand out. We only went to the parks one day, so we spent most of the time relaxing at the resort. Christopher, Jonathan, Ryan, Xavier and the entire activities crew are just really fun to be around. They really enjoy their jobs. The four of us stayed 8 days in a one bedroom (kids slept on the fold out couch). The fold out couch was very comfortable and the master bed is super comfortable. The kitchen is state of the art and there is a Publix just under the I-4 on Central Florida Parkway, past Sea World. We were able to combine our points with open season and stay 8 wonderful days at this resort. I did not want to go home. The only bad thing about this place is that it is going to get further developed and the new buildings are probably going to block the views and the public areas will be more crowded. But, at the present time it is one of the most wonderful properties that we have visited (and we have been to quite a few). This is the total package...clean, new and excellent staff and accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “A Disney Visit w/the Grandkids”
Reviews.Author: anglerted
Reviews.Content: The timeshare (points) units were well appointed and comfrotable. We stayed in a spacious 2 bedroom unit with 4 adults and 2 kids. Plenty of room. The amenities were ample with a great pool area. The location and landscaping left much to be desired. The food and drink are way overpriced. The sales pitch was low key. If you can get in this may be a good alternative to an expensive Hotel room suite.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: lemonandmint
Reviews.Content: Our trip was after Christmas, departing on December 31st. Parc Soleil is a beautiful property. We didn't get to enjoy the the facilities because our trip was all about the theme parks from morning to late evening. But, we did have a light supper in the poolside cafe-great burgers and soup. Pool area was beautiful and even though the temperatures were a bit cool, there were people using it. It appears that they have/or had big plans for more buildings-perhaps the speed in which those will be build have been pulled back somewhat until the economy picks up. The Parc Soleil seems to be all by itself on a stretch of road that has newer buildings, but is not withing walking distance of anything, so keep that in mind if you do not have transportation. I felt that it's location is conveniently located in between Disney and Universal. The suites were nicely furnished, the king size sofa which could be pulled out to make a large sized pull out bed didn't have fully fitted bedding, but we were able to make do. Our unit looked over the pool and the evening view is beautiful. My husband used the exercise room and equipment and had no complaints. The on-premise store has items you may need to help you get by until you make your trip to the store. The location is perfect. I would suggest going to Whole Foods for your main groceries and they have healthy great meals on the go--and it's a very short ride up the street towards Universal Studios Parks. We hope to return again some day.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Orchids
Reviews.Content: Overall we found our unit to be spacious and high quality. Pool and waterslide were great. Bonus was that we asked for a high floor with Disney view and we could watch the fireworks every night at both Epcot and Magic Kingdom (in a distance) from our balcony. Only downside was that it is a little away from stores/restaurants – but they have one of each in the building that was convenient; and you need to drive anyway to get to something from other hotels anyway as well. Regarding service, they took the initiative to call us a couple of time within the frist day or so to ask if eveything was ok / we wanted something. We asked for a few small additional supplies and they never sent them. We didnt ask again either. The other annoyance was that the conceirge was calling every other day to get us to come to their timeshare sales talk.

Reviews.Title: “This place is GREAT”
Reviews.Author: oasis_26
Reviews.Content: I don't know what people complain about, this place is awesome. My family has been here three times and we LOVE this place. It is close to the Disney parks, the pool is great, the rooms are clean and the staff is fun. We really enjoy this place and our kids do to. We will be back again and again and again. Yes they don't clean your room every day but they tell you that. And quite frankly I don't want my room cleaned everyday. I asked for clean towels everyday and they were prompt in making that happen.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place Ever!”
Reviews.Author: LINDA K
Reviews.Content: Loved the property and I am the pickiest person ever, we stayed in the one bedroom suite. It was a large beautiful room. In the evening we could see the fire works going off at Ebcot and Disney. Pool is huge with a great slide for kids and there were plenty of activities going on. We had a problem with our sink and someone was there in five minutes to tend to it. We have stayed at Hardrock, Wyndham, and the Portofino and we liked this property much better. Can't wait to come back. Restaurant is also wonderful and prices are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel in Great Orlando Location”
Reviews.Author: bkgs1015
Reviews.Content: Our stay started a little shaky, as our GPS could not find the hotel's address. We called the desk for assistance and found it easily from that point. "Desforges" is not likely to be listed on your GPS if you have not updated your maps recently... The location of the property is quite good for day trips to Disney, Sea World or Universal and is quite close to I5 (and unfortunately the Orlando Premium Outlets). It appears to be in a as of yet undeveloped pocket along I5, and only two of the six towers have been built to date. We had booked our trip through the Hilton Honors service line, and knew that we were accepting a discounted rate as long as we attended a two-hour timeshare sales session late in the week. We were not bothered at all during the week and the session itself was professional and comfortable - but not terribly succinct. Our one-bedroom suite was wonderful. We used the kitchen daily to prepare breakfast and lunch, packing our lunch for consumption at the Disney parks. We did eat dinner one night and breakfast on our last morning onsite, and found the food to be very reasonably priced and quite good. Connected to the restaurant was a convenient little store, complete with a coffee and wine shop. The main pool, located adjacent to tower #2, was wonderful. Our toddler loved the zero-entry pool and fountains. There was also a very nice playground located next to the pool - and we biked and walked along the long path around the lake one morning. The towers do indeed have parking ramps below them - a great convenience, as long as you don't drive a large SUV or arrive back at the hotel quite late. One night, we tried to re-enter the tower, trying three different locked entrances before walking through the parking garage to enter. A very minor annoyance indeed, but clearly our security was taken seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Parc Soleil - not a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Elsterz
Reviews.Content: I go to Florida every couple of years for the parks and to shop etc . This time we thought we'd try our luck at Parc Soleil instead of staying at the Grand Vacations Club On International drive (Tuscany) - big mistake. We had a studio for 3 days then a penthouse 1 bed for 3 days over New Years. The Studio was really noisy, could hear every word from the neighbours, the accommodation, whilst clean wasnt anywhere near as spacious as at International Drive, fridge even smaller(if that were possible). The one bedroom was great, complete contrast (we had a view out the back and it was quiet) The problem for me is the location - yeah its close to Disney but not close to anything else and its just doesnt have a warm friendly atmosphere to it as Tuscany does.
