The food is better, the shop and the restaurant but the pool looks dated, if you have a view over the flat roof and across onto the pool, it looks awful. The water slide now looks very dated and overall I think for a property just a few years old it is already starting to look tired. The build quality (noise) and the internal fittings are just not u to scratch I think. I wont be going there again - ever.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Back”
Reviews.Author: jlk427
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time back to Parc Soleil. This time we stayed in a 1 bedroom. We have 2 small boys (4 & 8) and this was plenty of room for us. The 2 bedroom was overkill for us in 2010. We stayed over Halloween and the hotel put on a very cute Halloween party where all the different depts. decorated a cabana in a contest. They also had trick or treating around the hotel which was really cute as well. I still think this property is your best bang for your buck if going to Disney. The rooms are HUGE and having the laundry and full kitchen is fantastic. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great vacation place...”
Reviews.Author: cagendalia
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again and I am a HiltonHonors member who loves Hilton hotels. They invited me to stay there to see the place. They put me in a 'basement' room...not a smart move if you want someone to purchase a timeshare there! The Internet was down more than it was up! I had to get up and STAND in front of the TV to use the remote control, which defeats the purpose. They gave me a handicap bathroom. No view... When I attended the 70 minute sales pitch that wound up taking 2 1/2 hours, the nice salesman became downright nasty when he discovered that I was not interested in purchasing. What a joke! They offered nothing to me but inferior service and accommodations. Why would I purchase that?

Reviews.Title: “Not our best stay”
Reviews.Author: ef2001
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times without issues. However, this past week, their Internet was down for three days and we did not have hot water in our room the entire stay. They didn't send anyone to repair it until our last day and it was never properly fixed. They did offer compensation although hot water would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely vacation spot near Disney”
Reviews.Author: traelee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Parc Soleil with our 2 youngest children. We were very happy with the property overall. Everything from an elegant lobby check in to the efficient elevators made our trip hassle free. Our room was on the top floor (15th) that is accessible only with your room card. I'm not sure what the penthouse level offers over the other floors, but the view was pretty spectacular. We were able to spend time on our balcony relaxing and overlooking the pool areas. At night we had a view of the fireworks at Sea World. I believe rooms on the otherside of our tower had views of the Disney area's fireworks. We had a 2 bedroom suite. The second room is separated by double doors that lock, so we had to keep them propped open with chairs (our children are under 3). Everything in the room was fuctional. The kids loved the novelty of the water coming down from the ceiling to fill the tub (there is only a tub in the master bath with a separate walk in shower). The kitchen had all the tools we could need and then some. The internet was fast and easy to use without an extra fee. There was an abundance of pillows everywhere which was comfortable. The beds were comfy, but the mattresses were definitely worn. Overall, it was spacious enough to truly live in. The only down side was that many of the finishes were showing wear and tear already. Housekeeping was sufficient, but they could do a more thorough job. We were never given new sheets, which was disappointing. Otherwise, it's nice to have daily service since other time share properties either don't do housekeeping or charge you a fee. There are 2 pool areas. The main pool has a water slide and is very child friendly. Like a beach, you walk right into the first inches of water and it very slowly gets deeper. There are plenty of small fountains for the kids to splash in. It's large enough that adults can lounge off to the sides peacefully. The secondary pool was usually empty during our early December visit. It was heated and overlooked a walking area with a LED color changing fountain. There is also a semi-covered playground and at least 3 large spas. Throughout the day there are fun activities like a not-so-newlywed game, a DJ, poolside bingo/trivia, etc. The indoor recreation area was also nice. A children's area was full of toys, things to color, and play with. It was quiet and relaxing. There are scheduled activities, but we were always alone in the room when visiting. There is also a teen lounge with Wii and other video games as well as a workout area. Having a restaurant and convenience store with a sandwich/coffee counter was quite nice. The prices weren't outrageous on most items, so we were happy to stay on property to buy items like milk, syrup, and treats. Service was always friendly. The restaurant food was average, but it was nice to sit right next to the pool and lunch. I was happy that there were a few vegetarian choices. The only major hiccup to the whole trip was having to attend a second time share presentation. We had gone to one a few months earlier and were sold their VIP package to try out the properties after turning down the offer to be an 'owner'. We were obligated to attend a second presentation during this trip. We were treated nicely, but it was still uncomfortable having to refuse the purchase. Luckily, after we did get out of the meeting, they never bothered us again during our visit, which I appreciated. The covered parking garage was a great addition. There is also gated access to the property that you can access with either your room key or opened by the gate guard. There is a lot of attention to detail at the Parc Soleil and I'd happily return during out next Orlando vacation. The location is quite central and you're only a few minutes to Disney or Sea World while feeling somewhat isolated from other hotels. This is one Hilton property that is a class act without being pretentious and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: RhondaC.
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the perks of a 4-star resort, and the largest suites I have ever seen! We took our 16-year-old son and one of his friends and they loved the resort. Our suite had an amazing bathroom in the master suite; a full kitchen, plus a mini kitchen in the other bedroom, perfect for the boys. The bar food at the pool was better than most. My ONLY COMPLAINT is the location, in that it is not on the main strip and you must use your car for all excursions. The i-ride trolley doesn't come near the resort. However, it is by far the best Hilton in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “New. Clean. Modern. Great for small kids.”
Reviews.Author: mpolatin
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there last week over xmas with 2 small kids and the grandparents. We had stayed at the Sea World property before and there is no comparison. This is much, much nicer. Newer and cleaner. We booked a 1 bedroom suite for 4 adults and 2 small kids. It was a little tight, but a beautiful room with a great kitchen and a very nice bathroom. As all 2-bedrooms were taken, we added a studio to make it larger-- and give the grandparents a little extra room. The pool area is fantastic with a water slide and a beach-like sloping entrance into the pool, which the kids love. There is also a great market there that sells everything you might need. The one kind of downside is that it is located in the middle of a vacant field -- the location itself is not terrible, as it is a quick 7 min drive to downtown disney, but when you pull up to the hotel you feel as if you are in the middle of nowhere. The staff was very helpful and nice. And the place looks and feels brand new and is very, very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: hopekayla
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch. It runs on this trolly line so for a few bucks you can get a 3day pass and go to shopping, restaurants, down town Orlando...The pool looks amazing and there is 3 or maybe 4 got tubs. The room had a fridge and a microwave, which was nice because we utilized them! Most people at the hotel owned a timeshare there and really seemed to enjoy coming back yr after yr. We met some really nice couples, but overall it was very quiet. It is the perfect location close enough to everything, but far enough away to enjoy some peace and quiet. This hotel is walking distance from a great outlet mall. We also went to Orlando, Sea World, and Discovery Cove (to swim with the dolphins) this was our favorite part!! It was just awesome! I don't have one complaint about this hotel, staff was super friendly and we would love to come back and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteKD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc Soleil for three nights before leaving for Naples, Florida for the rest of our vacation and we were very impressed! We are a family of four and would have liked a two bedroom, but because they were all booked, we got the one bedroom unit. This unit was large enough for us to enjoy our stay. The room was new, clean, spacious and modern. The pool was large, clean and warm. I loved that the restaurant overlooked the walk-in pool and park-- perfect for parents that want to lounge while the kids play. The food and service were both good. I really think this place was great for families. The only downfall is that it was driving distance to other restaurants, stores and entertainment. On that note, the driving distance was only minutes. When we called room service for extra blankets, they were at our door in seconds. I worked out at the gym and it was clean with lots of equipment. There was also a running track and sports courts. We were pleased with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Omer22
Reviews.Content: We travelled here in the second week of december with our two kids, 4 and 1. It's a beautiful property and is very well maintained. We had a one bedroom suite since two bedrooms were not available. The room was not ready when arrived at 12pm. We had to wait until 3:30pm to check in. We were tired and the kids had fallen sick the day before so we were glad to check in. We hadn't even settled in and the phone rang with the time share pitch. I really didn't appreciate this pushy approach. I explained to the man that we had just walked in the room and he kept on pushing and pushing. I eventually got rid of him and was very upset. The next morning we got another sales called following up on the last. I had to be firm and ask them not to call back. After this incident, the rest of the stay was very pleasant. The one bedroom suite had a king size sofa bed, full kitchen, laundry, bathtub and shower. The kitchen was fully equipped with dishes, pots, pans and cleaning supply. They were two tvs, one in the bedroom and one in the living room. They only problem was lack of storage space. Only one small closet to put all our stuff in along with two small side table dressers. There were no storage in the washroom. We had housekeeping visit every day which was great since the welcome pamphlet had said it would be once in 4 days. The walls are thin but we were lucky, we didn't have anyone next to us and got the corner unit. The grounds were very well kept. Two hot tubs along with two pools and water slides. There was a really nice recreational centre with pool table, ping pong table, Wii and PS3. Another room with younger kids toys where they had their craft activities. They had recreational activities happening all day but we didn't get a chance to go. The Mart downstairs with the Starbucks in wonderful. It had all the staple items available and such yummy desserts. This is a wonderful property, we would highly recommend. We will visit again, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: stacybbb
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 BR for 4 nights. Very nice! Stay with a pool view on a floor higher than 6 so you can enjoy the view. The pool and amenities are lovely. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hilton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ckali3002
Reviews.Content: The Parc Soleil is a 5 star hilton hotel in our opinion. We like to be spoiled on our vacations and the rooms here are impecable. We've stayed in a 2 bedroom suite 2 times and it's fantastic. Kitchen, washer & dryers in the rooms are wonderful for families. The location is great, very close to everything. We normally come in December when the weather is unpredictable in Orlando Florida, but the pool is always heated and has a great water slide in case we want to skip the parks for the day. Overall I greatly recommend this hotel for families that like to enjoy the Orlando parks and some downtime in the hotel itself. We plan to come back annually in December.

Reviews.Title: “3nts in Orlando near disney”
Reviews.Author: Bcr8tve
Reviews.Content: The property is so new, it's not on GPS so the hotel gives you address of nearby hotel. It's convenient to Disney, shopping, restaurants etc.. Weird parking..decks only and then travel via elevator. Lobby is not impressive. The restaurant has a good menu and really nice ambience. However, there are so many restaurants nearby that i only ate breakfast at the hotel. My room was gorgeous - a one bedroom king with kitchen, large bath, living area, balcony and nice view over pool. Lots of space for just one person but i liked the extra square footage just to lounge around in. I didn't take advantage of the fitness center or nature hiking trail but would do so next time. Nice secure property. I did call engineering to fix the tub fixtures - they were just spinning around so the night i arrived i couldn't soak in the tub. The next day within an hour of making the call, engineering arrived to resolve the issue. Note: Concierge desk lacks experience and there seem to be several kinks still to be worked out at this fairly new property. You definately need a car to stay at this property and traffic is a bit of a nuisance at the main intersection - sometimes long waits as the road where the property is located has several mid-range huge hotels - all the national chains.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path but well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: chuckq
Reviews.Content: We always try to stay at Hilton hotels when we travel. This was a newer site so we gave it try. We rented a 1 bedroom suite that overlooked the pool. It was clean, large, and filled with comfortable furniture. A full kitchen and a large balcony, and an amazing bathroom made the stay even more relaxing. The staff was friendly and very accomidating.

Reviews.Title: “long weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Occidental2urist
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Parc Soleil. Stayed 5 days 4 nites in a Studio unit in bldg 200. Room was large and had a small kitchenette. Bed was comfortable. The AC was very loud and the walls thin. could hear toilets flushing in adjacent rooms. View of empty lot and future construction not very nice. Staff was nice and helpful, Pool was nice. We did not rent a car and you are very isolated there. can't walk anywhere. Wish we had stopped at Publix on the way in for some supplies. Took the shuttle they offer ($9.00 roundtrip) to the parks, worked out well. Came on a timeshare promotion. The presentation took 3 hours. The on site restaurant was good. That was good because we had no choice but to eat there. Service not so great. All in all had a pleasant trip.

Reviews.Title: “Some parts okay, others not so good, oh and there is an odor”
Reviews.Author: RedBuddah
Reviews.Content: First, don't get me wrong, it is a pretty place but the location is extremely isolated and probably not somewhere you'd want to spend all your time and it is a long haul to anything else. We were in building #2 and faced away from the pool. From our window we had distant views of EPCOT fireworks at night but not much else except what looked to be a war zone where they may be planning to expand the property. The outdoor pool area is large with a fun water slide that we all enjoyed. Plenty of lounge chairs both in shade and sun. Convenient restrooms also in the pool area. The on-property restaurant was good and not terribly over priced. Our room size was spacious and included a nice table with two comfortable chairs that could be used for eating or business. No desk. The bathroom is also very large with a glass-enclosed shower (no tub). Good brand of shampoos, soaps and lotions. If you are staying less than 7 nights there is no daily maid service unless you pay an additional $20 per day for a 'tidy'. It is kind of a pain to call and ask for towels and supplies every day plus you need to make your bed too unless you don't mind looking at the mess but this is your main seating area. The biggest problem we had was the powerful odor present in our room that did not dissipate during our 5-night stay. Two floor managers checked it out and said it is just the smell of the cleaners they use and because we didn't have a window that opened there was nothing they could (or were willing) to do about it. We kept the bathroom ventilation fan running 24/7 and the ceiling fan but it really didn't help. The chemical smell was so strong that I had a headache during the entire stay and didn't get a good night sleep. Everyone of our friends who visited our room commented on the bad smell. The little efficiency kitchen is pretty sad. Fridge was tiny, the microwave stuck out of the cabinet over the sink and made it pretty impossible to use the sink. All-in-all not a very well designed area. I did like the 'wood' flooring instead of carpeting in this room. Plenty of outlets for charing all of your devices including an ipod charging alarm clock. The window area is very small for the room. Parking structure is very poorly designed with very tight spaces. It is almost impossible to pull into the spots on the first try and forget about you or your passengers being able to exit once you pull in. You have to hunt for luggage trollies on different floors so we didn't get off to a good start plus our room keys did not work which meant another long haul back down to the front desk. I'll never stay here or at another Hilton Vacation Club again. Very aloof, impersonal and uncaring staff. With all of the poor design choices it felt like just too much work to stay here plus you have to pay for the priveldge. Very disappointed, cannot recommend.

Reviews.Title: “timeshare sales”
Reviews.Author: chris g
Reviews.Content: to everyone writing a review. the reason they don't want you to think about it is because, when you get home you start to forget about what the ownership does for you and just toss the information in the garbage. if you owned the company would you want your sales reps selling today or hopefully having you coming back with the future (about 1% ever coming back and buy) they spend about $500 to get you infront of a rep, understand why it is today. if you were a gambler would you like 1% odd of winning the game?you should of learned everything it does with your rep and being adults and intelligent people should know if it's for your family and a good deal or not. your one of 10,000 tours a year so, if you don't like it-next! the people that buy that day get the best deals because they know if you leave , you won't be coming back. i have been in the business for 2 years and have never seen anyone come back. please don't take the review the wrong way, i just want to explain it to everyone. i have had 275 people buy and only 5 cancel. some people don't see the value others do. it's not for everyone. remember your not saying no to the rep, your saying no to your family. people always say i can't make a big decision that day, you do did, your decision was no. that's ok! you could be scared,you might not want it for your family, but 95% of people doing it are glad they did a year later.bottom line is, if you want it do it and use it, if you don't- take your gift and hope you had a good experience. remember people only start to go there becasue of the gift, nobody walks in and says i came here to buy a timeshare, so they'll give you one chance, but they won't be stupid having you come all the time. hope this helps everyone. any questions oneputtgaeta@gmail.com. NO i don't work for them, wish i could because the reputation is great, it's hilton!

Reviews.Title: “So impressed!”
Reviews.Author: atkinsor
Reviews.Content: We called around to find a one bedroom suite and stumbled on the Parc Soleil. When we saw our room we were surprised it was not higher than a 3 star rating. The suite was very spacious and modern, the bed was wonderful, the view was amazing, the grounds were clean and inviting, the kids club was great (but the outing for our 4 year old was cancelled the day of). THe free internet and free parking are also a plus! The front desk staff were friendly and I was impressed by Jose who promptly delivered our crib. We loved it so much that we were almost sold on the timeshare until we did a little research (online you can find the same units for a fraction of the price). Parc Soleil was beyond my expectations, excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Mhuinker
Reviews.Content: We were very please with our stay at Parc Soleil. Our studio room was clean and in excellent condition! Having the small kitchenette was very useful and was stocked with silverware and dining sets. We weren't sure there would be a maid service daily (per a previous post), however, they did clean our room for the three nights we were there. We both agreed we would definately stay there again. Their rates per night were surprisingly reasonable we thought for a Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “The expedia expert”
Reviews.Author: Vicki M
Reviews.Content: The Parc Soleil was ok--grand, a little isolated, but the staff members were exceptional. In particular, I was impressed with the Expedia Local Expert, Javin Lopez. Not only did he help us plan our trips to Disney attractions (and to choose the ones that would be most fun for us), but he also sent cupcakes and balloons to our apartment because it was my birthday. It was a wonderfully thoughtful and festive gesture!

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: wayne77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with all amenities required. Clean and modern with helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and a pleasant view.”
Reviews.Author: Fairlypicky
Reviews.Content: We had a great view from our 1 bedroom unit, enjoyed watching the fireworks from our patio. The facilities are great, especially the pool. Staff was pleasant. There is some room for improvement, for being only a couple of years old, the up keep seems a little behind. Paint on railings is chipped, the security/room key entry from the garage into the building was broken/hanging out of the wall. Our dishwasher was missing many wheels on the dish rack which made it difficult to pull out. The design in the room could be better. There is very limted storage, the closet upon entry lacks any sort of hanger. The kitchen is a little small, it is difficult to open the fridge with someone sitting at the table. You have to do the dishes after every meal because there is only 4 of everything. The bathtub, while great to look at and really neat to have water coming from the ceiling lacks some functionality. If you are in the tub there is nowhere to put soap and since it is so tall you can't reach the floor. They should add some wire hanging soap holders. Like I mentioned the view was great. At home we are tempurpedic sleepers so typically hotels beds are terrible, these beds were great. Overall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints except the timeshare sell.”
Reviews.Author: likesabitofluxury
Reviews.Content: We went on a timeshare deal. Our 1 bedroom unit was lovely--clean, well-decorated, great porch with a view of Disney fireworks each night. Really roomy and well-appointed! The jogging trail around was "lake" was pleasant if short. Pools were lovely. No complains at all. The timeshare sell was just too polished, too slick, and they definitely do NOT want you to go home and think about it! It's an impulse buy, which I just don't do (not to the tune of $15000 plus). There is no option to go think and come back--all the deals are 'now or never.' Kind of unpleasant, but not unmanageable if you want the cheap deal. I've read complains about rooms and I wonder if they don't have nice rooms for possible timeshare purchasers and less nice rooms for others. Just don't know.

Reviews.Title: “SO Suite!!”
Reviews.Author: coptest
Reviews.Content: The pool was dang awesome!!! It even had a water slide! Fun activities at the pool. Best hotel in Florida! Great for anyone 1 to 100. My dad says: This place was going to be a larger development of condos when it was conceived, but I guess they gave up on phase 3 & 4 because of the economy. So, it doesn't look like much from the road. But, man this place is a great value. I like luxury, and I felt like this was luxury. We got a one-bedroom for my family of 5. Kids slept on the pull out. Rooms are big, so plenty of room. Seriously full kitchen. The place looks like its brand new. Pool is great for kids and grown ups, but there is also a nice grown up pool off to the side. Staff is Hilton professional. It has a nice little convenience store. Then the Walmart and Whole Foods are right down the road. We ate in the room for most meals. Really a terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN GEM!!”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: This resort is definitely off the beaten path, but it was a great place to stay. First class accommodations, great service, close to all the theme parks, grocery store and restaurants 5 minutes away. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to visit theme parks”
Reviews.Author: Aischillos
Reviews.Content: Located at a 15 minute drive from Disney and other theme parks, this hotel provides clean, large rooms for a fair price. We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great stay! 2 large pools were welcoming refreshing. Parking garage is great, with elevator access nearby. Restaurant/bistro doesn't offer the most refined food we'd like, but it was nice sitting in front of the pool drinking a cocktail. Only thing that bothered us was the airconditioning which kept rattling on during the night ...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yellowcatfish
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel twice (we were travelling around florida) & on both occasions each room was immaculate & with a full kitchen. The bathrooms are large (even in the smaller rooms) with great walk-in showers. The rooms that we stayed in were quite different form one another but both great; the first was very large with a sofa bed in the living room for another couple to sleep on - this was no normal sofa bed, it was huge & very comfortable. The second room was smaller but by no means small - there was plenty of room for all of our baggage (there was a lot of it!) & plenty of drawer space too. The beds in each room were sooooo comfortable! The pool was always clean & tidy with plenty of chairs available. I can imagine at peak times of the year then it will get very busy but when we were there it was lovely & quiet but still busy. The shop & restaurant were very good with plenty of selection in both & the food was very fresh & good portions. The service was great & the staff were extremely bubbly & nothing was a problem for them. The location was brilliant with international drive, shopping, sea world etc all just a short drive. Also there are plenty of restaurants nearby (but you will need to drive or get a taxi) & lots of shops for those essentials. I don't usually go back to the same place once I have stayed there, simply because there are so many places to visit, but I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Orlando & might even stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Really good family hotel convenient for Disney without being Over the Top”
Reviews.Author: drwbaker
Reviews.Content: A great all suite hotel within easy drive of Disney so you get the full disney experience without it being too in your face all the time. Very good pool, good on site shop, good parking, secure.... We had a nice one bedroom suite which was fine for 2 adults and 2 kids. Walmart was just down the road so can buy all the essentials there. Great places to eat on International Drive - we liked longhorn steakhouse and outback.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort Hotel with great pool”
Reviews.Author: Coltron
Reviews.Content: After reviewing trip advisor I decided to book a 1 week stay at this hotel given the fantastic feedback. I'm glad to say I wasn't disappointed. Although the hotel is a little outside the well worn hotel tracts of international drive, this resort is a real gem! The pool and surrounding deck area is magnificent. The gym facilities are excellent and amongst the best I've used at any hotel. The hotel bar/restaurant is great, however given that it is open to the pool deck, I could seeing it being quite chilly in cooler conditions. The rooms are clean, modern and quite warm. The joggin trail, lagoon and grounds are very nice and inviting. It's refreshing also to see that the marketplace (small grocery store on site) has competitive prices with larger chain stores, selling everything you need from milk, eggs, to beer or wine. I would definitely short list this hotel again for my next stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL VACATION SPOT FOR WHOLE FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: karenkatz73
Reviews.Content: We recently went on a Timeshare trip to the Hilton Parc Soleil in Orlando Florida. Although we did not purchase a timeshare, we could easily see why someone would purchase one at the Parc Soleil. The rooms were extremely spacious with wonderful amenities. Our oldest at 13 slept on the pull out couch. We have never seen a pull out mattress that was just like a tempurpedic! The kids thoroughly enjoyed the kids club and the pool was great. The only negative is that the hot tubs did not seem very hot. The staff was pleasant and quite helpful - everywhere! Very close to all the major Orlando spots. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoobt
Reviews.Content: We travel to Disney twice a year and have stayed at most of their vacation clubs. (used to own there) However, we decided to stay off property and got a very pleasant surprise. This hotel was awesome-brand new, spacious and very modern. We loved the bathrooms and had no water issues at all as I have read in some of the other reviews. We loved our view from the 11th floor facing Disney and could see the fireworks in the evening. The pool and housekeeping were great. We never had time to try the restaurant though. This has all the conveniences of home and is great for those that enjoy fancy, clean and modern. We will definitely be back!(oh, and this is half the price of the DVC places which is an added bonus!)

Reviews.Title: “One Of My Top Choices For Orlando”
Reviews.Author: solitaire007
Reviews.Content: First let me say i am a Hilton Diamond Member. I visit Orlando once a month for work and several times a month for Disney. Parc Soleil is my absolute number one choice when traveling for business. I prefer a Disney hotel or the Hilton at Downtown Disney for visiting Disney Parks so I can use the extra magic hours. LOCATION: This property is somewhat secluded which is the major point for it being my choice for business trips. The property is centrally located and great if you have a car and will be visiting Disney, Universal, I Drive, restaurants at Dr Phillips, and all the outlets. This is the best location for avoiding traffic to most of the popular destinations. I find this location to be more secure than staying anywhere near I Drive. This property is gated and in response to the previous reviews about this I find accessing this property no different than most gated resorts. They do have security patrolling the property which is way more than you can say about some other Orlando hotels. ACCOMODATIONS: I normally reserve a studio which is more than adequate for me. The studio is a solid step above an average hotel room. The bathroom is HUGE! It has a stand up, glassed in shower and no tub. Personally I like this! The studio also has a mini kitchen with small fridge, microwave, toaster, and coffee maker. I really like this because the kitchen is furnished with utensils. This is super convenient for me. The flooring is laminate and I love this! I hate hotel carpet. Every room I have had here has been super clean. The beds and bedding are always fresh and comfy! They also provide an Mp3 plug in alarm clock. Plugs are also easily accessible. One HUGE bonus is that for a tourist hotel I always find my room here nice and quiet! AMMENITIES: The pools here are spectacular. There is a large pool with a water slide, zero entry walk in, and fountains. There is a huge playground that looks like tons of fun next to the main pool. There is a second pool that is sometimes quieter in the evenings. I believe there are 4 spa pools as well which I always take advantage of after a long day of work. The workout room is larger than standard hotels and for a business traveler in a tourist town this is great. The property is half finished but the walk around the lake is lovely. RESTAURANT: The restaurant is another big point for making this my top choice. This place makes a most phenomenal steak! I've never had a bad meal here and I feel it stands up to some of my favorite Orlando restaurants. The restaurant is open air in front of the main resort pool. After a long day at work I really enjoy having a meal here and relaxing like I am on vacation! The layout actually reminds me of some resorts I've visited in Hawaii. Now to be just a bit persnickety, I would say my one complaint about this hotel is they rarely acknowdge Hilton status and provide no perks for Diamond level members. I know that sounds snobby but when you spend as many nights per year in a hotel as I do, it's the little things that keep you going. Overall, I really like Parc Soleil due to the ammenities, restaurant, clean quiet rooms, and convenient location!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad & The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: postparade
Reviews.Content: I will start with the good because there are a few nice things about the property that we did enjoy. First the pool and slide is spectacular for families with kids. It's friendly and shallow enough that you can let them go in themselves and watch from the sideline. The condo units are lovely and clean. They are new so you would expect that from a Hilton property. But the pull out couch was a queen size and the mattress on the pull out wasn't half bad. The marketplace downstairs was convenient and relatively priced which I was surprised about. The restaurant was ok at best and probably could be better but it is what it is. Now, let's start with this. We are Hilton Diamond Club members. We were invited by HGVC to come down on them and view the timeshare presentation and receive our 3 nights free. I took advantage of that thinking they would take good care of us and make sure our stay was wonderful...how far from reality that was. We checked in on a Sunday evening. Our Hilton profile says, high floor, away from elevator...what do we get? Bottom floor which is 4- and right next to the elevators. By the time we got all the luggage in the room and sat down it was kind of too late to move. Plus the man who checked me in said we had a great view and the location of the unit was lovely. Oh...I failed to mention after we walked out onto the terrace that we were right over the 3rd floor parking garage, had a great view of cars, and the view of the crappy, empty lots they have for the new buildings. We saw no fireworks and heard car alarms all night and into the mornings. I was not sure who to complain to since we were on the timeshare side vacationing. Later found out that we should have discussed with hotel management to have the room changed. In my opinion if we are Diamond members, you want to sell me a timeshare, aren't you going to make sure we have the best of everything? Location? Setting? Experience, Etc? Nope. Not to be. My daughter (6) prefers to take baths and after a day at Disney who wouldn't want to? Well the water from the bath was cold so when we got home that evening we had to give her a shower which she was not happy about. the next morning was supposed to be our timeshare presentation so we thought we'd mention it to our concierge about all the issues. so we meet up with her, go listen to the program (which wasn't bad or pushy) and she said she'd talk to the manager. They sent someone up to fix it. Under his breath he commented that the handle and valve were backwards and that if we put it on the "C" we would get hot water. He told us it was a quick remedy and he'd be done in no time. So we decide to go to the pool, call the front desk and ask for service since we didn't take it the first day to save on towels, etc. Well we come back 2 1/2 hours later to find, no room cleaning and the man still there fixing the "so called" easy valve. I wanted to get my daughter into a warm bath and couldn't. The man was so convinced in the beginning that the "easy fix" would be done in no time. Well needless to say it took another 1/2 hour. Furious with the whole thing from the location of the room, to no maid service to no hot water I went to see the manager. She was reassuring and sorry...of course, gave us a $50 resort credit and told me someone would be to clean the room once we had departed for Disney that evening. Thankfully when we got home the room was done. However it took way too long and too much of an effort from patrons who should be treated much better. As a matter of fact she wanted to push me aside so quickly she mentioned they had their "staff party" that evening like she was in a big hurry to get out of there. The front gates are a joke. No one checks your passes, no one looks out the window. They simply raise the gate and let anyone in. The parking is terrible and unless you have a VW Mini cooper you aren't fitting your car in the space where passengers can get out. Don't be surprised if you wind up with a few nasty dings in the side of your doors. The restaurant was average. Prices were ok. Food was ok. Nothing to rave about. The worst thing about our stay was how we were treated. No one seemed to care about our issues and everyone wanted to pass it off on someone else. All they want to do is get you in for their timeshare presentation. The staff is unfriendly and common. They don't go out of their way for anyone. They really need to take a lesson from someone on manners. I would not recommend this property to anyone. You can give it a try yourself. Some have had great experiences. I think that ours proves that all you are is a number through the timeshare presentation door and nothing else. They don't care about their Hilton Honors members and that was quite apparent on our trip. Sorry...2 thumbs down from us.

Reviews.Title: “Cold antiseptic, and sterile.”
Reviews.Author: read27
Reviews.Content: This hotel/time share, whatever, should never have the Hilton name attached to it. It is located in the middle of several abandoned building projects, only 2 street lights on the long drive to the entrance where security lets anyone thru with no checks, so why bother being there. In and out 4 times before wew got a parking pass, again with no check. The lobby reverberates with nothing to absorb the sound. It is deafening trying to check in. The breakfast is awful, the service indifferent. The bedroom floor is wood laminate with no rugs, and piles of dust under the furniture shows poor cleaning and useless supervision thereof. On the plus side, a bathroom so long you have to take a picnic lunch to trek from one end to the other. But it takes a good 4 minutes for any tap or shower to produce hot water! All we heard when checking in were residents complaining. Room cleaning finally arrived around 4.30pm!

Reviews.Title: “Minutes to paradise”
Reviews.Author: skalliwag2
Reviews.Content: This new property is far enough away from everything to let you feel like you are in another world away from Orlando and all it's chaos. You will need a car to get around as you are not near any shops, restaurants and attractions. The property is clean, new and a great balance between family needs and adults only needs. Reasonable restaurant on site, plus a small, limited store for snacks and beverages. Nice walkway around fountain to take morning walks.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay”
Reviews.Author: Love_travelling013
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 8 year old daughter for 2 weeks in October 2011. There really is very little to fault here. The property is new and there are only 2 towers built (so far) The front desk and concierge and really helpful, the concierge got us free desserts when we booked at Roy's Restaurant which was really unexpected and appreciated. Our 2 bedroom suite was HUGE and can comfortably sleep 6. It was furnished to a high standard and had everything we needed (they even provide dishwasher powder and washing up liquid) The pool is lovely with a great water slide, plenty of sun beds and a nice atmosphere. They have movie nights, karaoke and other stuff but unfortunately we did not have time to take our daughter down there. We only ate at the restaurant twice but they had great service and good food. Location is great, 5 mins from Downtown Disney and its better to take the back roads there rather than the I4. Hotel easy to get to from the airport as well. One benefit is that the Dr Phillips area is about 10 mins away which has some great restaurants ( Roys and Seasons 52) Overall, the only fault we could find is that there is a really nasty smell in the indoor parking lot ! (though plenty of spaces tho)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Georgiagirl77755
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice with great views . The pool area was super cool . All the attractions were in short distance. They would play games at the pool and have a movie night also which was fun for the adults as well as the kids. Nice family atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “we shall be back (if we get a 2 bedroom suite)”
Reviews.Author: Popcornlovers
Reviews.Content: Travelling on vacation with pregnant wife and daughter 3 years. Again; we where here already during xmas 2010 and we love the place. This time we stayed 9 nights in a 1 bed room suite during Halloween and again like on xmas, there was a nice Halloween party for the kids and adults, it was great fun. Our daughter still talks about the party. We did again book a 1 bedroom suite and it was nice and spacious. The only negative thing we had the last time was the issues with the house keeping. Since share owners have limited house keeping sometimes they forgot to clean rooms of “regular” paying guest. But this time housekeeping was 110% up to their job and we like to thank them for this again. Reception is still hard to understand on the phone and they still tent to be a bit "grumpy" on the phone... not at the desk tough We had a suite in Building 2 and we recommend everybody to book I tower 2, on the 9th floor in the far back. Now let us tell you; if you are in a hurry coming back to the hotel; those rooms are really far away from the elevator. Pool and playgrounds are great for kids and adults, plenty of space and also resting areas for the parents. we shall be back (if we get a 2 bedroom suite as we will have another baby coming in January)

Reviews.Title: “Very generic location”
Reviews.Author: jojo34219
Reviews.Content: Burned recess lights, loose toilet paper holder, A/C unit with a hissing noise whenever it kicked off; problems were reported but not fixed during our stay; housekeepers that knock on your door even though you have a DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door. It is supposed to be a luxurious facility; it was not to us. This is a vacation ownership location and walls are so thin you can hear people above you and next to you on both sides. The property is not finished as well, so there is a lot of construction and not-too-pretty sightings.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Renee P
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this resort. The staff was friendly, the grounds were well kept, the rooms were beautiful AND clean. After doing theme parks for two days we spent the rest of the time at the resort. There were plenty of activities for the kids (day and night) a fabulous activity room for them, nice market and restaurant. Our party was 2 adults and 2 kids. We had a 2 bedroom suite. It was bigger than most apartments I've had. I especially enjoyed the full size kitchen with all of the amenities. The dinning table could easily seat six. We like to eat in and having the ability to cook a meal just like home was big bonus for us. It saved us a lot of money so we could do more of the fun stuff. It was the perfect place to relax after the hustle and bustle of the parks. We will definately stay here again the next time we go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Alvin W
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 10th floor at the Parc Soleil for 4 days,and we certainly enjoyed our stay. The entire staff, including housekeeping was great. It was secluded, but just enough to be away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. Shopping area and resturants were very convient. Seaworld was just minutes away. The resort had music floating through the air, which provided an enjoyable, relaxing atmosphere that complimented the landscaping and all the amenities. However the 2 hour timeshare presentation turned into 3.5 hours and a no thank you. We lost about 2 hours of sleep because the compressor on the furnance malfunctioned. We called for maintenance, and he promptly arrived. He was very nice and apologetic,but said he had heard some even louder than that one. Overall, this resort was great, and we enjoyed our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools and activities, good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: EspooSnob
Reviews.Content: Large nice rooms with good kitchens, huge pools and lots of hottubs, good playing areas for children. Lots of activities organised every day for kids. There is a nice hiking trail circling a small lake, although at certain times of the day they have a music system on with speakers by the trail, that's a bit annoying. Food in the restaurant was excellent, but service occasionally slow. Overall the hotel works very well and has a nice atmosphere although I wonder if that will change at some point as more of the rooms are sold as timeshares? The location is in my view very good: close to Disney and some of the malls, fairly close to some good restaurants as well. You definitely do need a car to move around.

Reviews.Title: “We won't stay anywhere else in Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: ajotter
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8 days at the Parc Soleil and it couldn't have been nicer. We had a two-bedroom suite which we all loved (family of four... two girls, 6 & 7). The decor was beautiful, the rooms were spacious, and there was plenty of storage space. The kitchen has anything you would need to make your own meals, the towels and linens were high quality, and they even provide your coffee for the coffee maker. The service was incredible...we never saw a single staff member who didn't greet us warmly. The marketplace is very convenient, and the prices were actually fair which was a nice surprise. The kids club was a big plus for our daughters. They really enjoyed it and met lots of friends from all over the world during our stay. The only recommendations I have to make it better are to not charge for all the kids activities. There was the occasional complimentary activity, but most are a la carte pricing. E.g., they offered sand art one day but wanted $5 to make one and it couldn't have been more than $1 worth of materials. At least don't try to profit off that stuff...felt chintzy to me. The other is that the kitchen grill vents into the parking garage and at peak meal times the garage gets very smoky and our car always smelled like a burnt hamburger. But beyond those two tiny points, the place is magnificent...and it is very central to everything. I've seen a few reviews saying it is in the middle of nowhere...I suppose if you don't have a car, it would seem that way but it is within 5-10 minutes' drive of anything you would need and an easy trip to all the big parks. We will definitely be back, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 17mcal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the one-bedroom king which has a full kitchen and washer and dryer. Very comfortable bed so we slept soundly. Fun pool and the food at the restaurant was fairly priced and especially the breakfast choices were excellent. The omlettes were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: JEF123
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a two week vacation at Parc Soleil and we were impressed with our stay. From the moment we arrived at the resort, we received customer service like nothing I've ever experienced before at any resort: the people were awesome. Although spacious and very comfortable, our room, a one bedroom suite facing the pool wasn't exactly as the pictures promised. For example, water did not come out of the ceiling in the bathtub. Our shower was more like a hospital shower and each time we used it water got all over the floor. I found it strange that there was no dresser in the bedroom and no small desk for the phone (and our laptop) in the living room. My husband wished there was a service that delivered a paper on the weekends to the room -- we would have paid extra for that (you do get U.S. Today Mon-Fri). But this is nitpicking, overall, it was very comfortable and the kitchen was well stocked with dishes and pans for cooking and the appliances were top-notch. The pool area was large and chairs and umbrellas were always available. The pool was perfect for my son who is 2.5 yrs old and just learning to swim and the place is clearly popular with families with young children. The pool was shallow throughout and had lots of waterfalls and fountains to play with. There were lots of great activities for kids - a playground, waterslide, activities centre, games throughout the day - bingo and slide races for example - and they even showed movies on a big screen at the pool twice a week in the evening. If your room faced the pool you could watch from your balcony, and other rooms can see the fireworks at Disney each night. The gym was good but not extensive or large. It was equipped with treadmills, elipticals, bikes and weight machines. Towels, water and earphones were provided which I found a nice touch. The general store at the pool was expensive but good for snacks and coffee throughout the day. We only ate dinner once at the restaurant. It was good. Nothing special except for the staff. The staff throughout were top notch and very accommodating towards all our needs. Parking was easy and there were always spots close to the elevators. But all in all it was a great resort with wonderful staff and I would recommend it to anyone - especially people with young children and we would certainly stay there if we returned to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect family vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLambeau
Reviews.Content: This resort is brand new with nicely appointed and extremely spacious rooms. We have travelled to many high end resorts. I would say this is a 4.5 stars. That said, even though it is not 5 stars, it is one of our favorite family vacation spots. It is a smaller resort, but the layout is absolutely perfect. The pool is beautiful and has an awesome-huge waterslide that kept my 3 kids busy for hours (and yes, mom, dad and grandparents even went down!!). There is also a playground right next to the pool that is covered for sun protection. The activity center is tons of fun for the kids. We had one miserable day of nasty weather and the activity center kept their attention the entire day. There is ping-pong, pool, wii, xbox, computers, board games and the best part is the staff. Jordan was awarded the staff of the month while we were there and he totally deserves it! He as a riot, great on the mic and kept the kids (and parents) having tons of fun with all the games they had planned. They do family games, like bingo, scavenger hunts, ping pong tournaments, etc, kids only games and activities like build a bear, and parents only games like pub games, which was a blast. The food at the restaurant was very good, great menu, with good salads, fish, and great kids meals. The deli market is great for breakfast food (the rooms have huge full kitchens) snacks and salads/sandwiches. The work out room is spacious and has great equipment. I hate to even post this, because I feel like it is our little secret....but we won't stay anywhere else in Orlando. This is our third year staying and the first year, we left the disney vacation club at the contemporary....to stay here and the disney resort could not hold a candle to the Hilton. It is only a 15 minute drive to magic kingdom and islands of adventure and right around the corner from about 15 restaurants--and only about 5 mintues from downtown disney.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best around”
Reviews.Author: jdr1000
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here for a day during a business trip. The place still looks like new. Market on first floor is a great convenience. Always stayed here during winter weather and this time I finally saw the pool at work. Great pool. Playground for the kids is HUGE and the Gym for us adults is also one of the largest I've seen on a hotel property. It worries me that in all these years with such a great place the developers are still only two buildings out of the eight planned. This leaves a sad view from the balcony. At night that same balcony had great views of the parks fireworks. Covered parking is perfect for Florida weather

Reviews.Title: “Totally exceeded our expectations - really nice vibe”
Reviews.Author: JulzieJ1
Reviews.Content: OK so despite being a little out of the way of everything (but not too far), this place was great. Great value for money, the whole place is new and looks really nice, although they are obviously planning on making it much bigger it doesn't really matter, it has a nice chilled out feel to it, totally different to Disney! The pools were really nice, and there was entertainment on all the time. Found the atmosphere really nice, all the staff were really friendly and there's free Wifi which is always a plus point. Our room was really nice, huge bathroom. The hotel is really close to Universal Studios and Sea World and also near to Disney but you don't have to venture into the Disney traffic if you don't want to. There is a restaurant at the complex but we didn't eat there as there are plenty of places within a 5-10 min drive. Great facilities (gym, laundry etc) which we took advantage of. Would definately consider staying here again next time we are in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Adventure trip ............ in style!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller2908
Reviews.Content: I was very uncertain about this holiday - first trip on my own!! I couldn't have had a better time - no need to have worried. From the time I drove up the staff couldn't have been more friendly and welcoming. My suite was superb - overlooking the pool, it was tremendous. I was able to drive out to the local shops easily, I went to meet friends and found that this location is very central ..... the hotel was so close to the interstate. Only problem was on initial arrival [in the dark] the hotel was difficult to find ..... could do with better signage please. The bathroom was beautiful, the bedroom - and bed - was so comfy - and whilst I had to do some work whilst there i loved being in the room and balcony whilst I did it !! The pools were both wonderful - and the added fun was the duck and her ducklings who came to visit with us all - much to the delight of all the guests ! Thank you Hilton for a wonderful visit - I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort, Staff just OK”
Reviews.Author: rockdaddy82
Reviews.Content: The week before we received a call from the resort to confirm the rooms and rates. After the customer service operator confirmed everything she tried to get me to buy a time share. It was no big deal and I thought at least I will not be bothered by the resort staff trying to sell me one when I arrived for my vacation. When we checked into the resort my little one had to use the bathroom so I asked my wife to check out what free gift we were getting. When we got done I asked my wife what did we get she said a cheap bag and the person that gave it to her tried to sell a timeshare. It's not a big deal to me but I know some people hate this so avoid the free gift if you don't feel like hearing a sell job. They did not push to much it was just anoying after a long drive. I really like all the activities that the resort plans all day long. Make sure you grab a activities planner. They have water slide races, movies at the pool, trivia games, and alot more for those days around the pool. The room was clean and was up to date. I would say for the price you get a great value because you get almost everything that the more expensive resorts offer. The only negaitive was one of the staff used bad language around my 5 year old. Luckly my 5 year old was so happy about disney and his ice cream. The guy seem to be sorry so I did not bring it up to management. Overall it was a good experience, I have had better but my family and I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Hands Down BEST Resort I have EVER stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Gabe F
Reviews.Content: All i can say is WOW! This hotel from top to bottom was 10 star! From staff to cleanliness to the design of the rooms. Words cannot describe how pleased I was with this hotel. They make you feel like a top notch welcomed guest. The balcony overlooking fireworks from Disneyland were fantastic. They had a full service kitchen with all stainless steel appliances, wooden floors, phenomenal bathroom/shower. I t was paradise. I could have stayed a full week in Orlando without having to ever even leave the room. The best part was the PRICE! to get a master suite for the price we got it for was heavenly. Also, their pool was astonishing! Not to mention the awesome restaurant that is attached to the poolside with the awesome staff they have working their from waitresses/waiters to bartenders! Talk about being personable with guests! I tell you one thing, If I owned my own 5 diamond resort, I would want it to be a complete replica of this place! You all are incredible! Well done! We will definitely be back in a few months when we take our kids to Disneyland! I appreciate all of you!

Reviews.Title: “More than met our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Beemaboy
Reviews.Content: At the time of booking I had a lot of issues convincing my wife as she has not had the best experiences with Hilton in the past. This place has completely changed her mind. The quality and space of our one 1 suite was excellent. We did have a hitch the day before arriving when we called to confirm our booking only to be told they had cancelled our booking the month before with no explanation. Fortunately Geoff who is one of the managers there sorted the problem out efficiently and even greeted us in person on our arrival to apologise. If I have to be picky about things, I felt the shower head did not match the overall quality of the bathroom. Also the waitresses in the restaurant at breakfast time spent too much time hiding in the back instead of spending time attending to diners. Some more umbrellas around the pool would be nice for those who like a bit of shade. These are all small points that did not impact on us too much. We did not get any hassel from the sales team but this might be because we are from the UK and are therefore unlikely to buy into their time share scheme. The place is well located for all the major parks / malls and the nearby main road (Palm Parkway / Turkey Lake Road) is excellent to use to avoid the traffic on the the roads which run parallel to the east (I4, International Drive, John Young etc). There is also a WallMart just down the road to stock up from. Overall, we loved this place and hope to come back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort! Beautiful grounds and the room was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Mygx470
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc Soleil September 12 - 16, 2011. I had booked a studio suite online with the AAA rate and got the room for $78.00 per night. When we checked in my husband asked if they had any upgraded rooms and they said that they would upgrade us to the one bedroom suite for one $25 more per night. Wow, this room was huge and beautiful. The full kitchen and the washer and dryer came in handy. Like others have posted, the bathroom is huge and the bathtub with the water coming from the ceiling was great. We were never called by the onsite team to sit theough a presentation, but...if you call down to check on park tickets, that's where they try to get you to sit through a presentation and offer very discounted tickets. We did not do that and never heard from them. Another nice amenity is the covered parking garage. The pool is great and stays open until 11:00 at night. We foiund all staff to be extremenly helpful and friendly. When we checked out, to our surprise, we were only billed an extra $15 per night for the upgrade. I will definitely stay here every time we travel to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: A Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite and loved it. We traveled with our 3 year old. I would definitely stay here again. One thing that prevented this from being a 5 point rating was the lack of really hot water. Seems the water never got hot enough. We ate at the onsite restaurant for lunch. The food was nothing to write home about, but for the price it was decent. I just like the convenience of it being right by the pool. The pool was perfect for young kids. We would definitely stay here again when visiting Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: AdventuresTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been to Orlando about 6 times and all the hotels I stayed at were pretty great but I have to say this is one of the best. The best rate, rooms, quality, excellent distance to Disney Parks and downtown Disney. We stayed in the one bedroom and it seriously is the size of a one bedroom apartment. Full kitchen, large bathroom with bath and shower, large bedroom. There was a large flat screen TV in the bedroom and living room area, included a DVD player. The entire place was spotless. The grounds and pool was really great too. They have a mini mart on the property which is nice if you want to get something later in the evening. Had breakfast by the pool, food was very good the bar drinks were also very good. I was pleased and would not stay anywhere else if I go back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Second time - just as great”
Reviews.Author: Chrisquitolindo
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Parc Soleil and this time we rented a 1 bedroom suite. Just spectacular: huge, extremely well-equipped and comfortable for just a few dollars more than the standard room. Excellent value. The room itself is far from the entrance so you can't hear a noise from the corridor. Stunning swimming pools and jacuzzis. It is just a great place to relax and sleep after a rough day in an amusement park or shopping in one of the closeby malls. We had a problem with our room not being made one day in spite of calling reception on two occasions. This was well dealt with by management who showed professional concern and attention. We will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Moms & Dads: this is a great place!!”
Reviews.Author: Val H
Reviews.Content: Great all around. Staff was friendly and helpful. Pools were awesome for the kids (and dad!) They have an onsite activity center set up for the kids when they're done at the pool. If you're staying with kids in Orlando - this is the place you want to be! Having a full kitchen and wash/dryer makes life so much easier while you're away from home. Onsite restaurant was not too pricey - our family of 4 spent $45 for lunch which you can't beat since it is a poolside restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Tony_in_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: Our family always stay at this hotel due to its relatively central location and the fact that place has a full kitchen. Everything was very clean and the service is also very good. The stay was very good and there really isnt anything to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “HGVC at Its Finest!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler011
Reviews.Content: It's relatively new and once fully developed will be fabulous. It already is exceptional -- offering a great pool area, children's activities, restaurant, tennis courts, basketball area, walking/jogging path, workout room. The rooms are wonderful! Packed with amenities and comfort, like oversized furniture, washer/dryer in 1 & 2 bdrm units and available laundry rooms off the interior hallway for studio guests. The interior hallways are a nice touch and not found at the other Orlando HGVC properties. Parking garage on this first couple of floors of each building is also unique to this property in comparison to the other Orlando HGVC properties. I liked the parking option. Easy to unload the rental car. No need to worry about bad weather when going from the room to the car. The walking trail is nice, but not as picturesque because of vacant land awaiting construction. Resort is probably better situated for Disney Marketplace, Universal, and Sea World, but an easy drive to WDW parks, too. The drive to Magic Kingdom is fastest by going the back way, but you have to know the way - some of the roads don't appear on maps.

Reviews.Title: “summer vacation”
Reviews.Author: Zimco01
Reviews.Content: This was the 4th stay at Parc and the service remains great and the property is kept up and clean Kids LOVE the water slide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lola1960048
Reviews.Content: This was part of a Hilton Grand Hotel Timeshare offer. We stayed for three nights for basically 68.00 total. They say you will get 100.00 back but it's in the form of a voucher that's good for 6 months that you send in after you stay at another Hilton brand hotel. The room was a suite with a sofa bed in the living room area and a full kitchen including a washer and dryer. It was as bright and beautiful as it was discribed. It's close to all the Disney attractions and they give you a folder with tons of coupons. There was a mandatory timeshare sales pitch that lasted an hour more than the described two hours which if you schedule that the first day as early as possible they don't bother you the rest of your stay to sign up. It's an excellent deal if you don't mind the sales pitch!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as expected”
Reviews.Author: Jen2304
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through Hotwire and for the price I paid, I was expecting much more (I've booked through Hotwire in the past and stayed at nicer places for less money). I have to say that I was a little disappointed with my stay. Our room was very small (though we booked a condo). We had one of the few rooms that didn't have a balcony, but instead had a window that overlooked a brick wall and part of the parking garage. The room itself was clean but had a weird mildew smell that I couldn't figure out. Walls are thin and you can hear everything going on in the hallway and the rooms near you. One day I took an ice cold shower because for some reason there was no hot water. I didn't visit the pool because it was completely mobbed with hundreds of people and kids running around screaming. We visited the restaurant by the pool for dessert and coffee one night and that was pretty nice with friendly service. Everyone we dealt with was very friendly and accommodating, typical Hilton staff. The grounds are very nice and appear to be well maintained. Free parking and internet access were definitely a plus. The location of the hotel is a little out of the way and in a really secluded area, but they provide you with a little book at check-in that gives you directions to nearby points of interest, which is a huge help. This is the first time I've stayed in Orlando and didn't end up getting lost. I hate that I'm being such a complainer, but I guess I just expected better considering the price I paid and the fact that it's a Hilton Grand Vacations Club resort. Maybe I just had bad luck this trip. Overall, I'd say that the place is nice, but there is certainly better out there. If you're taking a family trip, this might be a good spot because there seems to be a lot of things here to keep kids busy. If you prefer a more relaxing trip without hundreds of screaming kids, then this is definitely not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “AWSOME SERVICE, good room except for glass door, but AWFUL HOUSEKEEPING”
Reviews.Author: flacalinda
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were all GREAT, we were not harassed for the timeshare thing, we were politely asked just once. The facilities are great, great pool (kids 42inches and over), good games and stuff at the activities center, and great tot lot, DELICIOUS restaurant!!!! and good options at little market. The shower novelty is fun to look at but really impractical as it splashes everywhere and does not feel nice when it lands on you super hard. My two complaints are: 1. We stayed at a suite, and the bedroom door is made of glass, and all doors have HUGE gaps at the bottom. If any of you are like me and don´t want to have to be too quite so your kids don´t wake up in the other room then this hotel IS NOT FOR YOU... it´s like not having doors at all, and the toilet is absurdly loud for some reason. We ended up getting a separate room for the kids. 2. AND THIS WAS THE BIGGIE... THEY HAVE NO CLUE WHAT HOUSEKEEPING MEANS!!! I stayed 8 nights and every day I called, I am not going into details bc something different happenned EVERY SINGLE DAY!! it was ridiculous really, all they do is change the sheets if you ask every day for three days, and change out towels. The don´t wipe, dust, pick one single thing off the floor, vacuum (even if you ask, beg plead or demand). You will come back to a dirty room every day and have to ask for the night staff to come and clean, at least the night staff is efficient, then again they are doing it infront of you... Yes, the hotel gave me a small break on the price to compensate, but really they would have to knock off half to make it okay and that´s still not the point. So go and be prepared for this, if you don´t mind, then it´s a great property.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay in Orlando, this place is great.”
Reviews.Author: rovingambler
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I despise Orlando. I would prefer anywhere except maybe Libya. I went into this trip with expectations of wishing I was at work, or maybe in the middle of a tax audit; but the Parc made this trip bearable. When we checked in we were immediately directed to the sales table which promised wonderful gifts for just a small amount of my time. Having done to many timeshare pitches, we still said yes, knowing that we would save some amount on Disney Tickets. The pitch was ok, the sales guy Bobby, actually decent. We didn't purchase anything, it took 90 minutes and we were on our way with Disney Tickets for 280 bucks less than we would have paid at the gate. Then we went to our room. We have stayed at many other places that are actually nicer and much more deserving of 5 stars, but this place, in Orlando is really beautiful. The kitchen in the one bed suite is well equipped. Full size fridge and stove, washer and dryer, dishwasher, and fully stocked cabinets. The staff is quick to refill dish soap, laundry soap, and bathroom supplies with a call to the desk. We prepared breakfast everyday, and the occasional lunch or dinner when we returned from the parks. Living room has king size pull out sofa, actually more comfortable than the king bed. The bathroom is big, with tub and separate shower. Also a separate room for the toilet. Full porch with table and chairs were perfect for breakfast. Everything was clean, new, and functioning. The facilities were great: two swimming pools, water slide, 4 hot tubs. Small restaurant was better than the many chain restaurants nearby. My child loved the activities center to the point she was wanting to leave the Disney parks to get home at night to take part in some activity that they were offering. Special thanks to Kim and Jordan who really understand how to keep kids happy (not by feeding them candy, but by listening to them and laughing with them.) Also there is a tennis court and basketball court that no one uses, a walking/jogging path, weight room, pool table, and ping pong to round out the entertainment. I read a bunch of the reviews before exchanging my timeshare for a week at the parc, and the major complaint seemed to be that the Parc wasn't near anything. Because of that I rented a car and that took care of everything. It is true, the Parc isn't near much but in 15 minutes you can drive to Disney or Universal. It is 5 minutes to SeaWorld, 4 minutes to groceries, and 4 minutes to every restaurant chain known to man. I haven't been to Orlando in 10 years, hope I won't be back for at least 10 more, but if I return I will happily stay at the Parc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Parc”
Reviews.Author: Oconnellgang
Reviews.Content: We loved the Parc Soleil. Recently purchased a Hilton Grand Vacation Club property on the resale market. We used some our points to stay at the Parc in April. The property is well maintained .We especially liked the walking trail behind the hotel with the beautiful waterfall. The convenience store and poolside restaurant are great. Lots of activities for the kids. Wish we could have stayed a couple weeks. We'll definitely plan on going back in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Diagnosed w/cancer and they would not issue credit or reschedule....”
Reviews.Author: MGabrielli
Reviews.Content: Most incredibly insensitive customer service I have ever come across. In January of this past year, I had booked a short vacation here for myself, my wife and our twin, two-year olds for April. Unfortunately, I was diagnosed with lymphoma in February and, due to the necessity of having to undergo chemotherapy until August, we were obviously forced to try to reschedule the trip. Our request, however, was denied by the Parc Soleil. And not only did they refuse to allow us to reschedule, they likewise refused to issue any credit whatsoever and kept the $700 I previously paid them when I originally booked the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the early checkout time”
Reviews.Author: jviera
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised that check-out is 10:00 a.m. A late check out is available at a cost of $25 for two hour blocks. This was disappointing, but the hotel was otherwise excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay at the Parc Soleil”
Reviews.Author: epc2
Reviews.Content: This is definetly our place in Orlando , this is the 2nd time we stay at the Parc Soleil and everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovin’ every minute of it!”
Reviews.Author: Roger H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2BR Penthouse in building 2 for 1 week. I’m a new owner to HGVC Parc Soleil and I’m so glad I took the leap of faith to purchase here. This place is new, clean, modern and absolutely FANTASTIC! The kitchen was large had all the utensils someone would need for a week long vacation. The bedrooms and living room were spacious. The balcony had a table and chairs which was perfect for the morning cup of joe. The bathrooms are an attraction in themselves. The water for the bath tub comes out of the ceiling! Note: The rooms will get serviced on the 4th day of a 1 week stay. We knew this going in and that is just fine with me. Hotel rooms get serviced every day. I didn’t want to stay in a hotel, so it was not an issue. If I rented a condo from VBO, I wouldn’t have my room turned at all. My family had one unit and my in-laws had another unit across the hall. We all would hang out on each other’s balcony, have a glass a wine and enjoy the evening. The poolside unit had a good view of the pool and downtown Orlando. The ‘fireworks’ side had a view of Disney fireworks. This was a quieter side because you also see the undeveloped area where future towers will some day be built. I read some posts complaining about this side. Oddly enough, we ended up hanging out on this side balcony more often than the poolside balcony. The staff at Parc Soleil was kind, courteous, and fun! Anyone planning to go to this resort needs to check out the activities calendar. There is so much to do on the resort that we planned around it. The days we spent poolside was amazingly fun. Probably my favorite part. The Parc Soleil recreational team know how to entertain! There were hoola hoop contests, Texas hold’em tournaments, beer games, poolside trivia, face painting for the kids and more. Entering the hoola hoop contest was probably a mistake but I’ll try anything once. Yes, this resort is new and only 2 towers are built. But that is what makes it attractive to me. The pool wasn’t too crowded and we were always able to get a table. The gentle slope into the pool is a nice touch. Also, we all enjoyed the water slide because the water flow was set pretty high and we were able to fly down the slide. That’s the way it should be. The adult pool is set aside away from the main pool so you can read a book or get some R&R without being bothered with all of the hoopla at the main pool. The onsite deli and restaurant was convenient and pretty good! I highly recommend the roast beef wrap. My wife and I had this for lunch just about every day. It was that good. The resort is located between Disney and Universal and a short distance off the freeway. So it doesn’t have a lot of traffic going by and is peacefully quiet at night. We had a rockin’ good time and will definitely come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Could not be happier!”
Reviews.Author: maaq
Reviews.Content: I just got here, and I know it's early in my stay, but wow! The rooms are fantastic, I have a three bedroom. My purchase here, I am an owner and bought from Hilton, cost me a lot. But I am now of the firm view, it was money well spent! Will write again at the end, hope my view does not change, but I am sure it will not.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: theorphanarium
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc Soleil for one week in April. It suited our needs perfectly. Our room was very clean and quiet. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. The on-site market place had fresh and prepackaged food. We picked up a couple of quick breakfasts there and they were quite good. There was a laundry room down the hallway from our room, but we didn't use it.
