The hotel is a short drive from Universal Studios, Disney World, and Downtown Disney, as well as a Walmart and Whole Foods. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SouthernParent
Reviews.Content: We were offered a Parc Soleil Timeshare Package, 4 days 3 nights. We extended the 4 days in the package and paid the regular "hotel" rate for an extra few days. We also paid a little extra for a one bedroom. We know from friends that the yearly maintenance fee for most timeshares, no matter the brand, are not cheap. During the entire timeshare presentation I kept saying to myself that we paid less for our week than the owners paid for their yearly maintenance fee. But, having seen some of the major timeshares out there, Hilton would definitely be our first choice even though they tend to me a little bit more expensive. If we did become owners I would struggle with the fact that random people could just stay here simply by booking a room online like a regular hotel. As an owner I would rather my 'investment' be limited to owners. But, the stay was good. The cleanliness was overall good. No matter where we stay we always have to touch up areas that housekeeping missed. But, for a new resort, I did not expect to see stains on the carpet and the sofa cushions. This could go back to the renters(people who book online) and owners(those who shell out a lot of money). I feel that owners take better care because they will be coming back, maybe even requesting the same room. But the renter has no vested interest. Now we are under the category of renters, currently. But, we are seriously considering becoming owners. Some people had reviews about poor customer service. We found the customer service to be absolutely excellent. Whenever we requested towels or other items, no matter the time of day, they were delivered within 15 minutes. Every Hilton employee we had contact with, whether it be the front desk, housekeeping or maintenance, there were extremely courteous. When we checked in early, a room was ready but we choose to wait for an upper floor with a pool view. Our biggest issue with any hotel or resort is the lack of towel bars or hooks for towels. We believe in conservation but, we need somewhere to hang our towels in the bathroom. Without that we end up putting them on the floor and having to request new ones every day. Actually my husband reused his towel because he used the one hook that was in the bathroom. We really felt that this resort was a home away from home. Having a washer and dryer is such a necessity for a family like ours with young kids. The kitchen table is located in the perfect place because we used it as a folding table for our clothes. The kitchen is very open and bright. The balcony is huge. The tub idea was cute with the water coming out of the ceiling. I would have preferred frosted shower doors that way some one else could be in bathroom at the same time using the sink. There is a sliding door that separates the toliet but, where would the person wash their hands since both sinks are in the same area with the clear glass shower. The parking was interesting. There are more beams in this parking lot than many other garage that we have used. I guess that is because the hotel is on top and they need the extra support. Around some the beams are these metal rectangular things around the base, you will have to squeeze out of your vehicle to avoid hitting your door. The advantage of the Parc Soleil over the Tuscany a few miles away is the slide for the pool. I am not sure how much I will enjoy the Parc Soleil in 5 or 10 years when the other towers go up. Currently with only the two towers, it does not feel overcrowded like other resorts we have stayed at. We really enjoyed our stay. We will stay at the Parc Soleil again. And one last thing, we can not figure out why during the timeshare presentation they were trying to get us to take ownership with a deed on one of their older resorts in another state. The representative said it was to save us money. We like Hilton but, when has a company done something that is financially in the best interest of the consumer. We asked the difference but never got a straight answer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!!”
Reviews.Author: Shepherd
Reviews.Content: Great accommodations - easy drive to Disney. Walmart only 2miles away so food etc. is easy to get from here. This place has it all

Reviews.Title: “We had so much fun!”
Reviews.Author: ctet0731
Reviews.Content: There is so much to do at this resort that there is no need to leave! We had breakfast by the pool and the food was fabulous! The kids loved the water slide. It was hours and hours of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Place away from Disney crowds... Avoid Timeshare Presentation”
Reviews.Author: RileyPA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel as part of a "Timeshare" offer. First let me start by saying AVOID the TIMESHARE pitch. The excutive sales person we had intially was rude and horrible, he became very aggitated when we began to ask questions. We had to ask for a manager due to his behavior. The corporate manager was much nicer and we got all of our questions answered. We did end up purchasing 700 pts for $1645 (roughly 2 resorts stays, week each in Hawaii & New York or Vegas) to sort of test drive the timeshare offer with no strings attached. THE RESORT - We had a very, very nice one bedroom villa with a full kitchen, livingroom area and an amazing bathroom. The pool was wonderful, we rented a cabana for a day and literally stayed at the pool the entire day. The food & drinks on the resort are super pricey and not that good. Go to the local grocery store. We did have one incident in which housekeeping missed our room and it took 3 calls and a full hour before I got the front desk to simply send clean towels to our room. No compensation for the inconvenience. The hotel is away from all the hustle and bustle of Disney and the popular attractions, and unfortunately the resort is not nearly completed, so there isn't much to do on the resort it self, but we rented a car and that helped a lot. Overall the hotel itself is very nice, modern and clean, but lacks a lot of things a resort should have still.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel , clean and great pool”
Reviews.Author: TheGirls17
Reviews.Content: Finally getting around to reviewing the hotels my wife and i stayed at on our Wedding/Honeymoon trip visiting USA, Canada and Mexico from Australia ! We stayed here a few nights, was a little tricky to find as the navigation system in the hire car had not been updated!! Check in was fine but i also think the one and only time we saw hotel staff , which was kind of weird. The room was nice clean and new and nice big bathroom . Was nice to have a mini kitchen that we used a little after being on the road for 7 weeks was nice to cook some toast ! The pool was big and plenty of room for people with kids and those with out . We visited the local attractions and really enjoyed our time in Orlando ! I would highly recommend this hotel , prob more for famlies than for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort Experience”
Reviews.Author: MissMoorea
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first stay at Parc Soleil and we loved it so much that we can't wait to go back in November. We are accustomed to high-end travel and this resort property did not disappoint us in any way. We booked a 1 BR thru a HGVC promotional deal and stayed 4 days/3 nights and we can't say enough about Parc Soleil. The suite was spacious and well appointed; the amenities and activities were plentiful and well-designed; the staff was friendly; garage parking was NOT an issue and the location is ideal - private yet covenient. We watched fireworks at Seaworld from our huge balcony; watched family movies poolside on a big screen; sipped Starbucks and nibbled on delicious pastries in the gourmet marketplace and strolled the gorgeous grounds. Sure, our room wasn't made up until the late afternoon but who cares? We spent the entire day out of our room on outdoor activities. At night, we dined out at our favorite local restaurants - all just minutes away - and came back to rent recent movies on DVD for $3 in the activity center, go for a late night swim, etc. This resort is fantastic in every way!

Reviews.Title: “We wanted more time!!!”
Reviews.Author: vacationjulia
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Parc Soleil was fantastic. We had a one bedroom penthouse suite that was out of this world. The bathroom had a color TV that could be viewed while preparing for the day or soaking in the tub. The most different feature of the room was the water to the soaking tub came out of the ceiling. Cool!!! The people were so nice and hospitable that we tried to spend extra days but as luck would have it, there was a convention in town and therefore was there was no more room in the inn. I know you will enjoy your time in Orlando and we plan to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel,but..”
Reviews.Author: ES727
Reviews.Content: they need a nice restaurant on site, it is very far removed from anything you have to have a car. They do have a pool restaurant which is very nice, but they need an actual real restaurant for adults. The units themselves are very nice, beautiful wood floors and very spacious. I think we like being more in the middle of the action, but if you are a traveling family I could see why you would stay here. The main pool is very nice but extremely crowded, they showed movies at the pool which everyone seemed to enjoy. It was very nice facility, but I prefer a resort than a timeshare style

Reviews.Title: “SOOOOO GLAD we decided to stay at THIS LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Mr-N-MrsNash
Reviews.Content: First off my husband and I were there celebrating our 4th year anniversay! Parc Soleil is a beautiful resort of Hiltons!!! Randy checked us in and he was very hospitable, very informative, and funny! The resort is very pretty and really clean! The grounds are gorgeous and the employees are extremely courteous and helpful. The pool is really neat and its heated to 85 degrees year round. One side of it is like a beach. It doesn't have any stairs. Two sides does have stairs and then there is a big slide. There are two pools and two hot tubs. They have activities for the kids and adults at the pool. They also put up a big movie screen and played different kid friendly movies. We did have to attend a time share presentation but our guy wasn't pushy at all. We truly enjoyed ourselves! I think you and your special someones will as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be coming back!”
Reviews.Author: travaholic
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights at this resort and will definitely look into staying again. We usually stay on Disney property for our Orlando trips, but were also visiting other parks this time, and decided that this was a central location. You can't get much more central - Downtown Disney, Epcot, Animal Kingdom, Magic Kingdom, Hollywood Studios, Sea World, Universal and Outlet shopping all within 3-10 miles. We stayed in a Studio room (11th Floor) with 1 King Bed which included a kitchenette - small refrigerator, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, sink, silverware, dishes, and glasses. The "very" large bathroom had a standup shower and no tub. There was definitely enough room in the bathroom that they could have added a tub or at least a bigger shower with some shelving (no where to put soaps / shampoos but little 5" metal shelf). The studio rooms do not have balconies, but we had a very nice view of the Parc Lake / Jogging Path which looks straight out to Magic Kingdom. You can see the nightly fireworks at Magic Kingdom. The (2) pools are very nice, anyone with kids will enjoy the slide that is located in the larger pool. We did not utilize the restaurant, marketplace, charcoal grills, laundry facilities, fitness center, playground, basketball court, or tennis courts, but did use the computer rooms, internet service, pool table, ping pong table, Wii game system and the game room board games. The facility is gated and parking is free. The housekeeping staff was very nice and kept us well supplied with shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion. We booked this room as a package through Priceline.com and were not charged any additional fees upon our checkout. Will most definitely be visiting this resort again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotels but not the service I expected from a Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_South_Florida
Reviews.Content: Our Reservations Specialist was friendly and said our personal concierge would greet us when we arrived and have a welcome package for us. When we got there the staff had no idea what I was talking about. They sent us over to the concierge desk where there were 4 workers standing around who greeted us but told us only one person could help us. I waited 20 minutes before leaving to go park my car. When I got back she was still working with the same couple. When I was finally able to talk to her the prices she gave us for park tickets and dinner shows were higher that what I could get on my own over the internet. They have lots of great activities scheduled but the problem is they don't start them on time (usually 30 to 40 minutes late) or they just cancel them saying there are not enough people. The suites are very nice looking but somethings are just for the looks like the tub in the master bathroom with the water coming down from the ceiling (it just splashes everywhere.) We had a problem trying to get the expresso machine to work and they said they would send someone right away. After 45 minutes I called them again because we needed to leave and they asked us to wait just a few minutes and they would send someone right now. They sent a nice, helpful teenage boy from housekeeping but he had no idea how to use the machine and asked me where the instruction manuel was which was not in the suite. He made a call and finally determined it was broken. The pool area is great and we spent a lot of time there. They have a very nice cafe at the pool, but need to cleen the patio area to get all the ketchup and food off the walkway around the pool. Overall we really loved our stay and would go back again. I just was surprised that the quality of the service was not what I would expect from a Hilton Hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: tnightgirl
Reviews.Content: I normally stay in busier areas when i travel, but ORL can really get on my nerves with people and traffic so this time, I chose a place a little more isolated...neeed the down time! Really nice pool, clean rooms and I did not have one, but would recommend you get a balcony...so you can take in the fireworks view at night. WARNING: if you are staying here and participating in the timeshare presentations, beware of the salesperson named Gary "??". He is a very large man and you cannot miss him, but he is really rude and seems to be taking the slow sales out on the participants. I filed a complaint, which i never do, but he was just a bit too much and not what you would expect at a hilton.

Reviews.Title: “OVERALL: NOT SATISFACTORY”
Reviews.Author: DarkChocolateandWine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parc Soleil on our visit to Orlando, our intentions were to visit the Disney World and Universal Studios parks (all of them are in a 15 - 20 minute drive). At our arrival the Hotel facilities exceded our expectations, since we had read the Hotel was located on a isolated area and far from being finished, and to our suprise YES the hotel is located in an unconcluded area but is only a 3 min. drive from many restaurants and populated areas ... anyways the Hotel´s charm lasted only a few hours... Day after day we kept getting awfull service that ruined our overall experience, here I name a few of the Hotel´s flaws: 1. On our second day, we left the Hotel around 11.30 am and came back at 12.30 am to find our room not cleaned by housekeeping, when we complained to the front desk (which answered after 3 phone calls) they told us that MAYBE we left the "do not disturb" sign on the door... which we DID NOT... and if we had left it on it would still be there when we came back.... obviously it was NOT. 2. Anyways we needed to take a shower since the days over there are incredible hot, but we did not have clean towels since the hotel bathroom does not have towel hangers, you are forced to leave your towels on the floor... so on the same phone call we asked for clean towels and receive them 1.5 HOURS AND 3 ANGRY PHONE CALLS LATER... by then it was around 2.00 am and we were incredibly tired... NOT A NICE EXPERIENCE 3. The shower floor is made of a rough tile which makes it very dificult to clean, and HAIR stays stuck in between them, I noticed that on my second shower and I seriously doubt those hairs where mine or my husbands, also the drain cap is all rusted and uneven... NOT ACCEPTABLE. 4. The hotel does not offer room service. 5. The hotel offers a shuttle that leaves several times a day to the different theme parks, but when we wanted to sign on to the 10.45 am shuttle, the concierge assured my husband he could only make his reservation at 8.00 am that morning (what´s the point of going on the 10.45am shuttle if you have to be at the reception at 8.00 am making your reservation?) anyways we did the reservation at 10.00 am and there was no problem... why did the concierge wanted us tu be at the lobby at 8.00 am? .... The shuttle service van was awfully smelly and the driver in a horrible mood... I hope the Hotel reads this review and take some actions to improve their customer service because it´s a nice Hotel with brand new facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start, but overall nice stay”
Reviews.Author: disneygoof1966
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Parc Soleil. Our check in started off rocky as our room was not ready when we said we'd be arriving. We left, came back a couple hours later, waited some more and it still was not ready at the stated check in time. We ended up with a handicapped room, which was less than ideal, but workable. The downside to the handicapped rooms are the counter heights and the bath arrangements. The roll-in shower left the bath floor a mess (curtain, not door covered the shower) which meant daily laundry to keep up with the towels. I like to cook even on vacation, but the handicapped rooms have the microwave on the counter so there is minimal counter space and working on low counters in hard on the back. Thankfully, those were really our only significant complaints - and if you're handicapped even those aren't negative! We had a lot of rain this trip so we did spend time in the room relaxing and had plenty of space to spread out. There was a DVD player in the living room. Internet worked well the majority of the time. We did spend some time at the pool and love the poolside restaurant bar - enjoy a bite to eat and a drink with the kids enjoy a swim. King bed in the master bedroom was very comfortable as was the sofa bed (memory foam mattress). Parc Soleil is a little off the main streets near Disney/Universal so I'd suggest having a car if you're staying here. Oh - it does have the BEST smelling garage I've ever been in! The grills for the restaurant must vent into the parking garage - yum! They do have limited parkng for taller vehicles in the garage area. There is outside parking as well. It did get a little frustrating to pull into the garage and find a mini-cooper parked in the large-vehicle section of the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: goldigwife
Reviews.Content: My husband had a convention in Orlando and I wanted a long weekend away with kids just to play and that is exactly what we did. The pool was fantastic and in fact, the kids and I never left the property for 4 days. Loved the fun kid activities and games at the pool (zero entry good for 2yr and slide ideal for 6yr) and the 1BR suite was nicely appointed and clean. Wish the service at the cafe/ around the pool had been better, but their loss as I would have consumed many more pina coladas if someone had just come around and asked! The "upgraded view of the fireworks" is not worth it and a bit of a scam...basically charging you more for a worse view of abandoned development. Stick with the standard pool view. We were not hassled by time-shares people though they did call and attempt to set up an appointment. Parking was tight but convenient. We’ll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: pia55555
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a beautiful 2 bedroom suite. Clean, spacious, well stocked. Close to DW. Loved the “Swim in movie”. Only negative was the restaurant. They do cal to get you to attend a time share meeting, which we did; however, I think if you say you are not interested, they will stop.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book a studio or fall for timeshare deal!”
Reviews.Author: RachelleJacksonville
Reviews.Content: Hilton Vacation Market contacted me in effort to sell a three night stay at the Parc Soleil. The representative advised me that we would have a one bedroom suite that we had 6 months to book, however when I went to book the one bedroom suite the representative told me that the offer was only good for a studio. ( That should have been my first alarm ). Our vacation was sceduled and pre-paid from Thursday to Sunday, but we due to my husband's work schedule we arrived early Friday morning around 9:00 A.M. We thought that our room would be ready because we were a day late, however Randy from the frony desk advised us that they were 100% booked up and did not put us into a room until 1:00. I did not understand how they were 100% booked the day before because we were scheduled and paid for the day before but did not show up until the next morning. When we checked into the studio, it was nothing like the pictures that were taken of the suites. It is extremely bare and there is only a shower and no carpet. ABSOLUTELY NO FRILLS. I expected that this time-share would have at least each room would have a bathtub. We were so upset with the entire process that we went through with this resort, that we decided to forfiet the pre-payment and we booked another hotel that treated us great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay....with a few glitches.”
Reviews.Author: Coachk2001
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed here at this hotel for the first week in July. We choose this hotel because of the great deal online and the recent reviews on Tripadvisor. It was a great suite for a family of three (We have a 15 month old). So why the great stay, the room was very clean and the staff on arrival was amazing, pleasant greetings and welcomes by both the front staff and the person manning the gate. We had a fireworks view, which was awesome but the fireworks are very very far away (keep that in mind). The pool was very big and actually very nice! The negative.......First off if you plan on going to diseny world then expect to drive at least 15-20 to any of the parks or to Disney in general and that's with a rental car. Having a child that needed an afternoon nap, it was hard to go back and forth to theme parks. Second, after the second day at this hotel I received a phone call from a hotel representative asking how things were, if I was liking my stay, etc.... and then a solicitation to check out the timeshare (the guy was so nice, I felt really guilty to say no, even though I didn't want to sit through a 90 minute seminar, WITH my 15 MONTH OLD!, or the medicore gifts in return). Lastly our room was not cleaned until at least 5pm every day and the parking lot is very tight and at night over crowded.

Reviews.Title: “A Refuge Away from the Disney Bustle”
Reviews.Author: TheCurtos
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to the Parc Soleil, and we consider it a true resort. While Hilton hopes to sell these units, there is no timeshare presentation or pressure. This property is near the end of Palm Parkway at the Lake Buena Vista exit on I-4. It's near everything you need including the Disney parks, but it's set apart from the crowds and the noise. We have always stayed in the 1 bedroom suite which includes a full kitchen, washer/dryer, sofa bed, balcony [with table and chairs], bathroom with glass enclosed shower and separate tub], and a separate bedroom. The rooms have been exceptionally clean, daily housekeeping is available, and all kitchen items are provided including dishwasher soap. High-speed internet is complimentary. The parking building is adequate, well-lighted, and easily accessible. The highlight is the extensive pool area. There is a main pool and an adult pool that is completely separate and peaceful. Jacuzzis abound, the on-site restaurant has great food, and there is a daily schedule with events for kids and adults. Extreme attention is paid to the lush landscaping throughout the property. We hope you will enjoy this resort as much as we have.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful rooms and property”
Reviews.Author: suzie072
Reviews.Content: On our trip to Orlando we stayed at the Hilton parc soleil. First impression is dat it is a big hotel but we also saw that they have building plans in the area. Now it was plenty of room at the pool, well maintened and very nice with the slide. The children loved it. The room, a two bedroom suite was big and really good for us as a family with two teenagers. We loved our stay and we would love to get back. You would only find a problem there... How to get there the first time. It is not easy to find because your satnav won't know the adres. we find it with the name of the main road (desforges av. is just the road at the resort) i believe that was Park av. Enjoy, we did!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel abd great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Yolandil
Reviews.Content: New hotel about 10km's from Disney World. Stayed in King room with sleeper couch. Unit had everything needed. Kitchen with all appliances, crockery, oven, stove, microwave, dishwasher and even a blender. Washing machine and dryer. Hotel even supplies washing powder and dishwashing soap. Nice big bathroom. Sleeper couch when folded out is bigger as a king size bed. Free wi-fi. TV in each room with over 100 channels to choose from. Safe pool with slippy slide for kids. Will definetely go again. Around the corner from a huge Walmart. For the rate you pay each day and what you get, its cheaper to stay here than at your own home!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel !”
Reviews.Author: ChristianBelgium
Reviews.Content: Very nice , clean hotel. Location is perfect , close to everything. Great pool , nice spacious suites .Friendly and helpfull staff. Would go back !

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lyessouk
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, staff very friendly and helpful, I recommend this hotel to families who would like to have a perfect holiday. Just make sure to have a car, the bus is not very convenient around Parc Soleil.

Reviews.Title: “An overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: LtotheG
Reviews.Content: I have both a teenager and a toddler so I need a wide variety of ammenities. We are Hilton Grand Vacation owners and have been to many Hilton properties. This one was certainly nice but there are opportunities to make this better. The dining options are limited. The pool is fantastic for young ones and older ones alike. The bartenders and wait staff are REALLY good. The check in folks I have mixed opinions- the check in guy really nice, the check out gal not so much. I know it is a toss up with vacation ownership whether or not you get some sort of cleaning service- we did not get any for our entire stay so that was sorta a bummer. Activities were not publicized good enough - maybe if they were there would be greater participation, but nevertheless they had organized activities daily which was nice. They had a playground for the lil ones that not once did I see a kid playing on. Other properties nearby (Renissance, Clarion to name a couple) had play areas that were like little waterparks. I would have loved to have seen this here. But I cant complain- this was just a nice property that would really be fantastic with a few enhancements.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: FussyO
Reviews.Content: A fantastic place to stay, we were so impressed with the level of customer service. For instance when we arrived we parked our car and walked accross the massive car port to the reception area and a member of Hilton staff walked toward us waving her arms and saying 'oh there you are, have you parked your car?' I thought that she had got the wrong people but it turns out that when you give your name at the gate they communicate this to the reception staff and this is the welcome you get. I can't describe how lovely this greeting made us feel after such a long journey. The hotel is 1st class but not stuffy, the room was gorgeous - we had the large studio (lock-off) with kitchette, we slept like babies on a massive bed. The pools were exceptional. The cabana's with the fans were beyond wonderful and as you can tell I cannot imagine anything more to add to this hotel experience apart from someone actually carrying me out of bed and onto the sunbed each day!! There is a 'busy' pool and a quiet one. 6 hot tubs. Full entertainment programme. Gorgeous 'park' area for you to walk around with piped music. Barbeque areas. Everthing! Add to this that your fellow holiday makers are friendly and sociable and I really dont know what else you could want. We were lucky enough to get this on a really good deal through ebookers. We would like to say a very special thank you to the hotel manager Jeff Mance for his time and kind assistance on a personal issue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JellyDonuts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my wife and 7-year-old son and 5-year-old daughter in June 2011. Arrived early for check-in and were given complimentary drink passes for the bar while we enjoyed the pool. Room was fantastic but wasn't cleaned until 4-5 pm everyday which was only a problem on one day in which we stayed and enjoyed pool rather than visit the parks. Activity staff is great - my kids enjoyed all the fun games and the activity room where they could spend time playing pool, ping pong, and the Wii. Pool also has a water slide which kept them entertained for hours. Restaurant is good and reasonable but understaffed and while the servers are pleasant and nice, service is slow. Be prepared for the timeshare push when checking in. We had already purchased park tickets prior to arriving and they seem deflated to hear that as they don't offer anything else (like a discounted stay) for your time. They will also call your room daily encouraging you to attend a presentation - we just unplugged the phone on the 2nd day. People complain that the hotel is in the middle of nowhere. If you have rented a car, it is 5 minutes to Downtown Disney and restaurants - yes, it would be a far walk anywhere and I can't comment on their shuttle service. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will book here again next year...

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Do your research beforehand if offered a voucher.”
Reviews.Author: SyracuseGirl1981
Reviews.Content: We agreed to stay for $99 for 3 nights w/a $99 voucher once we sat through the timeshare spiel. This hotel is beautiful! We arrived early (before noon) and had no problem getting into our room. We had the wraps in the cafe and thought they were great. I ordered a bagel one morning and the woman was too foreign to understand that I said veggie cream cheese-- it didn't ruin my day but make sure you check your order. My husband ordered a breakfast sandwich and it was huge & tasty. We also jogged around the lake one day, which was nice not to have to leave the resort. No, you can't WALK to Disney from here but there are a lot of little plazas full of restaurants/bars/shops within a mile from the hotel. We went to Walmart, about 4 miles up the road. Sand Lake Rd has a lot of restaurants/bars. Bring a tervis tumbler to keep your drinks cold...it get HOT out at that pool. Someone wrote a review saying the bugs were too annoying to even read a book while sitting at the pool.... I noticed later in the week, the bugs did get annoying. BUT-- we drove to Daytona the next day and the bugs were insane!! --Apparently Florida has a week or 2 where "love bugs" come out early morning and die out around 3pm. All the cars who took the highway were plastered with them. I will definitely not come to Florida during April again, for that reason but I'm a bug-a-phobic. They really weren't that bad in Orlando, though. The waterslide is fun for all ages :) As for the timeshare presentation-- it is very convincing. Just a heads up-- if you were promised a $99 voucher, you need to know RIGHT AFTER the timeshare presentation on WHICH Hilton hotel you want to use it at. It MUST be used in the US (no Canada). We chose Embassy Suites, and wished we hadn't because these are rare in NY State. Do some research before you go. The voucher is actually a mail-in-rebate. You have to pay to stay and then you mail in your receipt. All in all- I would totally recommend this hotel. The suites were very nice! Any questions, feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: shhhzaammm
Reviews.Content: Reserved a penthouse room. When we arrived we were told that none were available and that although we reserved specifically that room level (a 1 bedroom) that it was subject to availability. Subject to availability? What!???!!! So we got a one bedroom one a lower floor w/o the "perks" of the penthouse suites. That was going to be my sanity. Kids would have fun at disney but at least I would get to appreciate a fine room on the top floor. That wasn't the case. We were charged less of course-the standard rate of the lower room. But we wanted and reserved a penthouse room for the view-"the fireworks view". And we learned its not even all that anyway b/c the hotel is too far away to appreciate the fireworks (see them yes, appreciate no) Very surprised at this hotel. We are not snobs and we grudeingly stayed in the lower room category but I expected more from Hilton. This is a Hilton, you should be treated well-but not here I think b/c it's a time share building and they do not have to live up to the standards of other Hiltons. Note that we are Hilton honors gold status members and we use the Hilton Amex card. Meaningless here. Oh, and the "want to buy a time share thing" was insulting. BOTTOM LINE-DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU ARE EXPECTING A HILTON EXPERIENCE. YOU CAN'T BOOK A ROOM TYPE AND THEN TELL THE CUSTOMER ITS NOT AVAILABLE-"SORRY FOR YOUR LUCK" ESSENTIALLY. THAT IS NOT A HOTEL. THAT IS A TIME SHARE COMEDY TO WHICH I'M SHOCKED HILTON HAS LOWERED THEMSELVES TO. I WILL BE CONTACTING HILTON.

Reviews.Title: “Don’t repeat my mistake – DO NOT STAY HERE. This place is horrible and in the middle of nowhere. Do not be fooled”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRucinski
Reviews.Content: Forget the photos on Tripadvisor - your room will look nothing like this. The so called “studio” is bare bones. You get half a window which DOESN’T OPEN and NO BALCONY !! Thus, you don’t have access to fresh air. The air conditioning in the ”studio” is so loud that I couldn’t sleep for 2 nights… Location: It’s literally close to nothing. There is nothing in walking distance. And there are thousands of disgusting bugs everywhere. You cannot read even one page of the book at the pool because you keep killing bugs. It’s really disgusting. One more thing: forget that nice bathtub with the ceiling faucet they show you - not available in the Studio. Overall: it is 3-star hotel at most, but the studio room is definitely no more than 2 stars. Do not be fooled. Move on in your search. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Luna526
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our honeymoon, and we're quite happy with this place. Staff are very nice and helpful, parking and Internet are free, and the bed is comfortable. They also upgraded our room for the same rate. However, there are a couple things that could be improved. We have a small kitchen in our room, and the smoke alarm is way too sensitive. It went on even when we used the toaster!! It's good to know that the smoke alarm is working, but what's point of giving people a kitchen when they can't use it? Also, the hairdryer in our room makes loud clicking sound, which makes me doubt the safety of the thing. Towel rack is small and doesn't fit more than one towel. Although we feel like recycling our towels, we have to change them everyday since there are no place to hang and dry them.

Reviews.Title: “Remember, it's a timeshare”
Reviews.Author: former_RX
Reviews.Content: This timeshare resort is a great site for your young family. If not an owner, you can still book as a guest via Hilton's website. We stayed 7 nights in a one bedroom suite on the 14th floor of Tower 100. And as a timeshare, there aren't usual hotel services: valet, daily housekeeping, and room service. Instead you get an upscale apartment with contemporary furnishings, washer/dryer, and no resort fees. We liked that it's in the middle of nowhere and away from i-Drive and Hotel Plaza Blvd. I echo the positive comments written by others, and wish to add a few things. - Housekeeping will come clean you your 4th day, if on a 7 night stay. - The garage is floors 1 to 3, so your car is protected from the hot Florida sun. You find the luggage cart and take your bags yourself to your room. - The water slide is supervised, and there's a video monitor at the top to let you know the bottom area is clear to begin your slide. - Request a room with the pool view, instead of the fireworks view. - If your departure is late in the day, you can store your bags at the Bell Desk. The second pool has lockers and a shower if you wish to still swim on your last day. Since checkout is 10:00am, there's a published price to extend: $25 until noon, $50 until 2:00pm, and full day price if until after 2:00pm.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: Pastyp
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed here last summer. I meant to write a glowing review of this property on our return but that got lost in the daily grind. However I was again pleasantly reminded of this property when I got an offer email from them recently - unfortunately no trip back planned this year, but definitely again in the future. But I had to ad my praises to all others on this site. Parc Soleil Hilton is a diamond in the rough, because as many reviewers have mentioned the two buildings that are currently built were meant to be part of a much larger project that seems to have faltered due presumably to the recent financial downturn. However you can be assured that the two towers that are finished and the surrounding pool area are fantastic! So what you may ask is the 'rough'. Well it's not as bad as you may be thinking - the rough is the surrounding plots where the remaining tours are to be built. On approach to the hotel you pass through this area and it is a little disconcerting. But that is all forgotten when you arrive in the finished part of the complex. Honestly this did not encroach at all on the enjoyment of the complex and apartment for us. Once in the complex the plots for the other towers are not evident or relevant. The complex should have been centered around a lake, the two existing towers are located to the end of this finished lake - but even so the lake area makes for a nice running/walking track and view from the balcony. We found the hotel complex to be the perfect location and distance to the parks, attractions and shopping (both food and outlet shops). Yes it is off the main drag of International Drive, but having stayed on International Drive before this is no bad thing. International Drive can be a little ‘tacky’. This hotel is away from the hustle and bustle and has quick and direct access to the interstate when trips to the parks or further afield are needed. In reality International Drive is only 5-10 minutes drive away anyway – if you really must! I did read a review that criticized the garage – I can’t understand this criticism as the garage was large with many spaces, easy to navigate and had quick direct access to the main building – what more could you want??? People who can’t park properly, i.e. taking up two spaces, is hardly the fault of the hotel. The quality and size of the apartments themselves can only be described as suitably American in scale. Myself and my wife looked forward to returning to the spacious, cool, comfortable apartment each night after long days in the parks. The apartments are practically new, so the quality and finish of the furniture was top notch. The apartments are equipped with a large, quality kitchen with all mod cons. We found stocking up at the beginning of the holiday gave us alternatives to eating out on any evening we were too tired to venture out. There is a large supermarket about 5-10 minutes drive away that has everything you could need. The dining area had a full size dinner table and six chairs. The main bedroom is spacious and comfortable with a large king sized bed. Bathroom was spacious with both a bath and shower unit and separate toilet - do you get the large spacious vibe - I'll stop with it now :) suffice to say that a family of two adults and two kids would be well catered for here. Also to mentioned - two flat screen TVs with a plethora of stations to keep tired kids entertained when needed. Only one down side was that we couldn’t use the balcony. The aforementioned lake nearby during the summer months did seem to bring out a larger than usual amount of mosquitoes – even for Florida. So sitting sipping wine on the balcony was a no, no for me – but again this wasn’t a huge thing for us. For as usual, mosquitoes only really a problem at sun down and sun up – during the day by the pool, no problem – especially for my Irish skin which usually attracts them from miles around. The pool area has the main pool with kids slides and pool side bar/restaurant serving decent food and at a reasonable price. There is however to one end a smaller adult pool with sun shielding cabanas for my pale Irish skin! Waiters made regular tours around, so need to budge from the cabana for food or drinks if you don’t want to. One point that I talked to management about was the piped music around the pool - was loud a little harsh at times - they politely turned this down, only to be chastised by another guest who wanted it back up again - horses for courses! In summary, I will be booking here again when we hopefully return to Florida for holidays. Having stayed in a few hotels in and around the Orlando area - for the quality, comfort, location and value for money – I wouldn’t consider anywhere else better. This is the best recommendation I can give Parc Soleil. Yes the complex is yet to be finished and yes it is off the usual drag but as mentioned the quality of the finished complex is such that the former is not a concern and few people holiday in Florida without a car so the later should be a non issue as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Mike1664
Reviews.Content: Facilities are great and the majority of staff are excellent are clearly take a pride in their job. Our niggle was that when we had an issue the two reception staff spoken to, were totally disinterested, so whilst we would stay there again there is still work to ensure standards stay high.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable & suited our every needs!”
Reviews.Author: querida31
Reviews.Content: It was my 1st trip to Disney World! and being a newly wed couple we wanted a hotel that was away from the hustle and bustle of the parks yet somewhere near enough that we can access all the parks and this was it! the location was no more than 10/15 from each park in a car & this hotel is very comfy and convenient! The hotel grounds are very clean! Which is a big deal for me.. and the pools and hot tubs were amazing after a long day of walking around and touring. This hotel felt more like an apt- so much like a home away from home and the staff were all so courteous! We recommend this hotel for families, singles, and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Fabulous rooms and facilities for families”
Reviews.Author: Vantort
Reviews.Content: Rooms are fantastic for families with good space, a well equiped kitchen and comfy beds. Good location convenient for Disney with good shops and restaurants a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: fabdiners
Reviews.Content: Nice resonably new resort for HGVC but a little soulless. Not a great atmosphere but I guess when it's finished (re: further development) it may get a bit better. Good location though for access to Disney etc. Would benefit from a better restaurant though. The suite was nice but already starting to deteriorate with damage/wear to flooring and some of the kitchen units. HGVC members beware - maintenance fees with skyrocket if inner furnishings are not better considered "at all resorts" for longevity!!!! Kitchen was well fitted out though with gadgets for everything. We didn't manage to sit outside on the balcony due to the huge amount of wasps flying about, unfortunately no mesh screen to protect us from insects. This is very unusual for Florida properties!!!! Don't think I will return to this resort though. Not great Hilton - disapppointing overall.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Carameltwist
Reviews.Content: Hilton makes good on their name.Beautiful from beginning to end! We had a two bedroom suite for a party of three.Color scheme gorgeous.Tub in master bath- water sprout comes from the ceiling. Kitchen has everything you would need to prepare a gourmet meal. WoW! No complaints, Everyone was very helpful! Will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Suite”
Reviews.Author: Arminlz
Reviews.Content: Very clean and spacious suite. Nice, new, and beautiful property. Very close to Sea World and Discovery Cove. We stayed in one bedroom suite, the kitchen was so nice and equipped with everything even washer and dryer. Great place to stay in Orlando for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet and good service”
Reviews.Author: Travelqueen37215
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our visit to Parc Soleil and had a wonderful time. My husband and I are very experienced travelers and usually stay in upscale resorts. I cannot understand what any one could write about that is negative regarding this resort. From the smiling bellhop who took our luggage at 8:30 am and stored it in our room for the day while we went to Universal, to the beautiful pools and rooms, the resort and its staff were totally gracious. Regarding other complaints on this website--those of you staying in studio units really should not complain about no balcony--the studios are lovely and well equipped and really rate much higher in quality than a hotel room. Anyone who complains that their dishes were not done or there was no dishwasher soap is just plain lazy. When you stay at a resort with a kitchen you are basically renting a condo or a home--do your own dishes! As far as the location is concerned--we loved it. Five minutes from Seaworld, 10-12 minutes to Universal and 15 minutes to Disney. Wonderful to get back and sit on the balcony overlooking the pool instead of a restaurant parking lot on International Drive. After reading previous reviews I have decided that some people just cannot be pleased no matter how hard others try.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Northerner who lives in the south
Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms, Easy to manage and QUIET!!”
Reviews.Author: Momof2andawife
Reviews.Content: We took our children to Orlando to see Disney and Universal ONLY because I received one of those phone calls to visit this location. I tried to wiggle out of it by asking for a two bedroom two bath unit, but of course they could accomodate me and BOY did they!! It was a fabulous room at a fabulous price. We were comfortable and relaxed our entire time there. We never had an issue with parking, noise or cleanliness. Quiet is important to me while in Orlando because every sense we have is attacked at these parks, so I never opt to stay on the properties. We always look for space and typically stay in another suite hotel. The only negative was that when we went to the sales pitch the people were so rude! They said, "we will take your name off our lists and never call you again." So, we said, "okay." I mean, we are not going to be bullied to buy something. What is really funny is that within a few months I had another offer from them for another location. There was still construction going on, but I can tell you this property definitely caught our eye! In addition, the timeshare opps were very intriguing. If you can stay here do---the newness, space of units and QUIET will do you well. My one other teeny tiny complaint is that the check in process was odd. It took a minute to find the people and then it was very self service! :) We did not swim, but the pools were lovely. We found food along the way and the kitchens were spacious, so meal prep was easy.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved every moment of it”
Reviews.Author: Alok42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the one bedroom suite in this hotel. It was amazing. The rooms were huge. The amenities top notch. Parking was very convenient. Infact it was on the same floor of our room. The location of this hotel is also very good. They had a small grocery store inside the hotel which was very convenient. Everything is included in the room price. The parking, internet, etc etc. Very good lake views from our room. Food was a bit disappointing. Pool was very good and their activity center for children was also very good. Overall a great property for family holiday. Will definitely want to stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fun to be had away from the theme parks”
Reviews.Author: jvargas92
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for her birthday. The convenience of being near the theme parks - but not directly outside them - made our day trip to Epcot an easy ride and one that allowed us to return home without hitting any major traffic. Even if we hadn't gone to Epcot we could have stayed here and enjoyed the large main pool and slide as well as the smaller pool and hot tub nearby. Because everything in Orlando is easy to get to we were able to meet up with local friends for lunch and dinner plans and enjoy a few evenings out at nearby restaurants. The resort is relatively new so when you go to your room it feels like you are the first person to ever stay there. Our bathroom has a gorgeous soaking tub that had a ceiling faucet. It was a very nice aesthetic. The staff were incredibly helpful with our assistance requests and really made the stay relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: tigerllili
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week and it was truely a lovely experience. The staff was friendly, helpful and went out of their way to make you feel welcomed. I rooms were spacious with beautiful views and they even included a small spotless kitchenette. The pools were delightful and never over crowded. We would fully reccomend staying here and the price through hotmail was amazing!!! We only paid $90 after taxes and fees.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ejandlouise
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Orlando. We had a 1 room suite for us and the kids and my parents had a room with a small kitchen. The 1 room suite was the size of some flats in England. The bathroom was amazing with two sinks, huge walk in shower and free standing bath. We couldn't work out how to fill the bath but then discovered a hole in the ceiling. The water came from there and the kids thought this was very exciting. The kitchen had everything you could need and the appliances were of fantastic quality. There was even a mini laundry room. Everything was really clean. The view was towards disney and you could see the fireworks at night time. The view is over empty ground which a couple of reviews were not so keen on. We were out all day so it didn't bother us. The lobby was very spacious and the staff were very welcoming and helpful. We purchased disney tickets from them so as to avoid the lines at the park. The pool area was great and my parents spent an afternoon relaxing while we did the parks. The prime outlets was a succesfull shopping trip for them. We had a great stay and will def be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great pool, would love to come back”
Reviews.Author: RooRoo8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc Soleil for 3 nights following a stay at Disney - this was to be the 'quiet' part of our trip after lots of running around. We booked a one bedroom suite and got a discount for sitting through their 2 hour timeshare presentation (similar to other timeshare presentations, a really hard sell and the salesman tries to convince you this is the deal of a lifetime - we must be crazy for passing up this investment that you pass onto generations - yeah, no thanks). Back to the hotel. Our suite was beautiful - large living room with a full (eat in) kitchen (granite countertops and stainless steel appliances). Very clean. French doors lead to the king size bedroom. From what I could tell the one bedroom suite costs about $50 more per night than the studio - it is more than twice the size of the studio - and has a balcony (that the studio does not). I think the one bedroom is a much better value than the studio. The pool area is fantastic. Our 6 year old daughter had a great time, loved the water slide. There are also several kids activities in the late afternoon (most cost extra). There is also a separate adult's pool which is a great option to have. We ate dinner twice in the pool side restaurant, I thought the food was good and the prices were reasonable ($8 to $10 for a hamburger with fries, mine was great, I don't eat many hamburgers). Drinks were $8 to $12. There was also a small store next to the restaurant with ready made sandwiches and snacks. We spent much of our time at the pool. Most of the other guests appeared to be families with kids. We really enjoyed our stay here. Presently there are two 'towers' and I believe another 4 are to be built. I sort of wonder once all of those are built if the pool with the water slide might get crowded. Great to have the full kitchen, you can prepare basic meals in your room (we ate breakfast and lunch in our room, saved some $ there). Like any other hotel you can hear noisy neighbors (next door neighbors came back to their room at 1am and heard their loud talking kids for half an hour). The hotel is about a mile from anything which was just fine with me, but you would need a car if you stayed here to get around Orlando. Many major restaurants within a 5 mile drive. There is also free wifi. The staff was all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Family Spot”
Reviews.Author: nsaba
Reviews.Content: Staff- friendly and willing to help Time share- It's Hilton, they are ALWAYS trying to upgrade your time share- my usual response- "I already own time share and I am NOT interested... thank you!" Food- Food at the restaurant was average... just average, nothing impressive- go hungry! Beach/Pool- no beach, the place is in the middle of nothing.... but the pool is great for the little ones- a beach like front (i.e. shallow at the start and gets progressively deeper). Activities- all day activities at the pool and the kid's club keeps the critters happy! Night life- NONE, go to Universal's Boardwalk. Logistics- The building is a high rise with parking on the P1-P3 levels, so it's a lot like staying at a high-rise condo. Shopping- onsite grocery with everything you need and more- prices are set for your convenience! after all you forgot it! so pay the price! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton, Don't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: SeaSpOts1
Reviews.Content: The front staff was less than thrilled to be employed and not at all hospitable. The studio was clean, new and appointed well for a studio but was actually no more than a standard hotel room with a kitchenette and minifridge. The ADA shower shot water across the bathroom and the slow drains allowed the floors to be contantly flooded. The room, being new, stunk of resins, and paint add to that the humidity problem and OMG, just get me out of here. There were no opening windows and the only door opened to an interior lobby-type hall. The pool area and water slides were very nice but we couldn't stand the room or the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family holiday”
Reviews.Author: MartaCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: In spite of being a seemingly efficient conference venue first and foremost - and busy as such - the Hilton Orlando provided me and my family with the perfect holiday experience. Beautiful garden and outdoor facilities, good choice of inhouse restaurants, friendly staff and efficient service granted us a wonderful stay which we all enjoyed. I highly recommend the hotel and would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Second time just as good as first”
Reviews.Author: albertafamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago just after it first opened and I am still impressed with this resort.The major complaint seems to be its location but most people rent a car when in Florida and if you do its no problem. Its only 20 seconds off of Palm Parkway and ten minutes either way to Disney or Universal. There is nothing but open fields surrounding this resort but who cares, your not there to look at a hotel next door and if you want you can request an upgrade to the pool view. Both times we stayed we had a one bedroom suite and the photos on the Hilton website are exactly what you get. The value,amenities and comfort of the suite compared to a regular hotel room can't be beat. I won't look anywhere else when in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY NOT ONE OF ORLANDO'S TOP 20 HOTELS”
Reviews.Author: Jafa22
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Parc Soleil after reading some positive reviews on TripAdvisor. To say that we were disappointed with what we found is an understatement. There is no doubt that we got a good deal but when you pay peanuts you get monkeys. This hotel is no better than a common motel. Sure the rooms are clean, quite new and modern but they are certainly not luxurious. Our main problems with the Parc Soleil were as follows: 1. Despite being a new hotel, the air con is very noisy and even when you turn it off (to try and get some sleep) it still makes a constant noise (which is apparently "the system refilling itself"). Definitely not good. 2. All rooms are adjoining so you CAN hear TVs/children from next door rooms. 3. We were told our first room had "views of the fireworks from Disney". What they failed to tell us was that it also overlooked very ugly wasteland. As this hotel is in the early stages of development - many of the rooms will have views over wasteland. After we complained we were moved to a "pool view" room. It wasn't a whole lot better because the rooms overlooking the pool also overlook the roof of the lower part of the hotels which is similarly ugly and very dirty. There are also no balconies and you cannot open the windows. 4. The water from the taps tastes absolutely disgusting (like pond water) so you will definitely need bottled water. 5. The breakfast restaurant staff were not a very cheery or professional bunch and the breakfasts were decidedly sub-standard and expensive for what you got. Also - no buffet option was available. 6. It is in the middle of nowhere. All in all we didn't really have anything positive to say about the place. If you're used to staying in nice hotels - DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great room, great pool...should be 5 out of 5 but some poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Snellingd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week with my wife and 3yr old daughter. Our one-bedroom suite was perfect for our stay. Well appointed kitchen and plenty space plus our 14th floor balcony had amazing night views of the Disney fireworks. Our welcome was warm from the front desk staff and they made an extra special effort with our daughter without going over the top. The two downsides of our stay were the cafe soleil and housekeeping. Service at the cafe is extremely slow...EVERY time we tried to get a drink or food it took forever. Even trying to get the bill one night took over 20 minutes!! On several occasions our room was not cleaned even though we had been out for most of the day which was a little annoying. Had it not been for these two negatives you can't pick a better hotel to stay with young children, they even blew up a huge screen one evening to show a family movie under the stars by the pool which was a fabulous night. I hope that the negative points we experienced are 'teething problems' which will be easily rectified given that the hotel has only been open for one year.

Reviews.Title: “LIERS !”
Reviews.Author: Yamira_11
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights 5/9 -5/13 with the Promotion for a sale in the resort, The 1 bedroom suite was great, I loved that, the pool is great, love the fact that there are 2 pools, (NOT HEATED) great for all ages, we traveled with a 3 yr old and he absolutely loved the pool. The playgound is ok, and the childrens activity center was ok. I do NOT recomend the only restaurant in the hotel, although we had no choice while out on the pool because it would be too much of a hassel to leave and go buy something in the car. The restaurant is extremely overpriced, the quality of the food was not great, the drinks were not great either. The restaurant's staff is very very slow. In the room our A/C had to be re-set every day while we were there, It was either freezing or too hot, there was no in between !!! the heater turned on if you set the A/C at 73 F !!! We were told the Manager was going to call us back after we left 2 messages, and we are still waiting for a call back ! Housekeeping was very unprofesional and rude, they make lots of noise early in the morning while out in the hallway. But putting all that aside, the resort has great pottential, under the right management> What I can't get over is the LIES... We were promised a voucher if we did the presentation, NEVER gave it to us, "they ran out " They MADE us go to this presentation on our first fullday there, at 8 AM !!! the sales staff were really bad, it was like going to buy a used car, I will never deal with them again ! When we first got this promotion we were told we can use it any time within a year, and that we were guaranteed additional nights to our stay for less that $99.00 a night... It was all a lie ! we paid full price for the additional nights, we had to use the stay by a certain day, Sooo sad that the Hilton has come to this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but you defo need a car to get around!”
Reviews.Author: zahidzafeer
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel in the first week of may 2011. its a great looking hotel, with excellent views of the city and downtown orlando. its a new addition to the hilton hotel chain in orlando. at the moment there are 2 buildings - building 1 and building 2. building 1 has the main reception, lobby area and the business centre. building 2 has the pools, the market/deli place and the fitness gym. we stayed in the king suite on the 4th floor in building 2. the room had the normal amenities, plus washer/ dryer machine, full size fridge, kitchen area, in room safe, microwave, dining table. the hotel also gives complimentary free wifi access to all its rooms. at 9pm every evening, you can view the disney fIreworks from the balcony, in addition to this there are awesome views of the sun setting in the evening! the housekeeping is excellent, room service is carried out everyday at around 10am. they provide extra towels, free washing machine powder, coffee/sugar, soap/shampoo and they provide free usa today newspapers to your room.. all the staff are excellent - reception, housekeeping, market/deli - they all welcome you with a smile. even the staff that you dont normally talk to, they are smile at you when they see you, which is something that cant be said about hotel staff in the uk! to get to the attractions - disney, universal, seaworld. the best and cheapest way is to book a shuttle. it costs $6 per person and they will pick you up from the hotel, drop you off at the attraction and then pick you up from the attraction and drop you off at the hotel in the afternoon/evening. the hotel and shuttle drivers have a timetable which highlights the times of the day that the shuttle picks up and drops off for every attraction. you can book tickets for the attractions at the concierge desk, but they do charge a little more than the face value of the ticket (case in point - i booked 2 5 day passes for disney world at the hotel, they charged me $314 per ticket. at disney world its $237 per person). this is a very clean, spacious hotel. it boasts its own outdoor 'garden' where you can go for walks in the evening - they have outdoor speakers in the 'garden' which plays music. the hotel has 2 seperate bbq areas, it has 2 tennis courts and 2 basketball courts. kids will love the pools that the hotel has, there are 2 main pools and then seperate mini pools. for the kids and (adults!) there is a water slide too. the only downside to this hotel is that it is isolated from local shops and restuarants -apart from the on site market/deli place, there is no other shops where you can shop for food.and also because we didnt have a car, we had to walk for 20 minutes to find the nearest pizza hut! - you can hire a car through the hotel, not too sure how much this is, but if you do then there is free on site parking. overall i would stay at this hotel again, but after they have more local shops around them. if this is to happen then they will be one of the hotels in orlando

Reviews.Title: “King Studio is Claustrophobish, but Pool Was Quite Nice”
Reviews.Author: sparklynails
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel with great pool area. Super clean. King studio was small with no desk, but I had a nice view of the three spaces in the parking garage. If I were paranoid about my car, I could have stared at it from my room. The bathroom just had shower-- and toilets that sound like rockets taking off. I wouldn't stay in that hotel room again, but I might go back for a suite, if I could find it for around $120 or a two bedroom for around $170. Any higher price would be unreasonable because of the horrible location. It's a pain to get to from the parks, and you can't walk to anything. It's supposed to be a non-smoking hotel with only a couple of designated smoking areas, but people smoked where they wanted outside without the staff saying anything. So much for that rule. The store is cute and not overly expensive. They have Staarucks coffee, latte's, etc. The pool was clean and refreshing with little waterfalls, a nice slide, and lots of chairs.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE !! THE WORST 4*HOTEL EVER !!!”
Reviews.Author: Suzzzzi
Reviews.Content: Don’t repeat my mistake – DO NOT STAY HERE. This place is horrible and in the middle of nowhere. Do not be fooled. Forget the photos on Tripadvisor - your room will look nothing like this. The so called “studio” is bare bones. You get half a window which DOESN’T OPEN and NO BALCONY !! Thus, you don’t have access to fresh air. The air conditioning in the ”studio” is so loud that I couldn’t sleep for 2 nights… Moreover, we could hear our neighbors above us, and on either side, as well as loads of hallway noise.. There are NO UPGRADES !!! If you want to change the room, they force you to pay additional money…. $90 per 1 night – sic! So for 2 nights they wanted me to pay $ 180 – just for the upgrade !! They don’t care if you are pregnant or not… I am pregnant – I couldn’t sleep in this room because of the lack of fresh air and very loud AC. They didn’t care… You can pay $180 and the you can change the room.. God ! The standards of the desk staff and management fall short of expectations… The only helpful person in this hotel was a technician who was trying to repair the AC and really wanted to help us when he saw that I’m pregnant. Location: It’s literally close to nothing. There is nothing in walking distance. And there are thousands of disgusting bugs everywhere ☹ You cannot read even one page of the book at the pool because you keep killing bugs. It’s really disgusting. One more thing: forget that nice bathtub with the ceiling faucet they show you - not available in the Studio. Overall: it is 3-star hotel at most, but the studio room is definitely no more than 2 stars. Do not be fooled. Move on in your search. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing property away from theme park craziness”
Reviews.Author: cas1015
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that t we are HGVC members w/ the Parc Soleil being our home resort and we are not a yearly Disney family . It was our first stay at the property and we were thoroughly pleased with our stay. We stayed in a spotless 2BR w/ a pool view (definitely a request worth the wait) . It was large enough for the 6 of us as we utilized the sofa bed). We stayed for 4 days prior to a cruise over Spring Break. The property was completely booked but it really didn't feel like it. There was plenty of room in the beautiful pools and it was fairly easy to find pool chairs. Our children (ages 15, 13, and 11 year old twins) participated in various fun activities which mainly took place at the main pool. They also spent some time in the activity center playing ping pong, shooting pool, and just hanging out w/ new friends. The basketball court is quite a hike however. We didn't eat on premises except for ice cream and wraps from the deli which were just fine. I suppose to some the resort is off the beaten path, but for us we liked not having traffic 24/7 when we ventured out for dinner. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, just not in walking distance. Another plus, covered parking!!! All in all, the Parc Soleil is a nice break from the typical Orlando resort and we are happy we are "owners" here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience.....Beautiful and Friendly Resort....Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tigerpaw93
Reviews.Content: Our family thoroughly enjoyed our experience at this beautiful Hilton Resort. The staff were amazingly friendly and the accomodations were impecable. We stayed in a Two Bedroom Plus (which was a studio joined to a one bedroom villa) and our family of five had more than enough room! Our room was on the end and overlooked the lake and the pool area that had a gazebo type structure above the hot-tub. It was not far from the elevator. I enjoyed cooking good meals for my children with the well-stocked full kitchen. The appliances were like ones that you would have in your own home (or even better.) The appliances were GE Profile. The adjoining room for the children had a mini-kitchen as well. We had lunch one day....pool side....that was fun! The staff always had games and activities planned for the children. The bathrooms were large and beautiful! The master bedroom was huge and tastefully decorated. Our children, as well as the parents, were amazed at the large garden tub that filled by the water that fell from the ceiling. We have never seen something like that before! The showers had two shower heads and were large enough for more than one person. The toilet was located behind a sliding door with plenty of room. The washer and dryer were of compact style, so don't plan on doing large loads at one time. We visited the Universal Studios parks and Sea World. This resort is in a great location for these parks as well as the Disney Parks. The resort has a water slide and several hot tubs with the zero entry pools. Everything was georgeous and clean! My husband enjoyed the workout facility. It was small but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel not too far from the parks”
Reviews.Author: Ravelan
Reviews.Content: Excellent service! Staff is really friendly, property is clean and better than I expected. Overall I would recommend staying there if you don't want to pay insane prices of the decent resorts on Disney property. There is a nice very kid friendly pool with a great slide, jacuzzi. There is one restaurant on premises but the food is yummy. It takes about 5 minutes to drive to do shopping, about 10 minutes to downtown Disney and about 20 to parks.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Orlando (so far)”
Reviews.Author: rhowell1965
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here. It was great having the beautiful new spacious one bedroom condo. So much better than staying at a hotel. We have previously stayed at Disney's Caribbean Beach,The Caribe Royale, Hyatt Grand Cypress, Nickelodean Hotel and the other Hilton Grand Vacation location on Vineland. We have also visited friends at Disney Boardwalk and Lowes Royal Pacific at Universal. I have to say that you can't beat this place for atmosphere, the pools and hot tubs are great, the on site restaurant is casual and open air and we ate almost all our meals there. The menu was good and the food was reasonable. I enjoyed the Salad Parisienne, the Pecan encrusted chicken and assorted panini sandwiches. The only things I wouldn't recommend are the Lobster Bisque and the childrens Steak (leather) and fries. But everything else- breakfast, lunch and dinner were wonderful. This place is a welcome retreat from the hustle and bustle of the theme parks. We could live here! They had movie night by the pool and kids games and music by the pool but it was never too loud or bothersome. It caters to families but is not a kiddie hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great price.”
Reviews.Author: michaela789
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel and all if had to offered. Jeffery checked us in when we arrived and he was extremely friendly and very informative. He was upbeat and made the check in process quick and smooth, but took the time to explain everything we wanted to know. Everything in the hotel is very new. The beds are comfortable. The flooring in the rooms are also wood, which is great because you know it is clean and allergy friendly. We did rent a car, and I think that was a smart move because it made getting to Disney, outlet malls, and other places easy. We never had trouble finding parking and usually found a great spot. The food at the hotel was okay, not great, but not bad. My boyfriend has celiac (gluten allery) and the menu was not very accommodating to that allergy. The prices were reasonable. Alcoholic beverages very watered down. The pool is great. Very clean and fun. I liked how there was a separate quiet pool to the side for adults. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. The price is unbeatable for the quality of the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: akuma88
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the studio suite at Parc soleil for 5 days and for the price that I paid, I can't complain. Excellent service from the staff and very clean. location wasn't easy to find at first but if you have a gps, it shouldn't be a problem. Walmart, restaurant and all the parks were within 15 minutes. Free laundry service as well, which helped when we had our 1 year old with us. Only complaint was that the bed and pillows were to soft. I like the firm mattresses so depends on your preference. Also, unless you have to, you're better off eating at perkins or denny's nearby than at their restaurant. same price but probably better food.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaHerder
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-long stay at the Parc Soleil and had a positive experience. Being Hilton "owners," we expected high-quality rooms and amenities - it's the trade-off when one buys with Hilton for HGVC's limited locations - and the Parc Soleil didn't disappoint. Location: Reading other reviews, we were expecting the Parc Soleil to be in a very remote location. It was not. Yes, there is a substantial amount of "green space" around the resort (presumably for future development), but frankly, after days in the parks, space and peace were somewhat welcome. The only real irritant here is that there is very little in "comfortable" walking distance around the resort - one would have to be VERY committed to walking - but there were numerous restaurants, grocery stores, etc., within 1-2 mile radius. This would not have ordinarily seemed like much of a challenge, but the limited restaurant (discussed further below) exacerbated it. The semi-seculded location did contribute to our feeling somewhat more confident in letting the kids go off in pairs without adult supervision. It is an easy drive to Universal (almost a straight shot). Rooms: The three-bedroom suite was more than adequately spacious for our group of three adults and four children (ages 10-14), and the furnishings were all new and consistently high Hilton quality. We had no problems with any of the kitchen appliances, had four (4) flat screen TVs in our suite, and did not notice any exceptional hallway noise or noise from other rooms - and this was during "Spring Break." The master suite was spacious and comfortable, providing a great "Parent Land" during our stay. The master bathroom was exceptionally nice. We requested a "fireworks" view, and - as other reviews have noted - this was a bit of a let-down. It is accurate to say that one can see the evening fireworks at Epcot, but just barely, and we were on the 12th floor. In retrospect, we would have preferred a pool view. Also, if you are traveling with teenagers who expect their "own" bed, be advised that you may need to bring an inflatable mattress and a quarter to flip - beds are kings, queens and - as others have noted - a very high-quality pull-out king. Pool: The pool area is great. Having stayed at the other HGVC sites in Orlando, the Parc Soleil has the best pool. The kids loved the waterslide and there was always plenty of seating in the pool area. The pool was clearly the hub of resort "activity," and the activity staff were constantly engaging kids (and willing adults) in games and activities. To put it in perspective, we rented a room at the Portofino one night to take advantage of the Loew's Express Pass benefit at Universal. This allowed us to spend mornings in the parks, swim in the afternoon and rest at the Portofino, and go back to the parks in the evening. The pool at the Portofino is outstanding; however, all the kids could not wait to get back to the pool at Parc Soleil. Grounds and other Amenities: The fitness center is small, but state-of-the-art, and is easily accessible. The activity center is similarly nice, and our older kids spent a fair amount of time there. The grounds are well-kept, and there is a very nice walking path around a man-made lake. The basketball and tennis courts are new and nice. There is free high-speed Internet throughout the resort. As others have noted, the future expansion "footprint" is a bit odd and makes the resort seem initially incomplete; however, we quickly got beyond it. Restaurant: Definitely the low point. The resort's food options are extremely limited, and virtually all of the food options we tried - with the notable exception of breakfast - were disappointing.
