In a week, we pretty much worked our way through the menu. Popular, easy and "kid friendly" appetizers, such as wings and nachos, were missing from the menu. Even the sandwiches were not particularly good. There is no onsite "mini" Pizza Hut as at the Tuscany. Other than dinner entrees (representative dinner items - pasta, $16; steaks - $25+), food prices were not outlandish, but the quality simply was not good. Paying $19 for a pork chop on vacation is expected - paying $19 for a pork chop that might be sent back at Waffle House because of poor quality is quite another. Again, this would not normally be as much of a problem in Orlando; however, the resort's semi-secluded location makes everything a drive. Knowing that one will eventually have to get kids out of the pool, cleaned up and drive around looking for food kills the potential of spending the afternoon with umbrella drinks by the pool. We strongly recommend taking advantage of the kitchen in your room - we normally take cereal and other items for breakfast to eat in the room, but rely on restaurants for lunch and dinner (who wants to cook on vacation?). Here, you are better off doing the opposite - bring snacks, sandwich makings, and "easy to fix" meals. Breakfast in the restaurant was consistently good. Market: Limited compared to other HGVC resorts. Prices were reasonable for a resort, but the deli was underwhelming and, as with the restaurant, selection was exceptionally limited. While approximately half the staff in the market were friendly and helpful, two in particular - who consistently seemed to work the same shift - often appeared irritated that they were having to wait on guests. If you have any food allergies or picky eaters, you will want to check your orders very carefully. Service: Where provided, great, but the Parc Soleil is woefully understaffed. This was another big difference in Parc Soleil and our experience with other HGVC properties. During our week there, we saw, at most, one server tasked with "rounding" the pool taking orders - and remember, this is a huge pool with hundreds of people around it. Drinks took approximately 20-30 minutes to deliver and food was longer. Again, activities staff and servers were friendly and full of personality, but they simply needed more help. An inordinate number of employees working in various positions (serving, bartending) noted that they were "new to the job." Overall: The overall experience was very good, and we will certainly consider going back to the Parc Soleil when we return to Orlando. If the restaurant issues were remedied, it would be a lock - this is a great property. Our kids loved it, and several days after returning, we are still in wonder that they preferred it to the Portofino, which is acknowledged as one of Orlando's premier resort hotels (having spent a week there previously, it merits this reputation). We tried to get a couple of the kids to spend the night with one of us at the Portofino and "close the park," thinking that they would argue over who got to stay and who had to drive back to the Hilton. No one was interested and they all wanted to get back to the Parc Soleil.

Reviews.Title: “Between Universal and Mickeyville - home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Iluvha
Reviews.Content: Parc Soleil feels like home away from home with its over-sized condos and warm staff. The two towers flank the pool and restaurant area which is shaded by plenty of umbrellas and palm trees. We booked a 3 bedroom which is a two bedroom with a studio lockout. The king studio doesn't have a balcony (FYI), but the two bedroom sported a huge balcony with one padded lounge chair and a table with four chairs. Ours was in the two-hundred building and we faced west with excellent distant views of Universal and Magic Kingdom and Epcot. The perfect weather gave us clear views of the fireworks each night at 10pm and we could see the Contemporary Hotel, castle and space mountain during the day and at night. A word of caution: If your suite is in Building 200, don't park on the first level since the vent from the kitchen of the restaurant blows out right onto the first level parking and you'll choke from the smoke. Move on up to the second and third levels where there was always plenty of parking for us. The coolest thing in our room: The bath tub in the King Bedroom bathroom fills from the ceiling. Weird. The kitchen cabinets have a slow close hinge that eliminates banging when shut. Wonderfully quiet. Unfortunately, chairs sliding on the hard floor surface in other units could be heard at all hours. We tried the marketplace for a quick breakfast and found made-to-order hot breakfast sandwiches and yummy pastries. Starbucks coffee and a cold drink fridge filled with juices, sodas and water. Or small milk and a bowl of cereal. We tried the Cafe one night and found that it's open all day until 11pm. We had dinner after a particularly exhausting park day. The food arrived at our table piping hot and delicious. Wild Mushroom pasta and Pecan encrusted chicken breast. I can still taste it, yumm-o. If you want to stock up your refrigerator there's a Winn Dixie a mile away. Turn right out of the resort onto Palm Parkway. At the four-way stop, turn right onto Lake road. 1/2 mile down the road on the right is Winn Dixie. If you reach Apopka-Vineland road, turn right and it's right there on your right. The heated pools and plentiful hot tubs provided distraction and relaxation. My only complaint which I will pass on to management is that a pair of mallards had made the reflecting pool their home and swam in it like it was their own private lake even though the property had a walkway around a man made pond feet away. All in all, we enjoyed our stay. Beds were comfy, kitchen well-stocked, loved the underground parking except for the first level (smokey). We liked the easy access to both Disney and Universal; and Orlando and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “We are extremely particular about where we stay but this even exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: MOMHANKS
Reviews.Content: The Parc Soleil exceeded our expectations. We stayed in the one bedroom suite which was perfect for our family. The room was extremely spacious and clean. The pool was nice with a resort type of atmosphere. The service at the restaurant was slow but all in all a great place to stay. We will always stay here when visiting Orlando in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiians3
Reviews.Content: I was in Orlando for a convention at a large convention hotel that is located about 4 miles away from the Parc Soleil Suites by Hilton Grand Vacation Club. I decided to stay here because I found an excellent price on-line that saved me about $200 per night from the host hotel. This is a relatively new complex with two of eight buildings completed. The pool area, store and restaurant are all targeting families that will be visiting the theme parks that are close by. I liked the free parking, free WiFi service in the rooms and daily housekeeping service that you would expect from a much more expensive hotel. I have to say the the first impression upon arriving is the smiling face of Juliet at the gatehouse. She always has a bright smile on her face and genuinely make you feel welcome each time you drive on property. The rest of the front line emplyees were also very friendly and personable. The property is a bit secluded from restaurants and shops. I think the sprawl will catch up to this development in about 5 years. All in all, a very good value for your money and a comfortable experience. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Highly recommend with car”
Reviews.Author: chtownmike
Reviews.Content: Checked in for a quick 3 days in orlando parks. Location is great, 5 minutes from Seaworld, 10-15 minutes from Universal. didn't go to disney this time but it wouldn't be much further than 15-20 minutes. Pool is good, kids really enjoyed the slide. The convenience store prices on site aren't too bad and we bought our staples there rahter than drive out to a CVS. The room was great. We had a one bnedroom, lots of space and having a full kitchen is a bonus. Only 2 real issues. Firstly, there is a lack of storage space in the room - not enough drawers if you were staying a week or two and wanted to unpack - just one small closet in the bedroom with a room safe, the two night tables, and a row of small sliding comparments. In the living room, with the hide a bed couch, only the 3 drawers under the TV. Other concern was transportation. If you stay here, a car is a must. We were told that there is a shuttle but it only drops you off at the parks 3 times a day. There is a restaurant on site but we didn't try it. There are a number of restaurants to try withina 5 minute drive (or if you are feeling like some exercise, I would guess a 20-30 minute walk). The business centre charges for internet access and you have to buy a card - $0.25 per minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Melto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Parc Soleil both before our cruise and after. We were originally just booked before, but once there, we decided we liked it well enough to return. In all, a great resort. The reviews are pretty accurate. The only negative I had was the surrounding area, which was barren! On our first stay we did not overlook the pool, we looked out on this vast emptiness. Yes we were able to view the Disney fireworks, but they weren't really anything worth viewing! Opt for the pool view. We had this view on our return visit and it's much nicer. Otherwise, everything else was great. The rooms are clean, large, well designed and well equiped. The bathroom and tub were awesome and that room alone could house a whole family! My kids really enjoyed the kids lounge area and all the activities they offered around the pool area. (ages 7, 13, and 15) They even have live entertainment and movie nights.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: cisaw38
Reviews.Content: We had a one bed room Suite with a King bed in the BR and King sofa sleeper. Very nice room on the 11th floor. The bathroom is huge with a shower and tub. Separate toilet area. Full kitchen, Washer and dryer. We planned on using the washer and dryer so we could bring less clothes for the week. Hotel provided laundry soap. Night view of the fireworks at Disney. The resort has big plans to expand so the area around the hotel is bare and the view is kind of lacking. The hotel is not within walking distance of any shopping. If your want to dine out, you will have to drive. They do have a on site market that is well stocked with reasonable prices, espresso, pastries, etc. Large swimming pool with water slide. The resort is about 1.5 miles from downtown Disney and 5 to 8 miles from the 4 Disney parks. Unlike some of the other reviews, we did not encounter any time share sale pitches. Free high speed internet in your room. The only down side is their business center. If you need to access the internet to print out anything other then boarding passes or access the web, it's .25 cents per min and .75 cents per page printing charge. If your looking for software to help plan your day at Disney check out the Undercover tourist app for your iPhone. The app shows you the current ride times at all the parks. Also, we used a software program from Ridemax. It lets you plan your day to spend the least amount of times in lines and take full advantage of the fast pass system. Well worth the money but you have to stick to the times in the plan. We have used it twice and it's amazing how accurate the times are.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: tk1780
Reviews.Content: This place was great. Very upscale rooms that were clean and modern. Pools were warm and clean. The staff was always friendly. Building was newer and fresh. two 15 story buildings built so far. There is room for probably 10 more so the surrounding land is barren for now. That did not bother us at all but I can see where some people might be put off. Location is near Downtown Disney and SeaWorld so it is a desirable location. Would stay again and probably will next year.

Reviews.Title: “Stay clear of this location!”
Reviews.Author: jnb7283
Reviews.Content: I honestly believe that any positive review was written by someone working for the hotel and not an actual guest. My trouble with the hotel started before I even set foot in the facility. When I was first contacted to come and see the hotel and stay for a reasonable price I informed the sales person that I would need to stay on the property due to having a child with a disability and would not feel comfortable leaving him and his older brother in a location I would have to drive to if I was needed in an emergency. I was told I would be staying on the Parc Soleil grounds, so I agreed to take the tour. HOWEVER, I received my confirmation letter that stated I would be staying at their Sea World location. Long story short, I contacted numerous individuals, both through Hilton Grand Vacations as well as Hilton Hotels and ran up an extensive complaint report for anyone within the HGV locations to see. Since we had already booked our vacation during our children's spring break, including a cruise, we did not have flexible dates to work with and any other location was booked. I was certain to inform them they had angered me enough that I would NEVER purchase one of their timeshares and that if we were forced to walk through a sales pitch it would be a waste of everyone's time and that I would be sure to inform anyone within earshot of the issues I'd already dealt with prior to showing up. I will give the hotel credit in that the staff was courteous and the room was beautiful. We were able to watch fireworks from our room. Though no fault of the resort, getting to and from the Disney area was horrible. Once you get to the main road, traffic is a mess and it takes a considerable amount of time to drive from one stop light to the next. Another downside to the facility is the incredibly small size of washer and dryer; they're the stackable type and we ended up needing to go through 5-6 loads of laundry for only two days worth of clothes for four people. I'm there to relax, not do laundry. I felt these issues were minor enough and the staff and cleanliness of the facilities were good enough to regain my trust in the Hilton brand, though not this particular resort. UNFORTUNATELY, after returning home from our cruise, I checked my account balance and noticed that money had been taken out of my account by Parc Soleil, one day AFTER we checked out. When I contacted the accounts department they not only showed that my card wasn't on file, they had no idea why it was charged. At this point, I'm still waiting to hear back from them. Don't waste your time with this place, it's not worth the frustration.

Reviews.Title: “Can it get any better”
Reviews.Author: kato1978
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is by far the best resort I've stayed in! The property was clean and beautiful and more importantly every staff that I ran into gave top notch service. I'm talking about from the grounds crew to the managers. Hilton must have great training, as I saw a training facility on site. Just like the previous comment, my spouse and I were late check ins, arriving around 3:30am. The gentlemen at the gate welcomed me. He gave me my parking decal with my name on it. Very nice guy. I wish I knew his name, but we talked briefly about the history of my last name in his country. I still wished I talked to him more about it, he seems pretty interesting. Great service my man! We checked in at the front desk which was very nice. The person at the front desk gave me a brief rundown of the resort. He spoke for about 5 minutes and gave me information on what they have to offer in a nutshell. It was so much info, but we were not expecting this great level of accommodations. The lobby was so nice and open. Very clean. Our luggage was lost due to our quick connection flights, so he offered us toothbrushes and toothpaste to start with. Normally that service is standard, but he was so professional about it that it made a HUGE difference with the other hotels. He also added that when our luggage arrives, he gave me the option of us picking it up in the lobby, or he'll have it delivered to our room. He was outstanding and I knew from that point we made the right choice in picking this resort. This was WAY more than I expected, and I was gleaming at our week ahead of us. Our room was the king studio room. I wanted the king bedroom w/ full kichen, but we also booked it last minute as it was completely booked. The studio wasn't that bad. It's a nice size room. We were in the second building on the 4th floor. We didn't have a great view, but that was okay. The air condition went out on our last day, but maintenence responded very quickly. He said something how the air condition gets locked up sometimes when you turn up the heat. There was a switch in the back that he flipped, and that was that. I love how the hotel is designed for the comfort to the guests. Little things like double doors that separate the elevators from the guest unit floor so it won't be so loud in the hallways. You can specify what time you would like the room to be cleaned each day. This resort had so much activities at the resort itself and peaks that we could not utilitize them all in one week. We organized our day trips in Orlando, but didn't realize that they had a concerge services. Our last day, we were trying to find one more activity to do since we had some more time to fill. We were looking at the pamplets of different things to do, and without asking, a lady at the front desk went out of her way and came over to help us plan our next activity for us. She called the number at different places we were looking at to find out hours, different specials or any other info we had asked. She was very helpful. Again, exeptional customer service. We will definitely stay in this resort in Orlando again. It makes me wander how the other Hilton Vacation Resorts are. I think I've just found my favorite hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Not Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Michelle780
Reviews.Content: After spending much time reading online reviews I decided to book the second week of our two-week stay in Orlando at the Hilton Parc Soleil, and was not disappointed. I am a very fussy traveler and found no faults with the room, amenities or service we experienced. We stayed in a one bedroom penthouse suite which was exactly as shown on their website. Our balcony was large, completely private and had a view of the Epcot and Magic Kingdom fireworks each evening. The kitchen was very well equipped (with Cuisinart small appliances and cookware!) and had every amenity we required. All rooms were very large and spacious and there was a washer and dryer in the suite. The king size pull-out sofa bed was more comfortable than any I've ever seen. The fitness center was wonderful, and there was a beautiful 1/2 mile walking trail. Basketball and tennis courts are also provided, as well as an amazing activity center for children. There were many supervised programs and activities for children each day and evening, and the pool/waterslide were a big hit with all. A smaller 'adult' pool and hot tub were available also. It was very nice for us adults to relax, yet our son still get to let loose and have fun. We never had one call from anyone trying to sell us time-share properties. The only fault some could find with this resort, although we found it a total bonus, would be that some of the surrounding area has not yet been developed. Walking anywhere would be difficult; however there were many good restaurants and a huge 24hr Wal-Mart a couple of minutes' drive away. Sea World, Universal Studios, Gatorland, Premium Outlet Mall and the Disney theme parks are all a very short distance away, most just a few minutes drive.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic HGVC resort!”
Reviews.Author: cvc47
Reviews.Content: We decided last minute to book a trip to Orlando for 3 days. Being owners at the HGVC on International Drive I tried there first but they were sold out (understandably as this was VERY last minute) Were able to get a 1 bedroom at the new Parc Soleil and decided to try it out. They only had a penthouse available and we were thrilled. As always, we called the hotel to ask for specific directions. We know from experience that Hilton uses their own internal addresses, so in addition to this being new, we were aware of the location issues. The person I spoke to was great and told me EXACTLY what to put in the GPS. Our flight was 2 hours late and we arrived at the resort at 3:30am. From there on out, the experience was all Hilton--first class and spectacular. From the night man at the gate who greeted us; to Diana at the desk--we were tired and she was quick! Building 2, top floor. We were blown away by the room. Our teenage son took the pull out and it was the BEST sleeper sofa we have ever seen. A tempurpedic type mattress on the sofa bed and it was comfortable. We were asleep in minutes. ONLY complaint: walls ARE thin. Room next to us woke us earlier than we would have liked; we were thankful no one above us or to our other side (we had end unit). That should be corrected in the next buildings they build. Our room overlooked the pool and the view was wonderful. Our last day we had breakfast on the lanai and enjoyed the view. We ate breakfast and lunch at the Cafe and I'm not sure where the complaints are coming from. The food was good, hot, plenty to choose from (we thought)and everyone was very attentive to our needs. Its a poolside cafe. It served its purpose well. The pool is zero depth, but has a deep enough area that my son and husband were able to play catch and goof around without interfering with smaller children (which is a plus when you're traveling with teens). Waterslide was terrific for this age group also, but saw plenty of young kids going down also. We asked for a late check out upon arrival and even though this is spring break and they are booked, we were granted a 12:30 check out, which allowed us to enjoy the pool, shower and check out. We were also told that we could use lockers and shower in the fitness center if we cared to stay longer and use the facilities OR the bellman would also keep our luggage if we chose. Everything at this resort is top notch. Yes it isn't finished, but being a brand new timeshare resort, people should know this--they always build these in phases. Ask questions when you book and you will get all the information you need. Way to go Hilton--we can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Will be better once finished”
Reviews.Author: amuslman
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for a long weekend in November. First off is a big negitive. WE COULDN'T FIND THE HOTEL!!!!!! We brought our GPS from home (which was fairly new at the time) since we were renting a car and didn't want to pay for one from the rental company. I plugged in the address and it could not be found. I was getting fustrated thinking I was doing something wrong. I then just looked up Hilton Garden Vacation Clubs and it came up with the one on Internations Blvd. so I just went with that one and told my husband we can ask them for directions for our hotel. When we got there the man at the gate told us this was a common problem with people who are using GPS's because it is a newer property. I do put blame on myself for not bringing mapped out directions with us. The hotel is not on a major road so that also can make it a little more difficult to find. Once we got there we were early so we went to see if it was possible to check in early. Our room was not ready yet but they guy at the check-in was very kind in telling us that they will get it ready as soon as possible and give us a call when it was ready. It was no big deal for us. Besides we still needed to eat a late lunch and needed to go to the store for a few things. While at lunch they called us to let us know the room was ready for us. Very impressed that they followed through with that promise. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite that was very beautiful and clean. We had no problems with the room at all. The balcony was nice and overlooked Epcot and Hollywood Studios. We were able to see fireworks at night. The unfortunate part of our view though was the undeveloped area. There is plenty of it. There were only 2 buildings that were built at the time when we went and still plenty of more buildings yet to be built. It's kind of an eyesore but we did spend little time on the balcony so it wasn't a huge deal for us. The property iteself (of what is built) is very pretty. The pool was really pretty. We didn't take advantage of it since it was unseasonably cool when we went. All the employees we encountered were very nice, especially to our two year old twins. I only gave this a rating of 3 because it is unfinished and just not the same as staying in a Hilton Vacation Club that is finished and looks beautiful. It made me wish we had stayed at the one on International Dr. The location of the property is good. Sea World is less than a 5 minute drive. We got to Magic Kingdom in about 20 minutes. Downtown Disney is between 5 - 10 minute drive depending on traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Not memorable in a good way or bad way, just an average stay.”
Reviews.Author: enstormblue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March between the 16th and 20th on a promotion from Hilton to check out their Timeshare program. We stayed in a studio suite overlooking the pool in their newest building 200. The good of the hotel: It is brand new, very clean and the desk staff is very nice and generally helpful. There is a fitness center on property along with various areas to grill around the pool deck. Also there is a onsite mini mart that sells coffee and sandwiches as well as one restaurant open from 7am to 11pm at the pool side. The mart was actually reasonably priced which was a surprise for once. Oh also the distance to Disney World is great, hop skip and a jump down the road and your there. The bad: Noisy, lower service then I am used to when staying with Hilton, some amenities seem to be an afterthought. - Noise: We could hear toilets flushing all night along with the TV though our neighbors walls. Now compared to other Hilton resorts we have stayed at or even the Hampton inns we have rarely had a noise issue like this. This reminded me of a college dorm, not good. - Room: Its been said before from other reviewers the room is ok but very bare bones. The studio has a small micro fridge and a microwave which is nice for a few day stay but if you tried to use it as intended for a longer stay it would wear on you fast. Bathroom layouts are not what I expect from Hitlon, the shower makes you feel like your in a glass box, oh wait you are, too awkward for us. - Service: Do note this a vacation club so I do understand that certain levels of service and treatment apply to owners over those just staying a few nights, however that being said there are few issues we had. For starters we requested a late checkout to be extended till 12 instead of 10 am, I was told they couldn't do that as they were booked solid, that was ok but I found out after the fact that a $25 fee would have been charged for late checkout. $25 really......a tad absurd as I've never been charged this at any other Hilton, our honors level even includes as a perk. - On the topic of service there are no free shuttles to any of the parks from this hotel. For a shuttle to Epcot it would be a $6 charge and I'm not sure if this is per trip, I do know you have to pay it everyday you need the shuttle. A free shuttle to Downtown Disney would go a long way to help guest out. - The pool area all together seems like an afterthought, when I'm sorry folks this is a Florida resort the pool should be the showcase and center piece. Instead the pool is nothing more then a few fountains and 1 water slide and a few hot tubs. No pool side food or drink service at all here.The worst goes to the pools towels they were small and cheap feeling and seemed a complete after thought, oh they ask you not to remove them from pool area, ha its march its cold at night, we returned the towels after we changed. - The parking garage is nice and is planned to be built into every building as they go up. But I can see that not everyone is going to fit in the garage and especially won't all fit with the way its laid out, my tiny car has issues fitting in those tiny spots especially when half the spot is taken up by cement pillars. As I've said the Hotel is clean and nice, but I've seen better for the money. I cannot see staying here again for the money I'd rather use Hilton Orlando or Bonnet Creek resorts near by. The time share sales pitch is stressful but that is expected and I will say that the Hotel did not harass us at all during the stay about buying the time share which was very appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly flabbergasted at the positive reviews!”
Reviews.Author: cognoscenti13
Reviews.Content: Painstakingly researched upscale hotels in the area, and this one kept coming up as very well regarded. WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT IT TURNED OUT TO BE! First of all, you can ignore the photos, as your room will look nothing like this. We travel frequently for business and pleasure, and I can honestly say that I have stayed in Hampton Inns (same family) that have had far superior accommodations. The studio is bare bones - do not be fooled. The restroom is embarrassing -- toilet awkwardly behind the door, and a teeny shower. Forget that nice bathtub with the ceiling faucet they show you -- not available in the Studio. Furthermore, you get half (or maybe even less) a window, and zero balcony. AND they make you pay additional for a higher floor or pool view. We paid for a higher floor (suckers), and were rewarded with a view of an unfinished construction area -- an obvious casualty of the economy, yet nonetheless not worth the extra money. Housekeeping did do a nice job, if they made it to your room while you were away. We stayed 3 nights (not counting the 1st), and had full housekeeping only 1. We even called to request housekeeping after they did not arrive timely the prior day (and provided a 5 hour window), yet returned late afternoon to find that they had yet to service the room. We were in for the night, and requested fresh towels, which they did expeditiously provide. To be fair, the pool area is nice and large and has multiple areas for lounging. And the sundry store was very nicely stocked with everything from upscale cold cuts and cheeses to beer, wine, salads, suntan lotion, clothing... and fairly priced, as well. Nonetheless, our room experience was less than stellar for a hotel this highly rated. Overall it was 3-star at most, but our room was definitely no more than 2.5-stars. Move on in your search.

Reviews.Title: “Burglary at Parc Soleil”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoLudwig
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent, the service excellent, rooms excellent... I would recommend except that I had 2 iphones stolen (with recharger) from my room. I'm from Brazil and I was very disappointed with this fact, at least not from a first world country. The hotel said it would take care of the case, they called their insurance company bla bla bla. But the fact is that they made time while I was there and as soon as I left USA, forget it... I understand the arguments but I use the safe for documents, jewelry not for something trivial as a cell phone. I have the right not to agree with their point of view. Besides this is what tourists do best: shopping. I thought a lot about whether to post or not but the thing is that probably the thief is still working there and my advice is to be very careful and 4 months passed and I still can't forget this story. Guys have a good trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Room size great, sofabed uncomfortable to sit on and checkout at 10am.”
Reviews.Author: AZMaverick
Reviews.Content: Our second visit as we had enjoyed the newness of the hotel. This time however was marred by the hotel's grudging agreement to a slightly later checkout at noon! (we had an evening flight ) and we were disturbed 3 times during the morning by Housekeeping staff obviously anxious for us to vacate the room. There was no communication between them and the Front Desk. Also we were disappointed by the small restaurant where, eventhough it was on the chilly side, all the entrances from the pool area were open. Then, the poolside cinema boomed out its presence. Not at all condusive to a quiet meal with your wife. Information in the room about such activities would have been helpful if only to avoid them. Palm Parkway, the road to the Disney attractions can be very busy to exit left from towards the Interstate and Disney.

Reviews.Title: “So beautiful, so new, so clean!”
Reviews.Author: Sil2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 10 days, with my husband and three kids (3, 9, 16). We reserved a one bedroom suite. The suite is exactly as shown at the hotel website. Everything is new and kitchen stuff is really complete. Bed was comfortable though too soft. Older kids slept in a coach that was comfortable enough. Pools are impressive, good water temperature and great water slide. Several whirlpools Deli market is really complete (Starbucks coffee included) and prices very reasonable. Restaurant is not very good, too much spicy food and little variety. Landscape includes a lagoon and a beautifully set running course. Service was very good: very attentive reception personnel (Graham was really kind!) and house keeping was ok (not outstanding). The hotel is near (3, 4 miles) the Disney parks. Value is outstanding. I absolutely recommend this hotel for families. Directions to get to the hotel: be careful, address is not easy to find, not even in a GPS. THis is because the address stated in webpage ("Desforges Avenue") is actually an internal avenue within the hotel. So look for Palm Parkway 7903 in your GPS.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL I HAVE EVER BEEN AT! - AND I TRAVEL ALOT!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelUSA538
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be moved up to #1 hotel in Orlando,hands down! Everything was prefect and I loved the 4 hot tubs and 2 pools!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: beachlover759
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc Soleil in May 2011 for four nights in a 1 bedroom suite. I booked the suite versus the studio because of the pictures shown on Hilton's website. The room did not disappoint as it was beautiful and very roomy. My only problem with this property is the walls are extremely thin. One evening I had friends over and we were talking and laughing. The women in the room next door called and asked us to keep it down. A few minutes later there was security knocking at the door. We were not overly loud and it was not late in the evening. That was annoying as when you're on vacation you don't expect to have to whisper in your room. The main pool was enjoyable and even thought I'm a grown woman of 50 years I enjoyed the water slide along with the children. A second pool is also available if you prefer a more relaxing atmosphere. The food at the restaurant is reasonable but more options would be nice. Overall I found this resort to be very nice and one I would definitely return to.

Reviews.Title: “So good we changed our holiday plans and extended our 2 nights to 6!”
Reviews.Author: LucyVanPelt99
Reviews.Content: After some hit and miss experiences in Miami we arrived a little jaded for a 2 night stay en-route to the coat. On arrival our Penthouse was upgraded to one with firework views, but it wasn't really necessary as the room was amazing compared to the previous hotels, it was as big as our London flat! Fully equipped kitchen inc. washer and dryer, dining suite, large tvs in living room and bedroom plus a tv in the bathroom. Large balcony with sun lounger. The suite was large, modern and clean, plenty of towels (2 of each size per peon) and quality toileteries which were added to daily. It was a pleasant change to park the car ourselves, FOR FREE, under the rooms and go directly to the room rather than hang around in reception and pay a valet to move it. There is an on site shop of essentials and foodstuffs which whilst a little pricey is far cheaper and provides much more choice and flexibility than room service. The pool area is fantastic with a shallow and a deep pool, 2 hot tubs and unlimited towels. This was the only hotel stay of our holiday that did not charge a "resort" fee on top of the advertised rate. The restaurant was very informal, more akin to a cafe. The prices and quality was good and the staff were excellent, always offering to remove items we did not like from the bill (we insisted on paying for anything we ordered then did not like but the offer to remove from the bill was appreciated). We encountered a little hassle both times we tried to extend our stay by another 2 days as front desk were only able to book wall-ins, not existing guests, but we were given the central reservation tel and managed to keep the same room and rate for each extension. Though originally having no intention to visit Disney we decided after extending to do 1 day. An enquiry to the concierge re. tickets got us a timeshare presentation in exchange for $27 tickets! It was worth attending the presentation if only for the amusement of continuously tripping the sales guy up over all the holes, ommissions and contradictions in his sales pitch. The scheduled 1.5 hr one on one presentation took 2.5 hrs after we turned the tables and he was trying to give us Disney tickets and get us out after only an hour of us interogating him! We would definitely return as our first choice in this area. We also visited the 4/5 star Trump, Hyatt and Fairmont Turnberry Hotels on our holiday and this was by far the best room, service and value.

Reviews.Title: “Good bar, lots of hot tubs, nearly brand new”
Reviews.Author: pauljpettit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference in Feb 2011. This is a brand new property, so it's set away from everything else, which seems strange until you see it. Once inside everything is extremely well kept and very upscale. It has a huge pool with water slide, 3 hot tubs, a private lake and a nice bar & grill that stays open till 11pm. I travelled alone for work but there were many families staying here visiting the theme parks or just hanging by the pool. I used the concierge desk to arrange some activities and they were very helpful as well. I tried to plan a trip back here with my family in April but they are all full, I'm hoping I can find something comparable.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Hilton for a great vacation”
Reviews.Author: sunshineyyy
Reviews.Content: The girls of my family (Mom, sister, aunt, cousins and grandma) just returned from a week stay in Orlando at Parc Soleil. We vary in age from 9 all the way up 68 and we all enjoyed our stay. Since there was 7 of us to a room, we had a suite plus a connecting room that gave us quite a bit of space. The rooms were super clean with nice decor, I love the hardwood floor because you actually know the floor is clean, opposed to mysterious carpet. We spent a lot of time out on the balcony in the evenings, overlooking the "lake" and empty lot where future buildings will go. The scenery didn't bother us, but then again we are easy-going Canadians :) The hotel location isn't central and you need a taxi or rent a car to really do anything. The hotel offers shuttle service to Disney Epcott at $6 per person, each way and is about 15 minute a drive from the hotel. Rent-a-car places offer shuttles to and from the hotel which is very convient. If you plan to drive, I reccommend Cocoa Beach.. I think the entire family enjoyed it even more than Disney. The one spot the the Hilton needs improvement is the restaurant service. We tried to be understanding that the hotel is fairly new, but it's hard to look past waiting over an hour for an order and the server consistantly forgetting and making mistakes. We ate at the restaurant sometimes twice a day for 6 days and recieved very inconsistant service (a few decent times and a few really bad). I'm not sure what the deal is, but I hope it improves and they hire more experienced staff. A lovely hotel, very family friendly. Would definitely reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Short
Reviews.Content: We stay here for 5 nights before our cruise & after staying here I was so pleased I booked to return there for a few days after the cruise! The room we were given when we arrived was in building 1 on the 11th floor with a firework view was quite simply the best. The beds were large & the pull out bed was the best pull out bed I have ever slept in. The room was cleaned everyday & all the coffee ect refilled, the place itself is a resort & both the poolside restaurant & on site deli was good value & to have a deli open to 11pm on site who will cook fresh for you at that time is a fab thing. The on site parking is under the buildings & we never had any problems parking & its so nice not to keep having to walk in & out of the reception area all the time too. This is a time share resort & I have read other reviews saying that the sellers keep getting in touch all the time, well they contacted me the evening we arrived & i told them that we were not interested & wanted not to waste both ours & their time which they understood & no further contact was made. I can not say enough good things about this hotel & yes we will always stay here when in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, service and value”
Reviews.Author: CoasterWarrior
Reviews.Content: This area east of Lake Buena Vista is just now being developed, so the surroundings are a bit sparse. This turned out to be a big plus for us as we like the fact that it is close to many things but tucked away and uncrowded at the same time. We spent our evenings in the Sandlake Rd. area north of I-4 which is easy to access via a back road and full of good restaurants. Lake Buena Visa is just as easy to access going the opposite direction. The room was great. It was huge, well appointed, clean and comfortable. The king bed and king pullout prompted me to book another upcoming stay, this time with the kids. This is a great place for families! The pool area was really nice, there is an activity center, lakeside walking trail, and many other things to do. A couple or family could be comfortable and entertained here for a day or a couple of weeks. The value was also excellent relative to comparable choices in Orlando that offer this much to do, this location, and the excellent room size.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a good choice for a family!”
Reviews.Author: PSCG
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that after one night here, we moved to a different hotel. To be fair, I will start with the positive. First, the hotel was clean. The finishings were very modern and nice. The floors were hardwood, which were better than dingy dirty carpet. Great for folks with allergies ... like us. Now, the bad. We were travelling with our three young children, ages 6, 4 and 10 months and my mother. We reserved a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite. This turned out to be a one bedroom that opened to a studio. The doors to the bedroom were translucent glass ... no noise reduction, no light reduction. Bad. The closets were IMPOSSIBLE. We simply could not unpack. We had 2 closets in the entire suite that were approximately 24 inches wide ... if that. I put a few of my things and my infant daughters in one closet and my 2 sons shirts in the other. My mother and husband left there clothes in open suitcases in the floor! There was barely room to walk around them in the rooms. We had all of our pjs and undergarments in one dresser in the studio. Ridiciulous. Plus, the kitchen area had a GIANT dining table that blocked the studio door, the door to the hall and the fridge. Impossible to get around. We couldn't even roll a luggage cart into this room without moving the chairs away from the dining table. On our second day there, I gave up, called a different resort and we packed and moved. Such a shame to waste an entire day on our once a year vacation! But I would have spent more time at the HIlton trying to find our clothes and shifting things around ... Great for a single or a couple without kids who don't own many clothes! Also, the hotel is on a giant empty undeveloped, unlandscaped lot. Not attractive area at all. The parking was hard to come by and the spaces are tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located, Great Amenities, and Beautiful Units!”
Reviews.Author: Gunfighter55
Reviews.Content: The Parc Soleil property is situated near Whole Foods, a hospital, Seaworld, Universal, and a five minute drive from Downtown Disney, for an Orlando visitor what's not to like? If you need more convincing, try this: The units are well-lit, spaciously designed, and airy, in a well-apppointed building that has it's own covered parking garage, which helps on those rainy Florida afternoons. The grounds are nicely laid out and the pool and surounding playareas are great. Our family has found it's new Orlando vacation home!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1106
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the parc soleil for 2 nights last week to celebrate Valentines day. At $109 a night this was one of the best values I've ever gotten in a hotel. Considering our short stay and the fact we had so many plans outside of the hotel, we decided to stick to the studio. This hotel is IMMACULATE!! everything is so clean and fresh looking. The room is beautifully appointed with all the modern amenities you could want including an oversized dual head shower. The beds were very comfy as in all Hilton properties. As stated in other reviews, the grounds surrounding the proprty are bare so I would recommend getting a room facing the pool. There are two pools available including a quieter reflection pool with an oversized hot tub. The fitness room was the nicest id seen in any hotel. The market which has plenty selection is shockingly affordable. We never dined on property but the restaurant has a nice menu. I feel this hotel is perfect for adults who want to visit orlando. Its location, which slightly away from the parks gives you a true feeling of being away. Its an oasis of serenity in the midst of touristy chaos.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent , can't wait to come back.”
Reviews.Author: epc2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc Soleil for 6 nights and Hotel was excellent , we rented a one bedroom suite and the Full kitchen was very nice.Very clean and big rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not our cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: PaulaAlexandria_VA
Reviews.Content: Accepted offer of reduced rate in exchange for a time share sales pitch, which was a mistake, since we aren't interested in a time share. View will be better when last 5 of 7 buildings are completed, but right now there is a lot of cleared, bare earth around. Decor and furnishings were lovely, but not sure we like bare, wood floors in a hotel. Definitely didn't like the lack of hot water. Staff was responsive and got it fixed, but a lot of time was wasted. Also, extremely noisy heating/cooling system interfered with sleep. Regretted lack of balcony in our studio unit.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal service for a Hilton Honors member hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamesham
Reviews.Content: Responded to a HHonors invitation to stay at this hotel for a time-share presentation that turned out to be 2 1/2 hours of information with expectation of making an immediate $27,000 decision on the spot. I declined and service got worse next day. No USA Today newspaper the second day, and housekeeping did not clean until 4pm. Stopped at front desk to ask for newspaper, and they said they did not have any available. Beware of treats. Purchased ice cream in small "market" area and found the one-room studio "suite" did not have a single spoon of any size! Ice cream carton was so soft it was like soft-serve. Ever tried eating DQ with a fork? Checkout on third day is unrealistic 10am with a $25 fee if you do not make it. Fee doubles to $50 at Noon. Noon is the usual checkout time at most Hiltons, with some slack given to HHonors members that are a little slow! Hotel is in the middle of no-where but sand..car required for everything. The "studio" suite is larger than a normal upscale hotel room, but too much of the space is devoted to the bathroom. Glass corner shower only, no tub....single deep sink....jet-assisted loud toilet in corner. "Kitchenette" is 5 feet of wall with microwave, dorm-fridge and enough counter space for a toaster. Beware of lots of noise through internal interconnecting door. The outstanding pool/spa features are high points of this property. Youth/activities staff resembles a cruise ship list. At check-in, we were reminded to watch Disney fireworks that evening. There is no balcony, just a window. The balcony extensions from rooms on either side of this studio make it impossible to see much skyline. The best rate on this room I could find online is $116. There are better values nearby from Holiday Inn and Marriott unless you really want to purchase a time share and listen to the pitch.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: MHG77
Reviews.Content: We went to Orlando for two reasons. The first reason was to escape the Chicago winter for a weekend, and the second was to see the Wizarding World of Harry Potter. So we were not looking for luxury, just some place close to Universal that had decent outdoor space. The Parc Soleil is not close to anything. Nothing is within walking distance, but this is Orlando, not much is walkable. If you stay here, you pretty much have to rent a car. The hotel grounds are nice, although it looks like they are planning to install about 4 other buildings and the footprints of these future buildings look like a construction projects. The most annoying feature about this hotel is that unless you get a 900 sq foot room (a suite with full kitchen, separate bedroom and dining/living area) you will not have a balcony. While the suite is a nice room, it is a little excessive for just two people. The first night we were in a smaller (normal hotel) room with a very noisy AC. The next night we asked to move to a different room and then decided to fork over the $50.00 per night upgrade to get the bigger room so that we could enjoy the balcony (It was 5 degrees in Chicago, we figured the upgrade was worth it). The upgrade room was really nice, but they failed to clean the room the next day. This was particularly annoying since we had paid to upgrade. When we complained the front desk person, was not apologetic. She insisted that we had the do not disturb sign on our door and the maid service could not enter. We explained that we removed the sign when we left at 10:30 AM. We also explained that the day before we remained in our (smaller/cheaper) room until almost noon and the room was cleaned. She finally agreed to send up a maintenance man who was very pleasant and brought us clean towels and took out the trash. There is only one restaurant on the property. It is nice, but since the property is so remote, they should have more options. There is no drink service at the pool. You can walk into the restaurant bar to get a drink, but drinking in the pool is not encouraged. The experience was not horrifying, but I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: brianfnc
Reviews.Content: Scoured the area looking for a roomy place to stay with the kids and go to the parks. Considered a few deluxe disney properties but the regular rooms are so small and suites were outrageously priced. Found parc soleil and decided to give it a shot b/c, really, if you're not staying at one of the few disney resorts on the monorail line, it really doesn't matter - you have to drive or get on a bus. This place was really perfect for us as a family with young kids. Had a 1-br penthouse. It was new and very roomy. Plenty of space for all. Had to be at least 1000 sq ft. Pull out sofa was perfect for the kids. Very nice modern decor. Loved the full kitchen, granite counters, stainless appliances, etc. There is a fine little restaurant on site. Nothiing fancy but good food at great prices. Though there is no room service, ordering takeout from the restaurant was easy. The market had the basics we wanted for breakfast and snacks. Service was spot on and friendly. My only complaint was the attempt to get us to attend the timeshare sales pitch. I understand these things and I had spoken to them in advance but not committed to joining a "tour." Yet they called unexpectedly at 7am the first morning and woke me to remind me of the 8am tour which I promptly declined. While presumptuous and annoying, it did not detract from our stay or overall impression. There really is nothing but unoccupied land in the immediate area. But it really didn't matter for us since we spent our days and evenings in the parks. It was less than 15 minutes to magic kingdom and only about 10 minutes to epcot. I still like the deluxe disney resorts but woudl stay at parc soleil again for sure. You really can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: TraceyTurnip
Reviews.Content: Well we returned to Parc Soleil ayear after our 1st visit, and things have really come along> The hotel has more facilities open now such as a small store and activity centre for children and teenagers. There seem to be more activited taking place, and every evening there seemed to be activites by the pool/ restaurant. The hotel is much busier now than when we 1st visited, and seems popular with weekend visitors. Friday nights can get busy and noisy round the restaurant, so if you are looking for a relaxed meal after a busy day, this may not be for you. Rooms as per my last review, however they seem to have calmed down on the timeshare which is good. Would I return in the near future, no.........however thats just because I fancy a change.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: IRK123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 4 year old daughter for 6 days. The lobby is big and impressive...check in was quick and efficient. The pool was great as it's 0 entry so great for toddlers...slide was lots of fun! The room was awesome...couldn't have asked for anything more...we stayed in the 2nd building penthouse. It was like staying at home with all the amenities. Doing a load of laundry before we left was so helpful!! The only disappointing thing during this trip was no room service after the 3rd day. I let 1 day slide by as we left the room a bit later and then the next day (we left the room around 9am) hoping to come back to a cleaner room with new towels, etc but still no room service. So, I called the front desk staff and she told me that 4 night stays only get room service for the 1st and 2nd days only. (We stayed for 5 nights but she didn't realize it as I had 2 bookings-1st night was a separate booking). When we checked in, the staff told me she'd note in the file that we were staying for 5 nights despite the 2 reservations made. I think regardless of how long you're staying at a hotel (2 or 4 or 5 nights), room service should be automatic. If not, I should have been told when I first checked in so I would of made the call the days I needed room service. But all in all, the stay was excellent and would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: jhgresseau
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast, great location, quiet area, very clean and spacious. Breakfast at Cafe Soleil was good. No room service but that's okay. The only issue was that the walls were not soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Skyview975
Reviews.Content: Was there for the 3 night 'time share' sales event. 2 hours of presentation out of 4 days was not bad. Close to major parks. Staff very helpful. Facility is 1st class. Parking lot looked like a used Mercedes dealership. They obviously are trying to get a certain economic class involved in ownership and pay for it. Resales about 60% less than presentation. Don't know if it makes a difference once you own. Very large pool area, good food and reasonable price. Rooms very clean and all looked new. We got an 18 month try before you buy deal and have already booked more time there. If they come down in price or up in points we'll buy. The A/C seemed a little loud but that's the only possible negative.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, currently quiet, the timeshare pitch is not too bad”
Reviews.Author: munchman
Reviews.Content: We agree with the most recent five months of five-star reviews and are only trying to add to them with this one. We visited on a tineshare pitch discount deal and sat through the two hours. This is a beautiful property with two towers currently, and they plan to build four more. It is very quiet right now, in comparison to the Hilton Grand Vacations Seaworld property which has at least four times the number of people at the pool and events. Pool is excellent and heated at 82 degrees, with a big probably three story slide (hours 1130A - 6PM) which is great for kids but slow for adults (not enough water). The events staff are young / energetic / diverse in country and US locations, with one guy from the Sesame Street tv program. The timeshare pitch is intense as usual, and we did not end up buying although it seems very compelling. It took the full 2 hours advertised plus another 15 minutes or so. We recommend having your own breakfast before you go, rather than trying to enjoy somewhat mediocre coffee and prewrapped bagels - go for the bananas and apples. They will slightly push you to book tickets for attractions before you leave, so be forewarned. They told us they sell to about 40% of the attendees and we can see why. Agree on the restaurant - great deal with an $8 salad that was fantastic. Fireworks at night could be seen in the very far distance for both Epcot and Universal (easier to see).from our room balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...Read this Review if Visiting Disney With Children.”
Reviews.Author: nmm9217
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. We saw all the reviews and were even more impressed when we arrived. We rented a one bedroom suite with king size pull out couch. The room was large enough that we could fit 4 adults and 2 children. Room was very clean, pool was amazing with water slide and full size play ground for young children. My brother and his 5 kids that live in Orlando came to visit and use all the facilities for the day without a problem. If you are staying here I would recommend renting a car. We thought we wouldn't need one but the taxi ride was $40 each way to and from the airport and if you take a taxi to the parks its $35 plus a $15 parking fee taxis must pay. The shuttle only comes once in the morning and it is $6 per person. We rented a car for 4 days what would cost a round trip to the airport. It only takes about 8-10 minutes to get to the theme parks with your own car. There are several restaurants (many of them chains) minutes from the hotel. The hotel itself sits very privately but soooo close to everything. The hotel restaurant walks out the pool and is priced reasonably. $6 for a kids meals and $8-$10 for adult meals. You won't break the bank eating there. My 2 year old spilled my drink and the staff ran over and said they wanted to buy me my next and kept apologizing for her. Great staff! We stayed 4 days in January and I loved it so much that we are going back in March and staying here again. No surprises on the bill either!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Bestmom81
Reviews.Content: Although this is a new resort in a very remote part of Orlando, if you can believe it. It is very close to Disney and Sea World. Universal is a 15 min. drive. We were very pleased with the service and accommodations. We stayed in a studio but, had plenty of room. Bathroom was huge! Resort had 2 pools, one with a jacuzzi and the other with a large slide and fountain. We belong to Hilton's timeshare and wanted to stay here. Although there are 3 other Hilton timeshares in Orlando, this was the newest. If we came back, we may or may not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Like my own little apartment”
Reviews.Author: McMillen28
Reviews.Content: Contemporary style, plenty to keep you occupied for families or for solo business travelers. Every employee I encountered was pleasant and friendly. Parking was ample and complimentary. This place made me feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay In Florida”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFAMPeoria
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Parc Soleil between Christmas and New Years. We used our points to stay here as we are owners of a Hilton time share in Florida. The hotel is still being contructed with additional towers planned. But there are plenty of rooms, parking, attractions available now. The hotel is the first in a relatively undeveloped area so there is nothing in walking distance. But within 5-10 minutes are the parks, restaurants, grocery, etc. We loved staying at this hotel and will definitely go back. We used our points to get two adjoining rooms since we had 3 kids with us. So the kids got a room with 2 double beds and a mini kitchen. Their room was then attached via door to the main kitchen and family room. Our master bedroom and bath was then off the other side of the family room. There was plenty of room for all. The kitchen, family room, and bedrooms were great. They are nicely decorated and have the latest flat screens, etc. We were on the 12th floor and the view was great. At night we could see the fireworks from the parks and on New Years Eve the fireworks from all the parks were spectacular. The hotel has a main parking lot that you can park in is you would like. A larger SUV with a topper would park here. But the towers do have parking decks and large SUV's without toppers can fit in there. We drove a expedition and had no problem parking. We did not use the pool as it was cold, but the pool is heated and we saw some people in it. It has a huge slide that the kids would love. We never did find the workout room but pictures look very nice. We ran outside while there and around the lake there is 1/2 mile. Probably the only complaint we had was there was not enough kitchen items for a family of 5. Everythiong seemed to be suited for 4. But we got by without any major issues. The washer/dryer combo came in handy and we left with all clean clothes which was nice when we got home.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay as great as the first!”
Reviews.Author: WWJD?LOVE
Reviews.Content: I have been at this Hilton Parc Soliel since January 6th and will be here until the 20th! It really is a home away from home! My little girls love the staff in the Activity Center! We are really enjoying our stay HERE AGAIN and have another upcoming stay end of February!

Reviews.Title: “We love it”
Reviews.Author: Popcornlovers
Reviews.Content: We spend with our family (2 adults and child 2.5) Christmas there. First week we where in the tower 2 on the 10th floor and we had 1 bedroom suite. It was great, not more to say, we had the big balcony and the view to Disney. My wife loved the washer and dryer in the suite and I loved the fact they have 2 TVs. The only downer really is to get the suite cleaned every day, it seems as some people don't have service every day for their suites. So we had to call them a couple times to get it done, but it was never a problem. Best is to leave the staff a note on the door or table that they have to do it and that does the trick. Pool and Jacuzzis, great warm to hot, even so it was chilly during our stay in the air, we still went swimming every day. Everything was great and clean and great friendly staff. My daughter loved the play grounds they have. After a 2 trip to Tampa we came back and where now placed in the Tower 1. Which is the same but I recommend to get a suite in Tower2 if possible. We had one small issue here: the back of the couch was torn apart and the stuffing came out. If you placed the pillows nicely you couldn't see it, but of course once you went on it, it was there and our daughter started to pull on it. I asked somebody at the reception to take some action and I was promised things are taken care of. Unfortunately nothing happened anymore…. Coming from the hotel industry myself, I can even understand that it was maybe not possible to fix it or replace it during the busy holiday season. BUT; somebody could have told us, said we are sorry, put some flowers or a fruit basked to the suite. But you gotta do something, especially if the customer tells you already in a friendly manner that there is an issue. After all Hilton Vacation Club Parc de Solei is not a 29$ Motel. Again we had the 1 time issue with the cleaning of the suite but we left the message and things worked fine and it was always nicely cleaned. We didn't go to the restaurant so we cant tell and we did the shopping outside at the publix. Also a need thing is, the Hotel has a 3 story park house. A important information for the European guest, I mention this here cause people have complained about it; YOU MUST HAVE A CAR! Car rental in Florida is cheap, but since you always have distances in America you need a car otherwise you will waste so much of the time. Remember just down the road means 30-60min walk, so better have a car and be free. You can still take the shuttle to the parks if you like. We shall be back for sure staying again in Tower2.

Reviews.Title: “Glamourous hotel and pools, great room and service”
Reviews.Author: Lisachristine0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc Soleil because we were offered a great deal to listen to the time share talk and wanted a little get away for our anniversary. Our brand new GPS could not find the hotel. However, we were not disappointed when we found it. Before we arrived we asked for an upgrade from our studio and were given a one bedroom suite that was wonderful. The bed was very comfortable. The bathtub filling from the ceiling was out of this world. The pools and hot tubs were great. There is a nice walking path. Good location and exceptional service. We liked that we were not surrounded by Disney even though the parks are very close. Ample free underground parking although tight spaces. We ate lunch at the hotel poolside and it was wonderful. There were lots of adults but plenty of kids having a great time. This setting could work for adults or families. Lots of activities at the pool area. The time share talk was not painful and we were treated respectfully when we declined to purchase. Overall an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Parc Soleil”
Reviews.Author: alertkm
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a 4 night stay at the Parc Soleil with our 18 month old twins. Parking and internet were great (and free!). Everything was clean and staff was very nice. We stayed at the other Hilton Vacation club on International Drive last spring and that location was better (literally right next to an outlet mall and could walk to a grocery store and a handful of restaurants). But the pool at Parc Soleil was better in my opinion. They had a beautiful zero entry pool that was really long and there were tons of small children sitting and playing in the water. The setup was a little strange b/c along the zero entry part of the pool was all the tables and chairs for the restaurant instead of lounge chairs but we often parked ourselves at a restaurant table with our own snacks/drinks and no one seemed to mind. We didn't eat a meal at the restaurant but they have Blue Moon on tap which is a plus! They also had a nice gated area with slides and climbing equipment for the kids. The pool was heated but not overly warm - it was nice. Our room was modern and clean. Nice tv's and a dvd player. The only thing about the room design that I thought was bad is that the door between the bedroom and the living room (we had a 1 bedroom suite) was made of tinted glass of some sort and not full wood. So basically we would put our kids to bed in pack n' plays (which were provided immediately upon check-in, as well as high-chairs, which were functional but could've used a scrub down) and then watch tv but the bedroom was lit up from the living area. I went to bed early one night and it drove me a little crazy b/c I like to sleep in the pitch black. The doors look good but they are poorly designed. That's really my only room complaint. The balcony was awesome - the door was off the tracks when we checked in but it was fixed immediately. One piece of advice. We had a room in Tower 100 (there's only 100 and 200 now - more to be built) and were facing the pool. However our balcony was never in the sun so on early mornings when I was drinking my coffee (which bring your own - the stuff provided is pretty bad) I would be a little chilly. Also in the afternoons when the kids napped we wished our balcony was in the sun. So if I could do it all over again I'd request a balcony in building 200 facing the pool - they had sun all the time. The location was not near anything but it was really a quick drive to grab a pizza or groceries. So you definitely need a car. And like other folks had mentioned it's not on older GPS's, which came in handy to know when we tried to find the place. Overall a great trip and would recommend the place, especially when traveling with small children and you need a kitchen and separate bedroom. Also downtown Disney is really close (5 mins) and getting to Disney was maybe a 10 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MaritimeExplorers
Reviews.Content: First off I'm a Hilton Gold member, so I've stayed at a few Hiltons, and two I rely heavily on trip advisor, and this is the first time I've been disappointed. Room- No upgrade available (ok no problem), but the room had no seating area, or balcony. The room was so noisy! We could hear our neighbours above us, and on either side, as well as loads of hallway noise. I never complain about noise, I'm a good sleeper, so it's never an issue for me, but this was a little over the top. Our mini broke down, and left a rotten smell in our room while we were out one day, ick! There wasn't anything in the fridge, but it was just that bad fridge smell, I called front desk, no apologies, the ended up putting the fridge in the middle of the bedroom, guess they were having outlet problem?? Which would be fine, but no one acknowledged the problem or said anything about it. Service- The service was awful!!! Any time we had a problem and reported it, it was so painful! Was it because they were busy? or was it because it was a Vacation Club Location?? I have no idea, but it wasn't pleasant. One day no one would call us a cab. When we asked for a cab they gave us a number to call, we didn't have our cell phones on us, so they said go back to your room to make the call.....I was a little ticked off at that point, what hotel doesn't get guests cabs when they need them?? Amenities- The hotels saving graces are it's amenities, with a fabulous pool area, and a decent restaurant and market on site. The pool has activity staff which was enjoyable, and all the kids on site seemed to be having fun. Location- It literally is close to nothing. There is nothing in walking distance. The plan is to expand, but right now it's a sad area. Although it was a quick cab ride to Disney/Shopping/Outlets/Universal. In all I wouldn't stay here again, but I think there is major room for improvement. If you want a hotel with a great pool, this does full-fill that need.

Reviews.Title: “OK.....”
Reviews.Author: SinginSuzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this vacation club during Christmas break to visit Orlando attractions. Overall, it was a nice, clean Hilton experience. The beds were wonderful, I loved the claw foot bath with the water pouring in from the ceiling. The shower was really big and had two shower heads which was really nice as well. At the pool they had fun activities for the kids when we were there, many nice spas and a waterfall that fell into the pool with a water slide. The marketplace was expensive (not unexpected), and a $7.99 bottle of wine at home was $17.00 there. The appliances were definitely low end. Our toaster broke and the washing machine belt broke as well. Our major concern was the timeliness of room service. Being on the 14th floor, we were pretty close to last and room service tended to show up at 4 - 5 pm, when we were back for a rest or dinner. Most days we declined Room service and just got coffee and towels, the first two days the room service forgot to leave coffee. I found out at the end that I could have asked for early room service, but I didn't know that. One other detracting thing was the location. This is a resort in progress, they plan on building several new towers so there wasn't much around. Also, don't go for the fireworks view, they are so far away, it's not worth it, so your view really is of a distant Orlando not much else. You can see Epcot in the far distance. Overall, a nice stay but for the price, just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Superb place and great location”
Reviews.Author: dyfrank
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite. Everything was clean and tidy as it's all very new. Superb level of equipment with 3 flat screen t.v.'s. Just a shame US tv is so bad ! Swimming pools are great and the girls could take them selves off to the teen room and use the facilities and free internet. Would recommend this hotel if you are planning to visit Sea World, Wet & Wild and Universal. The latter being 10-15 mins drive to get to but be warned if you're planning to visit the Harry Potter park in Island of Adventures then be sure to get there at 7-30 for the 8-00 door opening as its incredibly popular and this will save you a 2 hour queue just to get into the area before you queued for the rides ! Its only 10 mins to International Drive where there are plenty of restaurants for all tastes. Would love to go back again some day.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Neuenburg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc Soleil for a conference in December in Orlando. It is located within 2.5 miles of the conference center and I believe is a fairly new hotel (the actual street address only shows up on newer GPS units). For 199 plus tax I stayed ina 900-square foot suite (bigger than my apartment) which was beautiful. Full kitchen with exquisite granite counters, living room with balcony and bed room, both with flat screen tvs, nice furniture. The bathroom was gorgeous, with a spacious, glass-enclosed shower and a big clawfoot-type bathtub. The property has a gym, activity centers, pools with water slides, a restaurant and a store, which was great. The concierge is able to connect you with a cab service that charges a flat fee rather than the exorbitant cab fares that seem to be the standard in Orlando. Overall the staff was very nice, even when questions or problems arose. My card reader at my room broke down, and the problem was fixed within minutes. Overall, I can highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mgnogueira
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very well located and the room is large, has a little kitchen and is very clean. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, nice design, but loud if you have neighbors”
Reviews.Author: koali2004
Reviews.Content: I did not use timeshare points, but paid a daily rate for a 3 night stay. We requested to be in the newest building (I think there are 2 built) and got in the newest part of the property. It's clean because it's new, but the design is typical of most other new timeshare properties. You can see Disney in the distance from our room. It's on a new road, so older GPS cannot find it unless you pay for map updates. Nicely decorated. We had some problems though. Our shower was leaking big time and they had to repair it while we were there and couldn't use the shower for 6 hours. They brought in a huge noisy construction type dryer. However, even after the repair water was leaking. Second and worst problem is the wall are PAPER THIN. If you have neighbors, you can hear EVERYTHING. We had to knock on the wall to tell our neighbors to keep it down at 1:00 in the morning. It was horrible. Also, the parking garage is tight. Almost every spot is hard to get into if you have an SUV. I guess is your main concern is nice decor, comfort and clean, this would be ideal. But take into consideration the noise from other people in rooms next to you. It is only a 5 minute drive to Disney, so location is ideal. Professional staff upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: lowprfl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here using our HGVC timeshare points. Property is the newest out of all of the HGVC properties in Orlando. Staff is very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a studio penthouse facing west which allows you to watch the disney fireworks from your room at night! It is a 5 minute drive away from Downtown Disney and the Parks. Only negative is that the hotel is in an area that is not built up yet so there is nothing within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Gret place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: NJTripper9
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights there over the Thanksgiving holiday. Great place! We were in a 1Br, King suite with full kitchen (there's a Whole Food supermarket straight down the road about 5 mins. away for all your food needs). The rooms were large, clean and immensely comfortable. The fitness room was as good as it gets hotel wise, and the pool area was large, nicely landscaped, clean and relatively private. We were about 10 minutes from all major attractions. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. Overall, wonderful place to stay. It's the first place I'm gonna look to stay next time I'm in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Three great days”
Reviews.Author: speedz2
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice, quiet, comfortable place to kick back for a few days. Reviews looked good and price reasonable, so we booked it, took a shuttle from the airport and stayed planted at the hotel the entire time. Although we never ventured off the grounds, Disney and other major attractions are close by -- been there, done that in the past and have no interest in going back. Parc Soleil's rooms, restaurant, bar, fitness facilities, pools, service, landscaping all met our needs perfectly. There was plenty to keep us busy, and we spent more time in the activity room playing pool and ping pong than I could have imagined. Also played basketball, jogged and spent considerable time in the fitness room. Should be interesting to see what this place becomes once the other buildings are completed. I have stayed at nicer resorts, but for the money, this one was hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I Have Been To In My Whole Life!”
Reviews.Author: TravelUSA538
Reviews.Content: This hotel is paradise in Florida! From the moment I arrived Me, my wife, and my 2 children loved this place! We looked foward to getting back to the hotel after a long day at the theme parks. Some days we sayted at the hotel to enjoy the very large swimming pool and 3 whirpool spa's.
