We also liked the fully complimentary shuttles to ALL the nearby theme parks. I would highly reccommend this hotel to anybody and I for sure will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: StaceyLaurelton_NY
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at this hotel and it was amazing. I had a one-bedroom suite and I totally have no complaints. The service was great, the food was great, the rooms were immaculate, the pools were great, the playground and activities center for the kids was great and the view was awesome!! I will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiMor
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I travelled to Florida to see the launch of Discovery (which never happened) the first week of November. Not having been on vacation in a decade (!), I wanted to stay at a really nice hotel. I'd booked at another, but after reading some not-so-great reviews on Trip Advisor, I changed at the last minute. So glad I did! The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, with a cobblestone street leading to the gated entrance. The staff is wonderful and extremely friendly. There are two pools, the main one with a slide. There are also four hot tubs. It was a truly beautiful hotel. And what was best is that it's clean. I'd read so much about roaches at other hotels, so I was a bit nervous. But I didn't see a one! :-) It's a relatively new hotel, so that was even better. There is a small games room for the kids to enjoy themselves on the chillier nights or if they tire of the pool, complete with a PS3, ping pong and a pool table. For the younger ones, there is a playroom with a TV and toys. Now, I did have a couple of problems: no wake-up calls two days in a row and a fridge that didn't cool properly (milk curdled). However, the staff looked into both issues immediately and the hotel took care of me quite well, making amends for my inconveniences. I stayed in a studio room, which was quite sufficient for my daughter and I. And the bathroom was nice and big, with a huge shower! The hotel is off Palm Parkway, which is a bit off the beaten path, so you need a car to get around, but that also makes it nice and quiet. And Palm Parkway leads straight to Universal Studios (only about 10 minutes away), so that was very convenient. Close to Downtown Disney as well. I will be returning to Florida again, and I will most definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT LOOK ANTWHERE ELSE!!!”
Reviews.Author: muscrat007
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel.Very very clean ,spacious rooms helpful friendly staff.....beware the mini market...very expensive.Also dont take up the offer of free breakfast and reduced prices on attraction tickets as they are only leading you to a time share event.Set on a location on its own its about 3 mins from Seaworld and 15 mins or so from the other parks.Has a beautiful clean outdoor swimming complex and do ask for a room with a view over swimming pool as you can sunbath on the comfortable loungers they provide.Room is equipped with oven hob diswasher micro waste disposal fridge/freezer washing machine/tumble dryer.......it really is like an appartment and feels like one too!!If i was going back to Orlando I would def stay here again.........I am very fussy when it comes to hotels but there was not one thing I could complain about here.........top marks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Nicer than WDW at a fraction of the price.”
Reviews.Author: WonTonCharleston_SC
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at this property this year and things were again top notch. Our check in was quick, the hotel is beautiful and the suites are large and very well appointed. We had a one bedroom king suite. The finishes were all first class (granite, stainless etc) and the bathtub with the spigot in the ceiling was a hit with our little one. On this trip, we spent a day at the property while taking a break for the theme parks and were glad we did. The pool area is beautiful and there is a great playground for the kids. There were also plenty of children's activities going on at the pool throughout the day (hula hooping, limbo etc). There is nothing wrong with "staying on property" at WDW but to get the same accommodation you would have to pay literally 5x the price. You could easily stay at the Parc Soleil and travel to all the parks by stretch limo and still spend significantly less than you would "on property" We had a great visit to Orlando and having a suite at the Parc Soleil was a big reason. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have EVER stayed at... and I travel ALOT :)”
Reviews.Author: stephg329
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc Soleil back in August 2010. It was a trip with my boyfriend. It was a birthday surprise and his first time in Disney/FL, so needless to say, I wanted to stay at a nice hotel. I remember when I had gone back to Orlando in March with my friend Kelly, we took the shuttle to our other hotel and the driver made a stop here to drop off some people, and I kept the hotel in my head for the next time I came because I was wowed by how beautiful it looked, so August 2010 and I decided to book with the hotel. When we arrived, our room was already ready even though we checked in hours before check in. The room itself was VERY clean and beautiful! The view we had overlooked all of Orlando, because I had asked the front desk for a great view since it was my boyfriend's first time, and without hesitation or problems they had done so. The hotel itself is about a 10 min ride to many of the major attractions and there are many places to eat around the hotel. Also, there is a restaurant on the premises that has great breakfast! The hotel itself is amazing, there's so many positive things to say about it, that I could probably write several more paragraphs. I will definately stay here again when I go to Orlando, FL. This is a hotel you must check out yourself :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Orlando Getaway”
Reviews.Author: travel01250125
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this Hilton Property while visiting Disney! We loved it! We had the pent house and it was top notch! My kids loved the outside pool so much, they would rather stay there than the actual park! It was perfect and can't wait to stay again. I highly recommend it. It is nice to stay close to Disney without being in the middle of it all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ericablondegirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 7 days in Orlando and the Parc Soleil was amazing! Husband, 5 y.o. son and mother all enjoyed the pools, hot tubs, and spacious rooms. Everything is still very new and really clean. The location was central to all Disney attractions and Universal Studios, yet was a little off the beaten path. Great activities for the kids also. Can't beat this place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, can't wait to come back when it is fully completed.”
Reviews.Author: dizzymiss67
Reviews.Content: As usual for us, we chose this hotel on the back of reviews from this website and as always it did not let us down. We hired a car with GPS at the airport, however the hotel is not yet available on the system but thankfully we had our confirmation letter and were able to use a nearby address to find the hotel. The hotel is in the middle of no where but in a sprawling area such as Orlando and as it was recommended that we hire a car anyway, this did not pose any problem for us. Check in was very quick and the staff very pleasant. We weren't in our room ten mins when the phone rang asking about our interest in timeshares, however we knew to expect this from other reviews. We arranged to attend the timeshare breakfast the following morning as they were offering excellent discounts on park tickets. As it turned out we slept late and missed the breakfast, our rep, Joshua called and we told him we were not going to bother with it and didn't hear from him again after that, No constant pushiness as described in other reviews. Our studio room was just perfect for two, extremely roomy with a lovely large bathroom and small kitchenette. Our trip was originally set to last 9 nights but due to circumstances it had to be cut back to 7. As it was fully paid in advance we could get no refund on the last 2 nights and the same was in fact stimulated upon booking. As a treat and due to the fact our trip had to be cut short, we decided to upgrade our room to a one bedroom suite on our fourth day. This was at an extra cost of $33 dollars per night incl tax which we thought to be a pretty good deal especially after we saw the new room. Huge big living area with a large flat-screen, there is also a full kitchen including a washer and dryer, the bedroom was as big as the studio and had another flat-screen. The bathroom was very spacious with his and hers washbasins, a beautiful deep bath with separate shower area. In short, WOW and definitely the room I would recommend when booking your trip, it is worth every extra penny. We went from a pool view to a Lakeview and with binoculars (which we packed) a disneyworld/epcot view. The pool was wonderful and a much needed amenity after a day at the parks and is open until 11pm. The adult pool or reflection pool as it was called is an excellent idea, especially for those, like us, that like to relax without the boisterous excitement of disney happy children splashing about. The spa pools are a dream come through and I could have spent hours within it. The marketplace is very handy, however it is slightly expensive so we used the local walmart about two miles away. The cafe soleil is nice and we ate there on our last night only with the exception of a quick snack on another evening. service was a tad slow as the waitress is on her own and could definitely do with some help. The free car park underground is not as small as other reviews say, we were driving a large SUV and had not problem parking it at all, the spaces are more than adequate. Customer Service is not overly in-your-face,however anytime we asked for anything it was dealt with very efficiently and pleasantly. They leave you to your own devices and that suited us just fine. The room was spotless with housekeeping attended to daily. We would hope to revisit the Parc Soleil again in the future and would definitely recommend it both as a couples and family destination.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we have ever stayed in! Super location.”
Reviews.Author: bindymcminge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 17 nights visiting from Australia and we did not want to leave. Superb hotel and great location. We had a King Bed Studio Room with a kitchenette and was perfect for the two of us. Our room was situated on the 10th floor and the guest laundry was also on this floor. All washers and dryers are free. The bed was extremely comfortable and cleanliness of the hotel first class. Pool area was excellent. Staff are very friendly at this hotel and you only had to ask for something and they delivered. The in-house Expedia Expert Renae, organised our hire car and tickets to Disney. The only people that seem to be complaining about this hotel are Americans, but at the end of the day they complain about everything! Don't miss out this is a FANTASTIC HOTEL, close by to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: tadpole1
Reviews.Content: Would never stay there, service was poor, staff not helpful. Terrible experience, not a resort, just pools. No golf, not a good location, out in the middle of no where. Very hard sale for time shares, not worth the trouble, there are plenty more of nice places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dbusafr
Reviews.Content: Hotel is Ok and comfortable however, be aware they don't recognise the Hilton rewards. As long as you don't mind being called everyday by a sales rep trying to sell you time share you should enjoy the stay. The resort is not completed and it is located in middle of nowhere. Customer service was slow; 3 calls to get a hairdryer.... if you have the choice browse for other hotels in the same area....

Reviews.Title: “Beautifel new hotel with a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Maryamalzayani
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and very comfortable facilities in a very good price and close enough to all Orlando attractions but lacking customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facilities - No Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: kling
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facilities but lacking customer service. If you are a Hilton Honors VIP leave the card at home they do not recognize Hitlon Honors. Customer service is non existance. Parking is a problem, parking garage is small and people park in two spaces, so they run our of space early in the evening. Deli is over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: sardinia03
Reviews.Content: After much research we chose this hotel because the standard of accommodation looked to be very high, and the close proximity to Disney (Animal Kingdom about 10 minutes by car, Magic Kingdom about 20 minutes by car) made it ideal for our 4 night stay. The room was lovely - we had a view of the Fireworks at Magic Kingdom, and not of the pool, which suited us perfectly, as our Daughter is too young to take in Disney in the evenings! We stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was very spacious and a bright space. It had a full kitchen (Oven, Hob and microwave) and a very large fridge. It also had a washing machine and dryer. I could have easily stayed there for 2 weeks, given the standard of accommodation on offer. In the lounge area there was a King sofa bed and flat screen TV, and the bedroom had a king bed with en-suite facilities (lovely big walk in shower and bath with fancy ceiling mounted faucets!). The toilet was accessible from the kitchen/living room and from on suite - which is handy. The location was easy enough to find - we just downloaded a map to the address from Google. Only thing is that the entrance is not that well sign posted until you are almost upon it - fortunately my husband executed a perfect handbrake turn before we drove past. :-) There is nothing within walking distance, but plenty of shops (Wal-Mart - about 5 mins away) and restaurants (several if you turn right at the hotel exit and drive for about 5 mins, also takes you to Downtown Disney Area) within driving distance. There is a great little on-site shop that sells all the essentials - and it is not too pricey. It also has a lovely selection of cakes and pastries and a deli counter, they can make hot and cold meals / sandwiches and you can get (Starbucks) coffee. We ate in the hotel poolside restaurant, whilst our daughter watched the Little Mermaid on the big cinema screen (at the Dive in). The food was reasonably good, the service was a bit hit and miss , that said it was perfectly enjoyable. It was pretty laid back, people still in swimming gear till 10PM, and had a really good vibe for families. I also noticed that they had a children’s area, which would be good for children from 6 - teenagers, it had a WII, PS3, DVDs on with staff supervision - located close to the restaurant and bar and pool. Looked great for the older kids, who all seemed to be enjoying themselves. There is also a play park area for the little ones - really nice safe place to play. The pool area is fab. There were 2 swimming pools, an adult one and the main one for everyone. The main one also had an excellent slide. I think our money was wasted on Disney tickets - since my daughter would have been equally happy at the pool each day!!! To sum up, accommodation was very high standard (I should also say that our suite was cleaned each day and I thought the standard of housekeeping was good), on-site facilities (pool, shop, restaurant, entertainment) all excellent. Easy access to Disney parks. Only negative is that you cannot walk anywhere - area a bit isolated - but that was not an issue for us at all. We had a car (oh - should have mentioned the undercover parking which was great - as it kept car fairly cool!) and it was too hot to do much walking. Positives far outweigh negatives. I hope to be back (soon).

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable. Wish I never had to leave.”
Reviews.Author: TracyTLG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best place that I have ever stayed at. I had a king one bedroom suite...and it was worth every penny. I am very nit-picky and I always find a problem with every place I stay at. Not this one! From the pool, waterslide, jacuzzi, bathroom, bed, balcony, TV, service, cleanliness, towels....everything was excellent. I plan on staying here again soon. It was truly remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for a few days”
Reviews.Author: orangecamel
Reviews.Content: A studio with a mini fridge/microwave/sink was just fine for the 2 of us. The room was very clean and updated since the building itself was less than 2 years old. The housekeeping staff was very kind and caring and seemed to go out of their way to meet your needs. We ate several meals at the pool because the food was excellent and very reasonable. We really enjoyed the walk out pool from the dining area.

Reviews.Title: “Suite location is everything”
Reviews.Author: CAP1953
Reviews.Content: First the positives: The employees at Parc Soleil are extradinary, from the gatekeeper to the housekeeper to the maintenance person to the receptionist. I've never stayed at a property where each and every employee knew and practiced the best of customer service. Kudos to Parc Soleil for knowing how to recruit and hire the right people. Likewise, kudos to Parc Soleil for investing in quality, comfortable beds. Pool areas are very nice, with one restricted to adults only. I like that! Equipment in the fitness room is excellent. Now the negatives: Suite location directly impacts the quality of one's stay. Unfortunately, our suite location was poor. We had a view of........nothing but a vacant site cleared for soon-to-come construction. Moreover, our suite's balcony was directly over a mega-fan that vented the parking garage 24/7. The constant roar of the fan made it impossible to enjoy the balcony. The style of the suites is decidedly contemporary. It is generally attractive, except for the ridiculous sofa that looks more like a psychedelic coffin with sides so high it is impossible to access the side tables and fabric so coarse you don't want it touching bare skin. Besides being ugly, the sofa was completely uncomfortable. Likewise, the layout of the kitchen/dining area was somewhat odd. The door of the refrigerator could not be opened without banging into one of the dining chairs. I slid the whole dining set over to try to create more room. And - the toilet closet: OMG - the combined light/fan sounded like a jet engine.....not a very pleasant greeting when using the facility in the middle of the night. Housekeeping was also inconsistent - not its quality, but the timing of housekeeping's visit. Some days it was in the morning; other days as late as 5 PM. And...the final negative: As I expected, we received THE call our first morning there urging us to participate in a Vacation Club tour and presentation, and offering us everything from a free continental breakfast to "gifts" valued at $100. How I hate these pressure calls. You can't get the person to back off and when you say you are not interested, she just keeps upping the offer. Why can't these properties ask you when you make your online reservation if you are interested in a Vacation Club presentation? If the answer is no, then please LEAVE US ALONE. Would I return to Parc Soleil? The answer is a qualified "yes." If I returned, I would request a suite location overlooking the pool area. I would also inquire about the status of construction. Five more buildings are planned. I would definitely not want to stay there once construction gets underway.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel; Confusing Layout”
Reviews.Author: cepe1980
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel, with fountains in front and a large warm wading pool and average sized swimming pools on the side. Room had a gorgeous open setting, aside from a separate bedroom with frosted french doors. Room also had an efficiency-type kitchenette with granite counters and a dishwasher. There was also verandas in both the main area and bedroom looking out on a beautiful lake view. Couch in main room equipped with most comfortable sofa bed I had ever felt. Staff was courteous but took a few calls to obtain towels and sheets. Plenty of activities set up for children-very family friendly. The outside layout was aestetically pleasing, but only confusing aspect was the inside hotel layout, where the lobby was on the 2nd floor and the hotel room itself was in a separate tower. Cannot speak of the price, as we received a discounted rate for attending a workshop on timeshares. I would go back if offered the discounted rate again.

Reviews.Title: “great big rooms, beautiful units”
Reviews.Author: nickrebb
Reviews.Content: Hilton Parc Soleil was beautiful, great big units with large master suite and bathroom. Family trip to Universal Studios, transfers convenient, but nothing else within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Cold but Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bluewind20
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parc Soleil in Orlando over spring and meant to write a review right away but didn't. We loved the place! Beautiful rooms, service was good, but we hit a tough cold stretch in Florida that made swimming at the pool a little tough. The pool is awesome, and the setup is very nice as well. You can order food from the deli or the upscale bar/restaurant at the pool and enjoy a cocktail or meal while the kids go for a swim. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous - the bathtub (as other TA reviews might have said) fills form the ceiling! We will definitely be back as we'd like to try this trip when it's a little warmer. One heads up - the pool slide isn't always open during regular hours if demand isn't there (as it wasn't with the cool weather). This place is about 5 minutes from the entrance to Downtown Disney - we drove to DT Disney then took the shuttle over to Disney World - easy transition! Off the beaten path a little but really easy trip to many good restaurants. We like Chevy's right outside the gate to Downtown Disney - great margaritas and half-price apps for happy hour! All in all, a great stay and we will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Snufflenox
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hilton Parc Soleil. The + : Rooms are spacious and clean, 2 nice pools, a water slide, a play ground for children, 5 minutes from Seaworld, 5 to 10 mins to Walt Disney, 5 mins to I Drive, 45-50 mins from Busch Gardens, good gym, free covered parking, free washer/dryer, excellent rates. The - : It's 2010, we should have acces to a recycling bin!!! They will call you maybe once, twice or 3 times to see if you want to attend a breakfast for a time-share presentation. After 3 NO's, I guess they understood that we didn't feel like going!

Reviews.Title: “Attractive and new - a very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: EastSpringsOwner
Reviews.Content: We were in town for business and pleasure. There are a lot of older hotels in Orlando, so we chose Parc Soleil knowing it would be new and up-to-date. We booked the King Studio because it was the least expensive and we weren't going to be in the room that much. The room was attractive - I liked the wood floors and there was also artwork on the walls. The bathroom was huge with plenty of square footage and a large glassed-in shower. When we had time, we relaxed at the spacious pools and spas. The waterslide was so much fun - more adults should try it! The only issue (and I don't think the hotel could do anything about it) was the 'lovebugs' that were swarming around the pool area. Apparently they migrate twice a year and we happened to be there for the late summer nuisance. Don't worry, they do not bite, they just land on the lounge chairs in large numbers. The concierge was very helpful. We asked about theme park tickets, but decided against it, since we wouldn't be able to spend much time at one. She recommended several restaurants in the area and gave us discount cards. We went to the Big Fin Seafood Kitchen in the Dellagio Town Center. It was a little pricey, but the tood was delicious and the service exemplary. Dessert was ice cream at Kilwin's in the same shopping center. It will be interesting to see how this property develops in the coming years as more buiidngs and amenities are added.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: wayne77
Reviews.Content: Lovely new hotel with great staff. Only a few minutes drive from the hub of Orlando and only 15 minutes from Disney. Good facilities and nice restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Any moment this place will be #1 on TA list !!!”
Reviews.Author: StewardessFl
Reviews.Content: It's gated. It's gorgeous. It's covered parking. It's safe. It's crazy spacious. It's full of extras. It's new. It's a deal. Atmosphere is classy. Rooms are AMAZING. You Will Not believe what you get for the price. Go to the website and look at the room pix! We met up with family, 4 separate rooms, all of us have been to Orlando many, many times. This was THE best place we've ever stayed, and we've stayed at all the finest Disney Resorts. Also, this place was way cheaper and offered more. And Sea World is less than 5 minutes away. The famous Mary Shrine Catholic Church, right there. The place is soo close to the hot spots, yet it's in a giant undeveloped treed area. We all kept saying, how is this property still available/empty after all these years? Your kids get welcome gifts, popcorn, activities sheets at check-in, and an activity brochure that is FULL of stuff going on on the property, Daily. There's a massive kids pool with waterslide/falls, plus adult pool and all the rest of the stuff like a gym and .... any nice resort would have. It does not have a spa. You can watch fireworks from your balcony at two of the Disney parks (no sound). There's great food for nominal prices at the restaurants. Starbucks coffee. Pack-n-plays and high chairs? Just dial 0. One room's air conditioner wasn't working properly and there were issues with the keys not working over and over, but the manager comped the room AND gave my family member a future free night stay. This shows they REALLY want you to enjoy your stay. The other 3 rooms were soo fabulous. And the tub water coming out of ceiling, fun fun. Saturday night there was a giant screen by the pool and we watched the movie Marmaduke. The sound system is good as well as screen clarity. Some people watched movie from in pool, which looked really cool. We sat in the lounge chairs. You can get popcorn, snacks, soda too. It was SUCH a relaxing way to end the day after a long day at Sea World. Stretched out under the stars, drinks and a movie. Loved it. Will never stay anywhere else in Orlando again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very pleasant property. Do not book a studio suite!”
Reviews.Author: ILove2Travel95
Reviews.Content: The Parc Soleil is conveniently located off of Palm Parkway in an area that is currently very quiet and peaceful. There is very little other development in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. However, it is just a couple of miles in one direction from the hotel to one of the entrances to Walt Disney World and Universal Studios is just 5-6 miles in the other direction, both very quick and easy drives. It is secluded, yet close to the action. The grounds are very well maintaned. The pool area is very large and enjoyable. There are 3 or 4 huge whirlpools as well as one very large main pool with water features and another smaller pool, both heated. The restaurant which overlooks the pool area is a relaxing place for a meal. The hotel seems like a great place for families. There seemed to be tons of kids activities going on, which is outlined in a booklet you receive at check-in. Be aware that the "studio suite" is not as glamorous as it sounds in Hilton's marketing. All of the studio rooms are actually connecting rooms, part of a larger suite designed to add a bedroom if needed for a guest in the larger suite. The studio really felt like an afterthought, and it was disappointing. All of the studios have hardwood (really vinyl or something else) flooring and no carpeting at all. There is no artwork in the studios either, and the window is small, not allowing for an expansive view. All combined, this makes the studio seem very cold and unappealing, in my opinion. In addition, you will hear an incredible amount of noise from the neighboring suite (through the connecting door). I would strongly suggest reserving the 1 bedroom suite, which is much nicer than the studio, and has a separate carpeted bedroom, as well as a spacious balcony and expansive living and dining area with a kitchen. For what you get (or really don't get) with the "studio", I feel there are plenty of other nicer, more comfortable and inviting rooms in Orlando for a similar price. The studio is basically an "extra" room, and it really feels that way. It's designed for those who reserve a 1 bedroom suite and need a 2nd bedroom. In this way, it's fine, for kids, or extra family members or friends, as an extra room with a bed and bath. The other perplexing thing was wondering why the parking garage was designed as it is. It's convenient to park and get to your room quickly, but beware the concrete pillars in the garage. It takes some extra concentration to park without hitting pillars or other cars. Very poorly designed. Other than that, have a great Orlando vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay--Review better late than never!”
Reviews.Author: ginny0034
Reviews.Content: I and two girlfriends in our 40's stay in late april for a 3 night stay! Alway reading tripadvisor for some advise for where to stay and realized I hadn't reviewed my own stay. We were in a two bedroom lock off we were awed by these accomodations! Beautiful granite kitchens in both lock-offs smaller kitchenette in studio which connect to bigger one bedroom. Pool was beautiful and staff very attentive. My friends did go to the timeshare offer it lasted about 2 hours and they said it wasn't too bad. They were initially thinking about it but backed out at the last minute. We are staying this month at the sheraton vistana used an exchange at RCI couldn't get in at the Parc Soliel..I just hope it is comparable...I don't think it will be but I am hoping! If your looking for a getaway from the parks in luxurious surroundings this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed for it to be a resort”
Reviews.Author: TressyandCale
Reviews.Content: My fiance' booked a four day, three night stay for my birthday. We are Westgate Owners so I expected to be immediately "wowed" since it is Hilton. A week before the trip, we were bombarded with calls from customer service asking the same questions. That was very annoying and then they tried to sell my fiance' other things in the process. The concierge service called two days prior to the trip asking what were our plans and how he would accomodate us, but once we arrived, we never heard from him nor was he at the presentation as he stated he would be. We stayed in a very spacious one bedroom, very contemporary suite. There were balloons and a birthday card in the room from the staff, which I thought was very nice. I love a jacuzzi tub in my room so I was very disappointed there was not one. There was nowhere to store anything in the bathroom and I was shocked there wasn't a hair dryer in the room either. The grounds are very well maintained and thank God we rented a car because you definitely need one! Not sure if they have a shuttle service because it was not offered or even mentioned. We were not called prior to arriving by anyone to give us directions to the resort. I was expecting to be blown away, but instead I felt like this was like any other regular hotel instead of feeling like a resort. There was nothing spectacular happening on the resort to keep us wanting to stay there and for them to want us to buy a timeshare, they sure did not sell it like they wanted us too. All we did was sleep there and we enjoyed the pool our last day. Service means everything with me and it will make or break a deal. I will say the presentation was only for 45 minutes and the gentleman was very nice. Overall, it did not have the "wow" factor my fiance' was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort - just a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: ygbasham
Reviews.Content: We are HGVC owners and love our Hilton timeshares. We had been wanting to stay since it was finished because we have friends in Orlando and usually stay at the Hilton on International Drive - the Tuscany - which we love. I booked a 2 bedroom pentouse suite and it was simply gorgeous. The master suite bathroom was elegant and very chic. The spout for the bathtub is on the ceiling and so really cool. Only thing, there was nowhere to put your soap - no soap dish, only a ledge behind the tub to sit your toiletries on. The soap just stays in the tub with you. The other glitch was the TV/sound system. The tv is a nice flat-panel tv with a Yahama sound sytem and there's also a dvd player. There are 3 remotes but no instructions to tell you how to operate any of them. My friend and I had rented a movie and figured out how to operate the dvd but couldn't get the sound system to work. So we called the front desk and they sent a maintenance man up who arrived about 20 minutes later. He was very helpful and pleasant and we finally got to watch our tv. But you would think there would be some kind of instructions for these things - everybody is not a media wizard! The resort sits in a huge area where there isn't anything else around, which I liked. If your room faced the pool there was a lovely view, but from the other side you could just see vegetation and maintenance buildings which was not a pleasant view at all - except at night. At night you could see the Disney fireworks so that was the good thing about being on that side of the building. The pool was lovely with waterfalls and a nice big water slide. My friend and I would sit out by the pool at night and have drinks from the cafe. And on our last night we had the grilled mahi-mahi sandwich that was delicious. The fish was very fresh and cooked perfectly. Since we were on the penthouse level we had to use our key card in the elevator to get to the 15th floor - that was a nice feature. The grounds at the hotel were lovely, as were the interior hallways inside the resort. It had the feel of a luxurious hotel, and the service was excellent. The beds were extremely comfortable as were the pillows. What wasn't comfortable was the living room furniture. It looks great, but you just couldn't get comfortable on that couch. The kitchen was equipped with everything one would need to fix your meals there - even an espresso machine! They have a parking garage which is very nice in inclement weather and is very accessible from the elevator. Other than a couple little minor glitches, we loved our stay at the Parc Soleil and I definitely will be going back there.

Reviews.Title: “In our second time at this hotel the service and the cleanliness was terrible !”
Reviews.Author: fabiovlp
Reviews.Content: Last year 2009 , we had a very nice stay at this hotel (resort)... So we came back in september 2010 and the rooms still good , but the front desk staff and the housekeeping was terrible . Our room during our stay ,we stayed for seven days ,it was very dirty . We tryed to call to the front desk but they said to us that is normal at this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Noisy And Time Share Sales”
Reviews.Author: LondonRover
Reviews.Content: I am a well travelled, but level headed person, who generally believes you get what you pay for. Positves - good, convenient parking, adjoining lifts directly to your room. Parking also free of charge (compare that to say Hard Rock, or similar). Nice pool area with plenty of space to relax and spread out. Decent room rate for accommodation (on first appearance). Comfortable beds and decent shower equipment. Negatives - disgusting sales techniques - on check in I was pounced on by a cheesy salesperson who wanted to be my friend in the Jim Carey type of way (yuk) and just wouldn't let me go. He had no concept of appreciating I had just arrived, I had a young child with me and I don't expect this being a HH member etc etc. I said I might contact him, but I am tired now. Worse to follow - not even two minutes inside my room, another salesman rings up, giving me the same hard sell - Hilton - TOO MUCH - take note please. Other negative' I've seen thicker walls on a dolls house, this place is the noisiest hotel I have stayed in over 40 years, full of loud, inconsiderate people from a certain country who haven't got a clue what consideration means. My 9 year old was woken up at 2am from the people in the next room shouting, screaming and generally bring idiot as only certain people from a certain country can be. Location is fine - as long as you have a car, certainly nicer than the tacky I drive. Would I stay again ? If on a budget yes, if not - probably not. Best advice - take out the phone wire to stop the sales idiots pestering you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SnoopyBella
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a one bedroom suite at the beginning of August for 5 nights. The rooms are fabulous and have everything you could possibly need for a very comfortable stay. The pool area is great and it has a bar and restaurant for snacks and drinks. There is lots of entertainment around the pool area also for kids to keep them interested. Our daughter did a great scuba diving lesson which she thought was great. Location wise it is close to everything. Most restaurants and shops are within 5 mins drive away and it is very close to Disney and Sea World. There are two towers that have been built so far on this resort and they are planning to build another two soon. The views are great from the rooms but there is a lot of vacant land around waiting to be built on but this is kept very tidy and clean. There is also covered parking in garages which is great to keep car cool in the heat. All in all would highly recommend it as it is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Winnifer
Reviews.Content: We stay there for four nights, and had great experience. Great service, we were able to check in at 6am after 15 hours long flight. Housekeeping was great, room was huge and comfortablem, the kitchen area is awesome. My 4 and 8 years old boys had fun at pool every evening, but the bar service is aweful. We waited 20 mins and no one was coming to service. The bar really needs to be improved in service. But our overall stay was wonderful, excluding the dining part. Then we stay at Animal Kingdom Jumbo House for another two nights after Parc Soleil Hilton, where is almost triple the price of Parc Soleil. All I have to say is Parc Soleil is much much much better than Disney Animal Kingdom. I will absolutely recommend Parc Soleil.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed with sales tactics”
Reviews.Author: ovek66
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The International Drive location in the past and thought it would be good to try the newer location. I have not had a vacation in over three years and booked based on my previous pleasant experience. I am an Honors member. After a speedy check in I was surprised to be be subjected to an immediate invitataion to attend a sales presentation. This was not welcome as I had been having a terrible day and wanted to go to my room and begin to rest. I was not allowed to leave the desk until I was booked into a presentation the following morning. My wife is extremely against this type of promotion as we have had aweful experiences in previous presentations at other resorts. I decided to agree to the presentation as I was promised it would be 45 minutes to an hour and we would save on Disney tickets. I advised I had no interest in purchasing points or any other form of ownership. I was assured that as an Honors member that nothing would be done to offend us because we were their "bread and butter". We were booked the following morning for 0945 hrs. The next morning I was given an unrequested wake up call to ensure we would be at this "tentaive" presentation. Needless to say I was angry because I was enjoying a fine sleep. My wife and I went to the presentation. When we arrived we were left waiting for fifteen minutes before being greeted by a salesperson. We were escorted to a desk and then left to wait another ten minutes. When we finaly got underway it was almost 30 minutes into our appointment. The salesperson asked why we were there. I replied we only wanted to complete the presentation to qualify for the cheaper tickets. He was surprised and kept asking the same question. I told him the answer wouldn't change and to move on. I noticed he had at least twenty six questions to ask and realized we would never be released from this meeting. We told him to release us from this presentation. He left again and we were met by a young lady that asked me to sign a document. My wife didn't want to sign but I quickly signed the paper and we were told to leave. The whole experience was embarassing and annoying. This was one of the problems. We booked a two bedroom suite and I was surprised to find they were two separate room. This was not what I expected. The second smaller room consistently had a strong odour of cleaning fluid throughout our stay. I was also dismayed to find that the activitites at the pool were loud and often geared toward young children. I wanted to rest and enjoy the sun. I didn't need to hear a trivia contest naming music from televisions shows I could care less about. I understand Orlando is for children but I would have liked this described to me in some way. This was not mentioned in hotel literature. If I had known this I would have returned to the International Drive location. I should also mention that this high pressure sales tactic was not at the other location. I have to say that I'm extremely disappointed with this experience. I was only at the location six days. I did not have a good rest and will not return. Our room was $195/night and I expect to be treated with more respect than having a cheap sales presentation shoved down my throat. I expect this sort of thing when I place my name in a box to win a car and accept the offer of a free night stay somewhere not from the Hilton where I'm supposed to be considered their "bread and butter".

Reviews.Title: “WOW Perfect with Kids”
Reviews.Author: fldavefan
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great hotel..we have a 4 yr old and a 2 year old and this was perfect... the aterslide for the 4 year old and a walk in pool for the 2 year old..not to mention a closed off bed room when the kids go to bed you can still have your own time and sit out on the porch or in teh living room. we got the 1 bed room suite and it was plenty it was bacically a 1 bed room condo..location is great its only a mile ro so away from just about anything you need (reasturants,grocery stores,gas stations,disney) would deffinatly recomend for any one who likes new clean roomy hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Attractive some functional issues/”
Reviews.Author: melnek
Reviews.Content: FIrst of all, let me say we have stayed in other locations for the past 10 years and usually find them very enjoyable. Here, the buildings are new, yery asthesically pleasing facility and room, while maybe being a bit designed for attractiveness vs function. The kitchen was great, but we usually see a list of the supplies in the room, and we found no list, and no wine opener! t did have an expresso maker, so a nice touch! There was almost no place to place things in the bathroom, but it was again, very attractive with a full walk in shower.... The staff is very friendly, but it did take us two days for someone to come up and fix the DVD player. Again, concept was good, function was not so. The DVD player, can be hooked up to some speakers, nice touch. But, the DVD player does not play CDs? what is that about? Also, the cable does not get music. It would have been nice to be able to play some CDs, not just DVDs. Internet, is free! just slow.. and the cord is short. No desk on which to put a laptop. We had stayed during a slow period (Last week in Aug) so there were very few poeple at the place, and two pools definately help out making it very comfortable without seeming to be crowded. The gym had really nice equipment, free weights, lots of treadmills, and machines... Definately in the middle of nothing, so you need a car... everything is at least 1-2 miles away, and no sidewalks on the main drag. From Building One, you can see the evening fireworks at Epcot form one side. Bedroom is great and drapes really keep out the sun. Furnishings are pretty, but not very comfortable for lounging. try sitting on the couch or chairs to watch a movie for a few hours, and you will have a sore back. no lounge chair. Couch does pull out to a king bed.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Chrisquitolindo
Reviews.Content: Very nice but be aware that this is not a traditional hotel so you might have to find your way around the premises on your own. This can prove frustrating, especially when you are left on your own to find the entrance to the second building after checking-in. This negative point is widely compensated by the quality of the room, very comfortable and well equipped. Avoid the shuttle to Universal Studios, it costs as much as parking at the park, you have to decide on the time of your return in advance, and the driver is somewhat wreckless. Beautiful swimming pools.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Resort”
Reviews.Author: goo0325
Reviews.Content: I liked everything about this hotel. Rooms were spacious and clean. Complimentary high-speed internet was fast. Clean swimming pools and jacuzzis. Food in restaurant was good, but each time I ate there (3 times) service was poor. Servers lack proper training and it is apparent no one takes the leadership role in the restaurant. The resort was crowded, but it never felt that way because there is plenty of room. Pool chairs were not on top of each other. It was possible to have conversations with family members without others overhearing. The Crowne Plaza Universal used to be my favorite hotel in Orlando-- now it is the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: EranTlv
Reviews.Content: We've travelled a family of 5, oredered 2 double room suite. Every thinng is new, the service is great, 2 pools with activities, nice mini market, fitness center, great location. Great !

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel at which I have stayed in years!”
Reviews.Author: Todd_Whitehurst
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2-bedroom suite at this hotel for one night for a brief family vacation to Disney World. The 2-bedroom suite consists of a 1-bedroom suite adjoined to a studio. Since the 1-bedroom suite and the studio each had a bathroom and a kitchen, then we had 2 full bathrooms and kitchens, which was great! The hotel is clearly brand new, and all of the furnishings are very nice. Each room had a full-sized balcony. The pool area is also very nice, with a very long twisty water slide that was a real treat for the kids. The hotel had activities by the pool and on the grounds all day, so the kids could be entertained there as well. My kids chose to stay at the pool area instead of going to Disney World! The location was good, as it was just a mile from Downtown Disney. I will definitely stay in this hotel again if I go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow747
Reviews.Content: We have been vacationing in Orlando Florida annually for the last 10 years. This hotel was the best. We stayed from Aug 3rd to 10th and had a fantastic time. The one bedroom was very spacious and clean. The kitchen was well equipped with house hold utensils and cleaning supplies. Housekeeping was fantastic. We couldn't be happier. The pool was clean and lots of towels and lounge chairs. The water slide was lots of fun. There is no life guard on duty, so if you have small kids, better have someone at the bottom for those non swimmers. We had no problems with the parking. Although the parking spots are a bit tight but there are lots of space available. Like other reviewers have said, the hotel is in a new area and its not even on the GPS. But after you have found it once, it's not a problem. Over all, we have found Parc Soleil to be relaxing and fantastic hotel. Hope all you will enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Kalibr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc Soleil for a timeshare presentation. Our 3-night stay was excellent! The accommodations were top notch and the service is what you’d expect from a Hilton. We had a large 1 bedroom suite (about 900sf) with a full kitchen which made us feel right at home. The resort amenities were superb including a well equipped fitness center and an amazing pool area. The resort is close to Disney, Sea World and Universal Studios. I highly recommend this resort for a romantic getaway, family vacation or business trip. We will definitely return to Parc Soleil.

Reviews.Title: “Great bedrooms, patchy service”
Reviews.Author: monaco7
Reviews.Content: Having read lots of positive reviews on TA I decided to not stay at Disney and opted for Parc Soliel, there are lots of positives about the hotel but also a lot of small niggles which added up, all if them were staff related and could be addressed. Positives: The 2 bedroom suite was well appointed and huge, I don't know of a better sized room. The kitchen facilities are excellent and the washer / dryer come in handy if you are on an extended stay. We only paid $195 per night + tax through Hiltons own site and I have to say that value for money is incredible. We had 4 nights in the Portofino Bay prior to this stay and paid more than double this rate for less than half the bedroom, albeit the Portofino has better restaurants etc. The parking and Internet are free too, on an extended stay these small items add up so credit to Hilton for the non-profiteering. I thought the parking was fine, the spaces are a bit tight but the elevators are right by the exit of the parking bays, we found the pool and the food was very good and again terrific value. We used the market place for last minute things but spent most of our money on a one-off trip to the supermarket to stock up on water/beer etc. As the room has a fully functioning kitchen we also bought breakfast items, this saved us time and expanding waist-lines. I've read a few people say it is out of the way - don't really understand that comment as I found the location to be ideal, it is almost equidistant to the Disney Parks and Universal Parks taking me around 15 minutes to anywhere. It is also only one mile to the Crossroads Retail Park which has countless restaurants, shopping and bars. The only way to get closer is to stay on property and pay a lot more, having stayed at The Grand Floridian a few times, it isn't worth the convenience when you get such an amazing room and great value at Parc Soliel. Negatives: when we arrived there was only one bellman on duty and he took an age to come empty our car, not a good first impression. We were ahead of the 16:00 check in time so didn't get our room, another small annoyance after a long journey, and when we asked for two rooms together with our friends we were only given rooms on the same floor but they weren't close at all. Housekeeping is VERY patchy, we left a gratuity every day but on the last day our beds were hardly made, nothing was cleaned and none of the bins emptied. We also has a sour waitress one of the nights (had a terrific waiter the previous meal) and she kinda made us feel uncomfortable, I did make a note on the check and a supervisor called to follow up. I asked for NO sales calls but still got two, I found being quite rude the second time worked rather well. Overall I found the staff to be very hit-or-miss, the management need to spend either more time training or more money hiring to improve the service, it does impact when you are on vacation if your room is a mess and the wait staff are impatient and unfriendly, however, these are all human issues which can be addressed. Overall having stayed at Disney a number of times, The Hard Rock and Portofino, this hotel was less than half the cost and a FAR better property, when I go back next year I'll stay again and hope the staff are a little more consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations - but not "Above and Beyond"”
Reviews.Author: Ginger2963
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parc Soleil 5 nights from 8/9/10 to 8/14/10. Our room was a 1-bedroom studio in Tower 2 (newest Tower). The hotel staff was friendly in all cases. We had some confusion upon check-in. We had requested a pool-view room, but the font-desk staff told us that there were no pool-view rooms available. They told us they were able to provide a room with a view of the Disney fireworks. But upon entering our room, it was actually a pool-view room. Not a big deal to us, but still a little confusing. Overall the room was clean and adequate size for both of us. The bathroom was a little awkward in layout, but still served its purpose. We have no kids, but the hotel had a nice itinerary of activities for children throughout the day and into the evening. The hotel also provides a nice selection of DVD rentals (DVD players are in the rooms) for a fee of $3.00 (good selection of movies). We spent 3 days at the pool and 2 days at the parks. We thought that the pool was beautiful and we had no problems finding chairs or shade for the days we spent at the pool. The pool is only open until 11pm, which does not work well if you want to go swimming at night after returning from a park (as pool will be closed). There is only 1 restaurant at the hotel and also a market café (which serves Starbucks coffee). We ate lunch at the restaurant twice and thought selection was good and food was great. We rented a car and had no issues with finding parking in the garage, especially upon arriving back at the hotel late at night. Our only complaint (as others have also posted) was that spots were narrow. We also were not happy with the housekeeping staff. Our room was not cleaned prior to 5:30 on each of the days we spent at the hotel (versus the parks). Cleaning staff was on the floor whole time, but never made it to our room (not sure if it is because we only had a studio and we were last on priority list). Each time we had to tell them not to clean as we wanted to get ready for the evening but needed them to do a quick change in towels at that point. We mentioned to a staff member on last day and were told that we need to request early cleaning. That was a new experience for us… We were asked to attend the sales presentation for the Hilton Grand Vacations Club. It actually was not as bad as I had expected. We did not feel pressured and the hotel provided us with free breakfast (muffins, bagels, fruit coffee, etc). Selection of incentives was nice as we chose the $100 AMEX gift card. Out presentation lasted 45 minutes as we said we were not interested up front (I have read reviews in which other presentations lasted longer and felt more pressured). Overall, we had a good experience that met our expectations (relaxing stay, clean room, friendly staff, and great pool area). We would recommend this hotel for the value received for the price paid. Also location is great to parks, restaurants, outlets, etc. But we did not feel that the Parc Soleil offered us anything above and beyond. So our next stay in Orlando will be at a different hotel given the large selection of 4 and 5-star hotels at a competitive price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: FitzD
Reviews.Content: Loved it! plain and simple. Its a new place. We will return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel; Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: fligster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in late July 2010 with my wife and 5 year old son. We had a little bit of trouble find the hotel. ARRIVAL: Because the roads in the area are new, the hotel provides an alternate address to use for GPS directions. My GPS thought the location was about 1.5 miles away from the actual hotel and had us going in the wrong direction. I would recommend switching to the hotels written directions once you are in the general area. We arrived at about 3:50 pm. There was nobody else checking in and it was fast and efficient. We were given a room in building 200 on the 12th floor with views of the Disney fireworks. You can see the fireworks but they are quite a distance away. ROOM: We had a one-bedroom suite, which was very large and had a full kitchen with full size appliances. There is also a washer/dryer in the unit, which had 2 packets of laundry detergent available. The sofa bed was not a standard, wire spring based unit. The sofa bed was made up of 3 thick foam sections that formed the mattress and was very comfortable. There are LCD televisions in the living room and bedroom. There was a wide selection of channels, but no PPV. The doors separating the bedroom were frosted French doors. They seemed to prevent sound transmission, but light from the living area did make the bedroom lighter if someone was trying to sleep while others had lights on in the living area. There was a large balcony with table, chairs and one padded lounge chair. There was a safe in the bedroom closet. There was a clock/radio in the bedroom that had an IPOD connection on the top. I was able to dock my iphone, to play music and also to charge it. The bathroom was large with double sinks, separate large shower and tub. The tub was cool, because the water filled from a hole in the ceiling. The toilet was in a little separate area with a pocket door to separate it from the rest of the bathroom. The bathroom could be accessed from both the living area and the bedroom. The toiletries were Crabtree & Evelyn brand. FOOD: We ate in the restaurant once for dinner. The good was good and not too expensive. There is a little market shop on property where they sell coffee, sandwiches, and have a small grocery selection. PARKING: The parking spots were on the smaller side, and there were a lot of columns etc that caused spaces to feel tight, but I didn’t have any problems maneuvering or parking our rental car (Chevy Impala). OTHER: The pool area is great. They have a zero entry pool with a water slide. The slide is a very good size for a hotel pool. It is longer than expected. They also have a children’s play area and an activity center. The activity center has a pool table, ping pong, WII, Playstation 3, board games etc. They also have activities throughout the day, and provide a brochure with all the times. We were asked a few times about joining a timeshare presentation. I think they should just ask once and then that is it. Also, once they called after 9pm when my kid was already asleep, luckily it didn’t wake him up. There are gym style lockers and changing areas in the restrooms by the pool. You need to bring your own combination lock, but they would be useful if you arrived early or were staying later after checking out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new resort that feels remote even in packed Orlando”
Reviews.Author: mbflyflyaway
Reviews.Content: The resort is brand new and beautiful. Excellent, walk-in pool for the little ones as well as another more adult-like pool (though no apparent restrictions on kids). The playground is excellent for little ones (and shaded too) and the restaurant opens right to the pool so you can eat while watching the kids slide down the slide. Poolside games and an excellent gaming/fun room make this resort perfect for those with kids. Sure Disney and SeaWorld are nearby, but if you want that break day or two during your trip, this is a great place to stay. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite that was perfect for our family of 4 plus another couple. The little ones slept on the pullout. 2 full bathrooms is nice too as well as the full kitchen. Balcony facing Disney World allowed us to watch the fireworks. The property is the only thing around for at least a mile which feels a bit abnormal in the craziness that is Orlando, however it won't last as the properties nearby look ready to build. Staff was excellent, with the exception of the timeshare salesman (haven't met many that aren't when you aren't ready to buy). We stayed for 7 nights so the 2+ hour timeshare presentation was worth it. Just prepared to say no and get the cold shoulder once you do (from the salesman - not anyone else). We loved the property and would return if the opportunity arises. The drive to Disney wasn't too bad, but even a short drive can be a long one if the traffic is bad (which is common). Internet was very slow, but still free.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings, was expecting better. The parking garage is horrendous & the second pool is NOT adults only.”
Reviews.Author: PWHerman
Reviews.Content: I agree 100% with bassy92's review of Parc Soleil on Aug .3. My girlfriend and I booked Parc Soleil for our week's vacation to Orlando based on the many positive reviews on Tripadvisor.com, and we also wanted to avoid the crowds at the Disney Resorts. I am sorry to say we made a huge mistake. The "hotel" was great, but the little nuisances kept adding up. My first issue with this place happened BEFORE I checked in. The Monday before our arrival I was contacted by someone trying to sell me a time share. She offered me Sea World park tickets or 20,000 Hilton points if I sat and listened to their sales pitch over a 90 minute breakfast. I politely declined, but she wouldn't give up. I finally told her that I was unavailable and hung up the phone. You would think that would be the end but it wasn't. Someone from sales called me at least 6 more times prior to my arrival, but I let the calls go right to voicemail. We drove to the Hilton, and was greeted by a friendly bellhop who took our luggage. I was under the impression that he was also going to valet my car, but he did not. We were told to park in the horrible parking garage (I'll address that later). The bellhop brought our luggage to our room and gave us a tour of our room and answered all of our questions. The positives: We opted for the 1 bedroom suite with balcony. The room was very spacious with a modern kitchen. The balcony was also large and was equipped with a table with 4 chairs and a lounge chair. The room was very clean, and housekeeping did a great job maintaining the cleanliness of the room. The complex has 2 very clean pools and plenty of chairs. The negatives: 6 things really stood out. First, the parking garage is terrible. The parking garage in building 200 is built right behind the restaurant, so all the exhaust from the restaurant goes right into the garage. The last night of our stay my girlfriend and I could barely breath walking through the garage. The spaces are also very tight. Because the spaces are so tight, people often hog two spaces so their cars don't get hit. I don't blame them for doing this, but it is still inconsiderate to the other guests. We elected to park outside the garage, but if you do be prepared to breath in the restaurant fumes. Second, the air conditioner. We had to keep our room temperature at 65 degrees. If we went above 65 the heater for some reason would kick on and the room would go to 85 degrees. We had to call maintenance twice about this issue, but we elected to just keep the room freezing. Third, garbage in the hallways. My room was very clean, however, for some reason housekeeping or other occupants left trash out in the hallway. Some of the trash smelled terrible and I feel this could be a health issue. Forth, sales will call you to get you to sit for the timeshare demonstration. I guess since I did not schedule to sit for the sales presentation, sales felt the need to keep nagging me during my trip. The do not like taking no for an answer. Fifth, contrary to other reviews and other internet sites, THE SECOND POOL IS NOT ADULTS ONLY. Our main reason for choosing the Parc Soleil was we read that they had an adults only pool as well as a main pool with a slide. The second pool is much smaller and quieter. We elected to go to that pool, however within minutes children were jumping and splashing everywhere. I even heard a parent say to his 2 children "come on, let's go make noise at the quiet pool." I guess this happens because management has no control of the grounds. Children are running around all over the pool areas, but no one says anything to them or their parents. Sixth, the beds are extremely uncomfortable. I have problems sleeping as it is, so it was almost impossible for me to sleep. The mattresses are way too soft and you sink into the mattress. We both woke up sore every morning. I wish I had better things to say about Parc Soleil. The grounds are really pretty, but there are way too many things that I could not over look. My guess is that the majority of the positive reviews are from Hilton Vacation Club members that do not want to say anything bad about the place, or are just in denial about these small but significant negative details that could potentially ruin your vacation. I also feel management needs to take an active role in controlling the parking and pool situation. My advice, and I hate to say this, but is to stay at a Disney Resort. I wish we did because we felt like we were outsiders in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: mhc0
Reviews.Content: New property and very nice. Rooms were huge and well appointed. Bathroom was great. The living room furniture was not very comfortable but we didn't spend much time there. When I made the reservation, months before we arrived, I requested a view of the Disney fireworks. in addition, the day before we arrived we were told it would be no problem. However, at check in I was promptly told we did not have that room even though I had requested it months before. I had to tell my son that even though I promised him the Disney fireworks he would have to do without. Thanks Parc Soleil for teaching my son a valuable life lesson. Despite the setback, my son said he would rather stay at Parc Soleil than at the Nickelodeon Hotel where we stayed last year. My wife says they have spacious suites and it is great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort and close to parks”
Reviews.Author: outlanderptc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for three nights. We arrived on an early am flight and took a taxi to this resort. There are no shuttles from the airport, but there is a lower priced taxi that we didn't know about. We paid too much for ours. When we arrived at the resort, they told us our room was ready and that was wonderful since we were all tired from our early flight! The woman who checked us in was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and it was absolutely beautiful. The room was very spacious with a full kitchen, and the couch made into a king size bed for our teenage girls. The bedroom was very spacious as well with a king size bed. We also had a very large balcony overlooking the pool area. The bathroom was wonderful as well and we were all quite in awe of the water that came from the ceiling into the stand alone bathtub. The only drawback was there needs to be more hooks or racks for hanging towels. We were on the 6th floor and the marketplace/store was just a quick elevator ride down. The prices were very reasonalble there and they also sold Starbucks coffee. Near the market was a wonderful restaurant/bar, so we were very close to everything. We had a wonderful stay at this resort and I would love to stay here again someday!

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: RLAL
Reviews.Content: Parc Soleil is relatively new. They have two towers built on the property and I believe are going to build an additional three towers. The towers line a .5 mile walking path. The hotel also has tennis courts and basketball courts as well as a great fitness facility. We rented a King Studio for a week and had a great view from the 14th floor! Each night, we could see the firework shows at Epcot and Magic Kingdom from our window. The rooms were nicely decorated and clean. We had a problem with our refrigerator not cooling and a replacement was provided without issue. And wood floors are a plus in my book! We were pleasantly surprised to have a laundry room just a few doors down from our studio room that we could wash and dry our laundry (no charge). Most of our trip, we spent at the "quiet" pool. But we did venture down the waterslide a few times which was a blast. The hotel has planned activities throughout the day for kids and adults. We enjoyed the ice cream social! It was also very nice to have a convenience store / deli shop on site. Prices were not that bad for the convenience. And the sandwiches were very yummy made from there! The Parc Soleil appeared to be located on a new stretch of road that is developing. For us, being away from the congestion near Disney was nice. But having the ability to drive 5-10 minutes to attactions was a plus. Many restaurants were also close by. We had GPS to help and it worked satisfactorily with getting us there. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “This place was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: kimcatal
Reviews.Content: I just recently came back from Orlando on July 28, 2010. We stayed at the Parc Soleil by Hilton. It was awesome, clean and all the employees were very nice. The only thing is you have to take the shuttle to the parks which is $12 round trip per adult or a taxi to go anywhere if you dont have a car. The front desk guys were superb. I feel for them they wear a cotton, polyester uniform. Management you need to redesign the front desk uniforms to something more appropriate for Orlando in July.

Reviews.Title: “Nice "Time Share" Resort”
Reviews.Author: runfarandfast
Reviews.Content: As all the reviews have said here, this place is very nice. But one thing to keep in mind is that this is not technically a Hotel. It's one of 48 resorts of the Hilton Grand Vacation Club. It's new and there are currently 2 of future 7 buildings already on the property. That being said, the rooms are huge, with full kitchens (suites have the kitchen included).....think of a condo. Staff/service are extremely pleasant and are by the most part happy to be working at this facility. You will not be disappointed with your stay for the price.....value is extremely high. Since it is a Hilton Grand Vacation Club resort....they sell deeds to this place...and have many visitors on site doing tours and sales pitches. If you're up to hearing what they offer....they reward with good incentives to listen. Not extremely high pressure but again........it's a modified offering of a "timeshare". Close to Disney and SeaWorld, brand new, CLEAN!, super huge rooms, great service, happy staff, good food at reasonable prices...........again, you cannot go wrong with this choice of stay for your vacation. Highly recommended.....its not ritzy......but it is nice

Reviews.Title: “Perrrrrrrrrrrfect.”
Reviews.Author: SantaYalla
Reviews.Content: WOW, WOW. I had read the reviews prior to booking this hotel and I can say, i was not disappointed. Great location if you have a car, great service, beautiful pools and great for kids. I just love this place. Thanks God we found a great hotel to make our Orlando trip a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay EVER!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisStephanie
Reviews.Content: Stressed doing research to find the perfect hotel for my family - husband, 3 year old boy, 11 year old girl & 14 year old boy. This hotel was MAGNIFICENT!! It was beautifully decorated and very upscale....extremely modern and clean. I cannot say enough about this place. Pool and water slide was awesome! Kids room by the pool where they had internet access, xbox, WII.... music during the day by the pool.... I highly recommend this place. And it's super convenient to everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait until next year to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: HANNAHS34
Reviews.Content: This is a newer Hilton Vacation Club hotel/condo. We had a one bedroom with pull out sofa, full kitchen. We were on the 8th floor with a view of Epcot in the distance. The room was immaculate. The kitchen was equiped with top of the line appliances. The bathroom was romantic and large. An extra deep tub that filled from the ceiling. (yes the faucet was in the ceiling) The kids loved it. The hotel hada huge pool with a water slide (just wish it was open until close of pool) plus there was another pool to enjoy. They had games and activities for families and kids. A huge playroom. Nice bar and restaurant. We suggested while we were there to have the servers come to families enjoying the pool and once they started doing that it avoided us having to leave the kids and order food. We watched a movie pooside on a 23 foot screen. The kids loved it!! We loved drinking coffee ad reading the comp paper on the balcony. The parking garage was a plus with the heat. The staff was always happy. The walking trail around the pond was nice. We were able to see the Disney fireworks from our balcony. I do not recommend staying on Disney (yes you have the pleasure of free transportation) but the difference in cost is amazing. This hotel was super. I can't wait to book for next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Large suites with modern decor”
Reviews.Author: Yallahs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for three nights and enjoyed the resort greatly. We had a one bedroom suite and it was excellent! Our suite overlooked the fountains/man-made lake, and we were able to see the fireworks from Disney/Universal Studios at nights The property was nicely landscaped and the check-in area was nicely decorated. The suite was large with a large balcony for lounging and dining (lounge chair and patio dining table and chairs). The shower was large for two people and the tub was unique, with the plumbing in the ceiling. The living room /dindingroom/kitchen area was very spacious and nicely decorated with well appointed furnishing and a rug. The bedroom was large and also well decorated. The bed, however, was not very comfortable. Overall, this is a great place to stay when visiting Orlando. With so much to do in the area, I wish that I had more time to spend in the suite just enjoying it and using the kitchen to prepare a simple meal to enjoy on the patio with my favorite breverage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Perfect for families.”
Reviews.Author: JamesD101
Reviews.Content: All the conference hotels were booked up so I stayed here. Great value, The large rooms would be perfect for a family. Very, very nice, new and super clean. It was a steal for the price. Cons: It's an up and coming planned development. Can be hard to find with GPS since it's a tiny new road the developer created. Also the parking garage was a bit hard to navigate in in a larger car.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: CarloLivorno
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, two kids of 12 and 9, and our staying of 8 days was great. Perfect the location, near to amusement parks, outlets and supermarkets, and perfect the hotel that is a real vacation resort. The swimming pools were cleaned and huge with a slide perfect for children amusement. The room, I mean the apartment, was big enough to make us feel at home when we were back from our rides in the parks. Everything was perfect except the hour of housekeeping of the room. Sometimes it was too early (8:30 a.m.), sometimes early afternoon or later, sometimes........never. Anyway I'm sure they will improve. This resort is absolutely perfect for everyone who wants to combine an 'amusement parks' vacation with a real relaxing staying in the wonderful location of Parc Soleil.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the middle of attractions”
Reviews.Author: jon_turner
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay and i was sad to leave. This is a gorgeous property in the heart of all the attractions. I was a little nervous travelling alone with 3 kids but I found the hotel just fine from the airport. We arrived around 12am and we were greeted by Jeffery who made us feel comfortable and welcome. He was nice enough to give each of my 3 girls a nice package of goodies. We parked in the parking garage and it was well lit only complaint was the parking spaces are very small. We went to our room and my mouth hit the floor. Gorgeous, just simple gorgeous. The beds were comfy, the rooms large and the bathroom was top notch. The 1st time I went to give the kids a bath I just about died when the water that fills the tub came from the ceiling. It was nice having a full kitchen so we could at least have breakfast in the room and a place to put drinks and snacks. I never thought i would use a washer and dryer on vacation but I did and let me tell you coming home and just putting clothes away was so much nicer than coming home and doing a weeks worth of laundry. It was also handy having the little market downstairs for things like milk, cereal and not to mention the morning starbucks. This resort is only 5mins from everything and everywhere (disney, seaworld, walmart, shops, restaurants ect...). The kids loved the pool and it was nice that it was open until 11pm so after a hot day at attractions it was great to cool down in the pool before bed. I strongly recommend this resort and I won"t stay anywhere else in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, you will not be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: holidaytimeplease
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for twelve nights in June 2010. For a young couple this hotel is fantastic. The grounds are classy and well kept and the suite room (more like a small appartment) is mind blowing. To get a suite of this size and standard in a city like New York or London would cost mega bucks. Staff friendly and helpfull. The Hilton Parc Soliel makes Disneys accommodation look overpriced and I believe some of there hotels are getting a little tired (I have never stayed at one myself). I have also stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress and praised it at the time but this betters it in most places. Lots of families with young kids here but this did not detract from the overall experience for a young couple. The maid always offered us extra everything (dishwasher/washing powder). The grounds and communal areas are so expansive that it never feels very busy giving it a relaxing atmosphere. The parking is undercover so the car is nice and cool (relatively speaking) when you get in it. Be warned you will recieve a phone call regarding time share opportunities with a genuine and generous incentive if you take them up on the offer of a hotel tour, we did not (we`re on holiday for goodness sake). This is the only little blip however everything else was top notch. We could have lived in that suitelong term quite comfortably

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: estabrks
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. Our first stay was for one night prior to an Animal Kingdom Lodge stay.
