We were so pleased with the hotel we decided to stay here during our next visit. This visit was 5 nights long and we reserved a two bedroom suite. The hotel is only a year old so everything is still new and shiny. The beds are all kings which we love. They are comfortable, too. The restaurant has excellent food that we felt was relatively reasonable. Most sandwiches were around $9 and included excellent sides, including caesar and regular salad. They had soup for $6. Kids' meals were $6, too. The activity center is new and wonderful - ping pong, pool table, tons of computers to use, board games, wii, etc. the pool is great for kids. the huge water slide is a blast. it is a zero entry pool so little guys have lots of safe room to play. While at Disney my kids (ages 6 and 4) kept asking to go back to the hotel they liked it so much. the kitchen is well stocked. we ate several meals at the hotel and had all the cooking supplies we needed. you may want to bring some paper plates, though, if you have more than 4 in your party and reserve only a one bedroom because they only provide 4 of everything. The hotel is fairly close to Disney - 5 minutes to epcot. it is about 1-2 miles from downtown disney. In sum, having LOTS of space in the suite, king bed, and wonderful hotel amenities easily made up for having to drive and park at the attractions! I would suggest renting a one bedroom over a studio if at all possible as the studios are a little cramped and don't have a full kitchen. they are more like a traditional hotel room. I know this because the studio is the second bedroom/bath in the 2 bedroom/2 bath suite. It's GREAT as a second bedroom, but not as a stand alone. One last thing, we had a room overlooking the fireworks and trees. we really enjoyed this even thought the fireworks are in the distance. the only draw back to this view is that if you look straight down you see the lot for the next new building.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: arjames
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous, great location, was literally 20 minutes drive from all the attractions, the perfect place to stay out of a Disney Resort, I personally think this hotel is head and shoulders above any Disney resorts I have stayed at in the past! The rooms were beautiful and the pool area's were clean. The cafe bar/restaurant was really reasonably priced and the food was wonderful!! I celebrated my 30th birthday and my engagement there and I wouldn't have wanted to spend it anywhere else. We will be back and would not choose anywhere else to stay in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “We will back!”
Reviews.Author: anna191
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 9 day stay and truly enjoyed this hotel. We had a 1 bedroom suite on the 10th floor in Building 1 overlooking the pool. The room was modern, spacious, clean and had anything you could possibly need. The staff and service was just great. My kids loved the restaurant and the beautiful pool area. The resort was fully booked during our stay yet never felt crowded. There were plenty of kids activites by the pool. My kids never wanted to leave the pool area. The location is perfect if you are looking for some peace and quiet yet be 5 minutes away from shopping and restaurants. It took us 10 minutes to get to Disney. I can't imagine staying anywhere else. I felt very safe and thought this hotel was very kid friendly. Overall we had such a positive experience. This hotel met and exceeded our expecations.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marsjanet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a one bedroom suite for a few days. Everything was brandnew as the vacation club just opended. Still there is construction but there was not too much noise. Staff was very friendly. Better chose a room on a higher level as mine was just above the garage where you heard the cars at night/early morning. An outlet center is close by, just a 10 minutes drive.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAK987
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to the Parc Soleil for my parents buisness. Where do I start? First it's when of those place that you could let kids walk around in and feel safe. The kids room blew our minds and expections away. The kids activites were fun and the directors were ton of fun to be around. My brother enjoyed it so much that he stayed there 10 hours straight with out any distraction. The pool was nothing short of miraculous and the slide was amazing. The room itself was gorgeous. My grandmother was there with us. Now understand this women gets up at 6:00 every morning there she got up at 9:00. The restraunt was great with a ton of variety. Now I would end this with a complaint but I can't think of any so i'll just say this. The Parc Soleil is a truly wonderous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in orlando”
Reviews.Author: TIMGreenville_sc
Reviews.Content: stayed in a large 2 bedroom suite, excellent customer service, beauiful pool, convienent to disney and sea world

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: sarahli07
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 9 days because of others' reviews/recommendations and wish to contribute mine as well. We enjoyed staying here so much with all its in-room comforts and conveniences that we extended our stay by 2 days! Here are the good and bad: Good: 1. At USD129.00+ tax per day for a one brm suite, it was a wonderful deal compared to Disney's resort hotels. 2. The room with a king size bed and the living area with a sofa bed are spacious with a flat screen TV in each room. 3. The one bathroom has a tub, glass shower room, and a separate toilet room. The basin counter is spacious with 2 sinks on a granite top. 4. The beds are comfortable with enough pillows. 5. The well equipped kitchen area has a big fridge with good size freezer compartment, toaster, dishwasher, oven, micro wave oven, cutlery, glasses, plates, kettle, etc, for warming and preparing simple meals if a family does not wish to go out for a meal after a tired day. 6. It also has a washer and dryer in the room which is wonderful for time saving and convenience esp after a long tired day out. 7. It has a big swimming pool with a nice decent size slide for kids. 8. The staff are helpful and friendly. I guess they are making an effort to promote their relatively new hotel and vacation club plans. 9. The grounds are safe and big with 2 blocks of hotel currently. The Bad: 1. It is not easy to locate this hotel, even on our Garmin GPS with its Des Forges address although it is about 10 minutes drive away from the Disney Parks. 2. There are times when we were so tired after a long tiring hot day that we wondered if we should have just booked a Disney resort hotel because it is just a hop on a bus/boat/train away, instead of having to hop on Park bus to reach our car and then to drive back to our hotel. 3. It is not within short walking distance of any shop or restaurants. It looks like it is in the middle of a big expanse of land on its own with room to build a few more blocks of vacation homes. 4. Housekeeping needs to be called to clean your room in the morning or they might be real late in cleaning up your room like 5pm. Overall, the good far outweigh the bad. If I have to do it all over again, I will. Disney may be more convenient but the new hotel with all its in-room conveniences and space plus its value price is hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: Mamamolu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc Soleil for two nights in April; we got an amazing deal through hotels.com and only paid something like $85 per night including the tax! The hotel is being built as we speak, there are at least three more buildnings planned on the property, and it sort of feels "unfinished." It's a very nice hotel and good pool area, but if you look the other way there's an empty field where they haven't started building yet. Free parking and wifi, which is always a nice touch. Rooms are comfy and quite large, and a very posh bathroom which I liked :) Great bed too - but an extremely noisy air conditioner which we had to turn off to be able to sleep. It feels a little out of the way, but it didn't really bother us as everything is still within a few minutes of driving. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and I'm sure it will be amazing once it is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms. Luxurious Bath!”
Reviews.Author: JSTn29306
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights during quick get away in Dec 2009. Great location on Palm Parkway -- you'll need a car. But very convenient to I-Drive, Disney and Universal. Room was beautiful and comfy. We had one bedroom suite with a fantastic bathroom - separate glass shower, water closet (toilet) and but with ceiling spout. There were only a few buildings built in December. Spa was not yet open and it was too chilly to use the pool area. Plan to go back later in 2010 (September hopefully). This place is at the top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Rossi2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 14nights, the daily maid service was excellent very clean and tidy. Facilties are excellent, pool, childrens den area and restaurant is good food. The location is great for all disney parks, international drive and other restaurants too. We recommend to anyone and will stay again in near future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelerTPA
Reviews.Content: We travel to Orlando from Tampa a great deal since we have young children and annual passes to Disney. This resort is absolutely SUPERB! We stayed in a one bedroom suite with our 2 young children and it gave us plenty of room. The kitchen was beautiful--granite and stainless. You can comfortably prepare meals and sit at the 4-person table. Pool was fantastic with lots of activities--our 5 year old LOVED the slide! We enjoyed fireworks from our spacious balcony every evening. The room was extremely clean since the resort is new. Decor is beautiful. Loved everything about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!!!”
Reviews.Author: MFamilyUtah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week with 3 children ages 9 and 11. We all loved this hotel. We received wonderful service and had plenty of room to stretch out and feel like we were at home. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. We loved having a kitchen. We stayed in a two bedroom suite and had lots of space. We enjoyed walks around the walking path my kids had fun catching frogs and putting them in the bushes. We all enjoyed the pools and the slide. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “UNBEATABLE VALUE”
Reviews.Author: harryly
Reviews.Content: As a family we have been holidaying in Orlando since 1988. We have stayed onsite at Disney and also at Beuna Vista Palace, Floridays, Hyatt Regency and Omni Champions gate. In view of this my review of the Parc Soleil would be based on a comparison with these hotels. Firstly, if you are expecting a top service hotel then this place is not for you!! If you require a clean well managed hotel with an awesome pool in a great location for value for your Dollar, euro or in my case Pound then the Parc Soleil for what get will beat most comparable hptels hands down. Try and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, great location and superb price performance!”
Reviews.Author: mart1no
Reviews.Content: Very well equipped, and nearby Disney area. Each room with LCD TV 's complete cable and free wireless, very convenient grocery store at the 1st floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and had such a great time.”
Reviews.Author: TallTiff
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. My friend and I stayed in the 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen. It was extremely clean and everything was fully functioning. The first night we thought something was wrong with the dvd player so someone came to look at it only to find out that the cords were unplugged in the back. The person who came in was extremely nice and made sure were we comfortable with everything. All of the employees we ran into would always say hell with a warm smile, which I think says a lot about a hotel. We could not have been happier about our stay here. I am definitely going back. It was worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andreaponte
Reviews.Content: I've been in this hotel in April 2010 with my husband and children. We decided to rent two interconnected rooms (one with sitting room, kitchen and a huge balcony), the two for $ 235 by day. Everything was perfect. Beautiful furniture and well preserved and the kitchen objects clean and bright, which seemed never been used. Many facilities such as washing machine and clothes dryer, dishwasher, coffee maker, blender, etc.. The location was good with easy access (by car) to all sites. The recreation area was wonderful, with huge pool, waterslide, shop. I loved and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: CrisGodoy
Reviews.Content: We had a marvelous stay at Parc Soleil! The hotel is located in an still unoccupied area, but is very close to the parks (15 minutes) and very silent. The buildings (only 2 for the moment) are very nice, new and clean, and the pools seem excellent, although we didn't have time to enjoy them. We had the 1 bedroom suite for US$ 159/day in building A, and it was simply the best hotel room we have ever had. Modern, clean, spacious, with everything you need to feel at home: full spotless kitchen with flatware and all the necessary appliances, laundry washer/dryer (detergent included), 2 flat TVs, a king-size sofabed, a beautiful balcony with table and chairs and a lounge chair, and an enourmous bathroom with separate WC, separate shower, and a wonderful bathtub. Only the closet is a little small for such a huge suite. Front desk was very professional and helpful; we asked for a quiet room and they put us far from the main pool, which has music and entertainment for the kids. We had housekeeping every day of our stay. No problems with air conditioning, but I should say that we used to turn it off from time to time and open the balcony doors, since we like fresh air. High speed Internet and parking are free. The only minor inconvenience were the two calls from the time-sharing sales personnel, inviting us to a free breakfast. They were very polite, though, and we just said no, thanks. Very easy express check-out: they leave a statement of charges in the room, you dial a number, informing your name and unit number. You leave the keys in the room and off you go! We are looking forward to go back to Orlando and the Parc Soleil. We hope they keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool!”
Reviews.Author: MelDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc Soleil over Labor Day weekend in 2009. We rented a 2 bedroom unit with another couple and our 3 daughters....2 3.5 year olds and a 2 year old. The unit was big enough for us to be comfortable and we were not in it often since we were in Orlando and the resort had an awesome pool area. The pool area has a huge waterslide, free form activity pool, playground and a quiet pool. The girls has such a great time that we skipped the parks one day and just played at the pool. There is a restaurant and bar at the pool, serving casual food and tropical drinks. Everyone at the resort was very friendly and eager to help out. The resort seems a bit remote but it is only 2 miles from downtown Disney. This was our second trip to Orlando and I have to say that we enjoy staying off the Disney property...sometimes you jsut need a break from the mouse.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, modern and well-priced hotel!”
Reviews.Author: uL13
Reviews.Content: I invested a lot of time in finding the right hotel for our trip to Orlando. I wanted a well priced hotel with a large room, nice pool and located in the middle of all entertainment parks and for me the Parc Soleil by Hilton Grand Vacations Club seemed the perfect choice. This was our first time in Orlando and we were really excited. We arrived quite late in Orlando, around 10pm, got our rental car and drove directly to the hotel. The hotel is located in a quite area, because there isn't really much around the hotel, except the road. No chance going out for a walk just to get something for breakfast or something like that, except you like walking around 30-40 mins one way. If staying there I would really recommend a rental car, because you're just more flexibel and there is so much to discover in Orlando and with a car you can really take out all of every day. The hotel also offers free parking with much space in the parking block. The check-in went very quickly, only around 3 mins. We booked a studio suite, with a large kitchenette, seperate living area with flat TV, huge bath room, very comfortable bed room with one more flat TV and a huge balcony with a nice view. The suite was just amazing, just like the price. One thing I've got to criticize is the housekeeping, which could have been much better, like many other users here on TripAdvisor mentioned before. They sometimes completely forgot cleaning up the floor or replacing the soap and detergent. Well, and there was the strange construction of the shower, which sprayed the water on the bath room floor, even when there was the curtain. As I already mentioned the hotel is just in the middle of nowhere but also in the middle of everywhere. Sounds strange, but if you want to go out for a walk, there is hardly a chance reaching something useful like a Walmart or Starbucks. But if you got a car, you can reach everything within some minutes. Seaworld or Discovery Cove are only like 5 mins away, just like the next Walmart also just 5 mins, or Disney World about 15-20 mins. We had a great time at the Parc Soleil by Hilton Grand Vacations Club and I would recommend this hotel to everyone, who looks for a well-priced, modern and new hotel, plus free WiFi and free parking. In combination with a car, this was our perfect hotel choice and we had a fantastic time in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: CGeorgeMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the property and I am very impressed. I definitely took into consideration the earlier reviews. I had read that there wasn't much housekeeping done during the stay. I would like to clarify that if you stay more than four nights your room will have a full cleaning. I was a little nervous about that but I figured I could work around it. I was pleasantly surprised that housekeeping came every day and emptied the trash, made the beds, and new towels set out. I was pleasantly surprised that they did the dishes in the sink. My room was always clean when I returned at the end of the day. My room was beautiful and it had a very fancy dvd/tv/stereo system in the livingroom. I had to call down for help and Derek at guest services knew the exact answer. Also, gotta love the bell carts on every floor in the garage. Those were a lifesaver with groceries and luggage at check in. All of the staff were great from the reception, concierge, housekeeping, and parking. All so polite! Its a sign of very well managed property! Great job Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jamesyp1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our honeymoon in May 2010, which was our 3rd visit to Orlando. Lake Buena Vista area is definitely a great area for access to all the parks, and access to the motorway. The hotel is still quite new, but is first rate. We stayed in a King suite studio, and it was very comfortable with a kitchenette and large shower (no bath). It has 2 amazing pools - 1 with a water slide - plus several jacuzzi's. It has a snack bar, small market for everday stuff and an area for kids with TV's pool tables and PS3's etc and free internet access. Great location, which in my opinion is better than staying on International drive, and has made our honeymoon amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Best value around.”
Reviews.Author: fairynana
Reviews.Content: For years we felt the only place to stay when visiting Disney World was on-site, paying on-site prices (high). When Parc Soliel first opened we went to Orlando for a birthday celebration at Discovery Cove and Sea World and we stayed there. We were so pleasantly surprised at the quality of the suite for the price as well as the pool. We just revisited Parc Soliel this past weekend and were provided the penthouse 1 bedroom suite, which was wonderful. I think the restaurant needs some tweaking but the small store is convenient and stocked well, fitness center and activity center are both great. If you don't mind not having housekeeping for small visits, this place is great. If you need to clean up, there is a broom and dust pan for your use. We will definitely continue to stay at this facility and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best place we've stayed to date”
Reviews.Author: mjsmanderson
Reviews.Content: First off a little about us: We are in our late 30's with a 9 and 10 year old. We go every May to Disney for 7-10 days. We don't stay on-property because it is too expensive for what you get and prefer a little more variety in food. We've stayed at various Marriott resort/vacation properties, Renaissance at Sea World, Hyatt Grand Cypress and multiple other time-share properties. We've decided that Parc Soleil is the best place so far! Our experience: We stayed at the Parc from May 12 - 19. We purposely chose mid-May since there are fewer tourists and it is considered off-season. I reserved the room 4 weeks in advance and talked directly with Hilton reservations which gave me a $125 "Managers Special" instead of the $159 rate initially offered. We were able to check in by 2 PM, and into a 1-bedroom suite of our choosing (new building, high floor overlooking Disney fireworks). Parking was tight, but there were plenty of open spaces - I was just happy for covered parking! Luggage carts were available in the parking garage - I turned down the luggage bellhop's help. We were stunned at how nice the room actually was. It was clean, and everything (appliances, TVs, furniture, materials) was top notch. My kids slept on the king-size pull out sofa which as quite comfortable. We made breakfast in the kitchen every morning, and even ate supper there a few times. We used the washer/dryer several times as well. Complaints on the loudness of the Air Conditioning are well-founded, however it never really bothered us. We occasionally heard the people next door, but it wasn't that bad. Although the view was what we requested, it did look out over the future building sites of other Hilton buildings, which was not very nice, but we never really spent that much time sitting on the balcony - which is HUGE. We did watch the fireworks one night, which were about 5 miles away. Beds are comfortable, bathroom is huge with a lock-off toilet room, and the shower has good water flow. Watch out for the toilet - it might suck you in when you flush! TV has alot of channels, but no movie rental options - you have to physically rent a DVD in the family center which costs $3 - small selection but they have a few new titles. You can also check out board games, play pool, and other kid-friendly activities there, which is right off of the main pool area. Free internet was nice, and the exercise room is better than many hotels I've stayed - and I travel for work. The pool is awesome! We've stayed at the Hyatt Grand Cypress several times and although it is bigger there, the Parc has a much bigger waterslide, zero entry area, and is conveniently located next to the restaurant so food/beverages are easier to get. For supper one time we called the kids out of the pool - they ate - then jumped right back in to play some more. Pool hours are long (8 AM to 11 PM). Overall, I prefer this property to the Hyatt Grand Cypress and the other Marriott 5 star resorts we've stayed at for the following reasons: 1) Its easy to get somewhere without having to walk a mile - the proximity of the pool to our room to the restaurant and everything else is very close and well thought out. 2) We prefer value luxury - we like staying at the very nice places but don't like being nicked-and-dimed for the extra stuff like bellhop/luggage, exercise room, internet, resort beverage (pool bar) only rules, towel service, etc that alot of the more expensive places tack on (most make you pay a daily "resort fee" that covers this stuff). If you want to be 'serviced' as if you are staying at a 6 star spa resort, then I suggest you go somewhere else. However, this place has good amenities that bridge the gap. Convenience store featuring Starbucks surpassed my expectations. They were pricier on foodstuff, but by the time you jump in your car and drive to the rip-off tourist grocery store it isn't that bad if you are buying a little detergent or ice cream. Starbucks coffee varies depending on who is mixing the drink. Deli is good for a quick bite. And they sell bathing suits if you forget yours. Wine is way overpriced. Restaurant is not a 4 star food place, but suffices to fill your stomach without ripping apart your wallet. Enough variety to eat there several times. The problem waitress referred to in other reviews seems to be gone. We liked eating poolside while watching the kids play. Overall, it was the little things that captured our attention: while relaxing by the pool, security makes its rounds about every 10-15 minutes, and we noticed they inquired about several very young children seemingly playing by themselves, making sure their parents were nearby. Staff came through regularly to clean up towels, straighten chairs, and check to see if we needed anything. They even came by and cleaned up bird poop off of a planter nearby. We received only one phone call within 15 minutes of checking in to attend a time-share presentation, which I turned down. The $100 gift card or discounted tickets were not enough to entice me to sit through the 1 hour presentation. There is a $25 late check out fee during busy times, but we were able to stay until noon without the fee by calling the morning of and requesting late check out. The only complaints I have are with housekeeping - we had to ask twice for towels and once for new bedsheets for the sofa bed. There was one day our room wasn't cleaned until after 5 PM. Cleaning was inconsistent, and sometimes the soap and detergent were not replaced when used. Also, the cleaning staff (not restaurant, store, or desk staff) were a little rude when we encountered them in the elevator area or garage. With my family of four when using the elevator or going to our cars, several times we had to stop and let the staff enter the elevator first or drive their golf carts down the ramp when it should be the other way around since we were guests. It was a good stay and we left here to go to the Hyatt Grand Cypress for 4 days. We were so disappointed staying there after the Parc, even though we'd stayed there before and they had undergone a multi-million dollar renovation. We will stay there again assuming the prices don't double.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort But BEWARE OF TIMESHARE SALES TOURS!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lear192
Reviews.Content: Make sure you know this is a Timeshare property for Hilton and you will not get daily housekeeping. I booked this resort through Hilton since I am a HHonors member. A few weeks before we were to arrive I received call wanting to check on my up coming reservation. Come to find out it was a solicitation to sign me up for a timeshare sales tour. The woman said it would be real quick and I could receive a 100 dollar visa card for my tour. So I reserved a timeshare tour at 8am the last day at this resort before I went to another property. I arrived at 4pm and went inside since I saw no bellman around. Check in was fine and there was popcorn and coloring books in the lobby for the kids. After checking in I unloaded all my luggage myself since I still could not get help from a bellman. I went and parked my truck In the outdoor parking since my truck would not fit in the parking garage. I returned and still no bellman. We waited for a total of 15 min to get a bellman to get our bags. We arrived at our room which was a 1 bedroom suite on the 8th floor. The kitchen is very nice with Granite counters and stainless appliances. The living room is of nice size with a pullout KING size bed. The bedroom has a large King size bed and both rooms having flat panel tv"s on the wall. The bathroom was HUGE and has a tub that is free standing that is filled from the ceiling. YES water comes out of the ceiling to fill up the tub. The balcony is very large with a table and chairs and a lounge chair. The pool is a walk in pool and the water slide is fun for kids and adults. The pool side food is good. On the last day I had my timeshare tour at 8am. WE RECEIVED A CALL IN OUR ROOM AT 7:30 MAKING SURE WE WERE GOING TO BE ON TIME AND ATTENDING OUR TOUR!!!!!! This was fine since we were almost ready and the sales center was beside the lobby. ME AND MY PREGNANT WIFE WITH TWINS (because you have to bring your spouse). We checked in at the front desk at 8am. We were told someone would be with us in a min. We continued to wait but as everyone else who arrived were whisked away on a tour we were left waiting After 20 min we decided we could not wait any longer since my wife was pregnant and we already had waited almost 1/3 of the time of the tour. I informed the front desk we were not going to wait and their was no expiation or we are sorry for the inconvenience just OK. I was not happy with this experience so I called the Hilton Vacation Club Sales line and spoke to a manager and he explained he could not help me I had to contact the resort sales center direct and speak with a manager on duty. He did tell me that they probably over booked. Apparently they give priority to guests that are solicited deals to come to the resort and take a mandatory tour or they have to pay full price. I guess I was not very important since I paid full price to stay at the resort and my time was wasted. I left a message for the manager on duty at the sales center at the resort but I have still to date not received a call. The main thing is the resort is supper nice but the bell service needs help. I would stay again but do yourself a favor and don't make the mistake I did and get your time wasted on the hope of a 100 dollar gift card.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel3573
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel from May 1-9th and had an incredible stay. I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews, but we had an excellent stay and will definitely stay there again. We were in tower one in a 2BR penthouse on the 15th floor. The rooms were beautiful and the king size beds were great. The view overlooking the pool was amazing. We loved the huge balcony. My kids loved the pool and the waterslide. We ended up eating 4 dinners at the pool because my kids were so happy there. The food at the pool restaurant was very good and I felt it was reasonably priced. We went to the local grocery store and bought snacks and beverages which we were able to bring to the pool which saved a lot of money. The pool was busy at times but never overcrowded. You could always find tables and chairs. I loved having the washer and dryer in the room and did wash daily. It was so nice to come home with clean clothes. They provided detergent which was also great. I do agree that housekeeping could be improved. We were there 8 nights and our room was only cleaned once after the fourth night. They did not come into our room at all on the other days so our beds were never made. There was a place to take your trash so we took out our own trash daily. They did not restock our coffee or detergent but one call to guest services and it was sent up immediately. The staff was friendly and my kids loved the workers at the pool. All the slide attendants knew my children's names. We loved the movie nights by the pool and the game room was great. My kids went down the slide a few hundred times. The hotel is surrounded by vacant properties but the Hilton property itself is nice. We were only a few minutes from restaurants, Walmart and grocery stores. While you couldn't walk anywhere, you could drive there quickly. Disney was about 15 minutes. The concierge had great dinner recommendations and great coupons. Our room did not have any noisy AC - thank goodness. Parking in tower one had very narrow spots but the garage was never full so you could park further away if you wanted to protect your car. The elevator came quickly even to the 15th floor. Besides improving the housecleaning, I really don't have any complaints. My kids thought this was the best hotel EVER which made it great for us as parents. We were at the parks a lot during the day so missed a lot of activities at the pool, but they seemed to have a lot of them. If we hadn't already bought park tickets, my kids would have been just as happy staying at the hotel. You can even get your hair braided or a temporary tatoo at the pool which was a big hit with the kids. If you are looking for a kid friendly hotel, I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Return to Hilton Parc Soleil”
Reviews.Author: TwoAzMom
Reviews.Content: All I can say is how much we enjoyed our stay at Hilton Parc Soleil. We were there for almost a week and have already booked a return visit for . When I chose this hotel I read a bunch of reviews on various hotels before choosing this one. Even after I booked it I kept second guessing my decision because you never can be sure until you actually stay somplace yourself. I was not disappointed. We thoroughly enjoyed it and can't wait to return. The hotel is kept spic and span. The staff do an excellent job making sure that this hotel is kept spotless. The pool and hot tub are sparkling clean. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. The fold out sofa is actually comfortable. The location in my opinion is perfect. You are minutes away from a ton of restaurants and just minutes to downtown disney and disney attractions. We enjoyed Carrabas, Olive Garden & TRex. I did not find any issue with service. We had an "accident" over night with my 4 year old son and the staff promptly brought us new sheets and a replacement cover for the bed with a change of sheets for the fold out. The pool is a 10. The pictures do not do it justice. In fact, it was one of the rare times that I actually enjoyed myself at a pool with my children instead of being worried the whole time about them drowning. The zero entry is the BEST. I did not know what that was but basically like a lake, with a very gradual increase in the depth. The water sprays everywhere are GREAT fun for the kids and the most amazing waterslide. I enjoyed it just as much as my children. The playground is wonderful, covered with a light tent so a nice place for the kids to get out of the sun. The hotel description does not do the Hilton Justice. It does not explain that there is a lovely pond on site that has a fabulous walking path around it that is lit up at night. My husband and I loved sitting on the balcony after tucking our children in bed for the night and watching people walk or jog around it. Also, we could see the fireworks of disney and epcot, along with the beautiful pool that has a fountain that changes colors... absolutely beautiful! It was a dream to spend time in that lovely setting. We had lunch several times and dinner once by the pool. I want to say that my dinner at Parc Soleil was my favorite while on vacation. My husband and I both had the salmon and it was cooked to perfection. We also had the rosemary chicken for lunch, the mahi mahi and the portobello burger...fantastic. They also had a nice selection for my children. The food was top notch and the service Excellent. People sometimes say "who cares, your only gonna sleep there", at Parc Soleil, you will "vacation there". We went on vacation thinking that we would enjoy a little time at the hotel but spend most of our time at the disney area attractions...that was not the case. The hotel is busy enough so you wont be bored but not chaotic or jammed with screaming kids... Thank you Hilton Parc Soleil staff for making our visit to Florida such an enjoyable one. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment, do-it-yourself hotel”
Reviews.Author: plasticsymphony
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for service, a resort experience or the least bit of help with anything—go elsewhere. The first day we checked in, I thought everything looked great. The pool, playground and activity center were all wonderful with a small child. But, soon the cracks started to show. I called the first nice we were there to ask if they had room service. The representative put me on hold for over 5 minutes to check and see. How do they not know? They told me I could buy food down by the pool and bring it up to the room. Yeah...that's not room service. The housekeeping service is terrible. With hardwood floors and a small child, there were so many crumbs and so much debris that got tracked into bed with us—and they didn't change the sheets for our entire 5-night stay. Our mini-fridge was broken (but still running) and we filled it with food, only to find our milk, cream cheese, etc. warm and inedible in the morning. The shower in the bathroom sprays water all over the floor, even with the curtain completely drawn. My daughter slipped on the soaking wet bathroom floor—twice! I'm lucky she wasn't seriously injured. Halfway through our stay, my daughter started feeling sick. I was finally able to get her to nap and called Guest Services to see if there was any way I could get someone to bring me up some ice for her. The first rep said they could send some up. 45 minutes later, I called back and they said they had no way of doing that, but they would 'try'. I called again half an hour later and talked to a supervisor. They were snippy, said they don't have room service but "I guess I can send up a bellhop". I finally got ice for my daughter an hour later. For the entire stay, I spent several hours every day down at the pool and no one ever asked me if I needed anything—a drink, food, etc. I was also really tired of getting calls every single day trying to get us to go to their timeshare presentation. I will say that their were some lovely features. The pool area is very kid friendly. We liked the activity center and playground. The bartender at the Soleil Cafe was very friendly and helpful and the staff at the Marketplace were very accommodating. Overall, I had higher expectations and the Parc Soleil sorely disappointed. The service level is near zero here. It's fine for spending the night if you plan on being out all day..but if you want a resort experience, go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, but a few issues....”
Reviews.Author: overnighttraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a one bedroom unt for five nights. This was a leisure visit with a couple days at the theme parks, some shopping, and a couple days of pool time. This property has a lot of positives. Prices are very reasonable, it's nearly brand new, nice decor, two very nice pools, can get an Epcot fireworks view, not a long drive to various attractions. I thought the bathroom was one of the nicest I've seen. Large stand alone tub (very cool how water comes from ceiling!), huge shower with oversize shower head and hand held option. Unit is really spacious and easily comfortable for a longer stay. Decent soundproofing, but I could occasionally hear people next door and above. Balcony was also large and had a nice lounger as well as table and chairs. Not screened, but I didn't notice an issue with bugs (on 10th floor). I really liked having the option of using the main larger pool which includes water features and daily entertainment (livelier on weekends, but some entertainment every day) and is close to bar/restaurant. Smaller, adult pool is adjacent and much quieter, but still nicer than the basic rectangle you see sometimes. Ample towels were provided and I never saw more than half the chairs full although one of the staff commented that they were at 92% occupancy during my stay. I didn't find parking to be a problem in my small SUV. Spaces were kind of tight, but not ridiculously so and garage never seemed more than 50 - 75% full so you always had the option of parking further away if you didn't want to be next to another car. Now, onto the issues. In Building Two, the elevators are at the far end of one looooooong hallway and I ended up in the very furthest unit. I guess this is just the equivalent of being assigned a more distant building in a low rise property, but this long hallway walk made it feel like sort of a hike anytime you were going to the elevator to head to the pool or parking garage. Also, given the newness of the property, I was really surprised how dirty and spotted the hallway carpet was. Makes me wonder how well they will keep up the property. I definitely had issues with housekeeping as others have mentioned. Upon check in, found the wood furniture in the room very dusty. Also, on two different days when I had left the room by 9AM I returned after 5PM and found it had not been cleaned and had to call to get fresh towels. As others have said daily housekeeping really only includes taking out the trash, making the bed and replacing the towels. Bathroom and floors were not cleaned during my stay and I don't believe the sheets were ever changed and there was no card to request this. On another day when we returned from Epcot after 10:00, there were two unpleasant suprises. First, the air conditioning was not working and I had a voice mail from the front desk that something had gone wrong with swiping my credit card and I needed to come down that day (to front desk in the other building) to get if fixed. Well, it took two calls and an hour and a half for them to come fix the air conditioning (it was very hot!) and I ended up at the front desk around midnight to find out there had been some error on their end and there was no problem with my credit card. Also had to have two separate service calls on a severely leaking shower head which they said they fixed the first time and didn't. The last thing I didn't really care for was the property's location. If you're not familiar with the back roads you will definitely think you're way off the beaten track. Definitely cannot walk anywhere from here. Usually you'd think an advantage of being slightly out of the way would be serenity and views, but views are really of a future construction site and not at all appealing. Although it wasn't a long drive to attractions, I still would have prefered to be in either a more populated area, or if out of the way a prettier, more natural area. Overall I still think this place is a great value for the money and the newness and pools are a major plus, but I they have some work to do on housekeeping and maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Veda085
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful from the spacious suite to the awesome pool. The highlight of the hotel was the entertainment at the pool. A Mardi Gras themed party kept my young kids super entertained. The two entertainment guys were awesome - hula hoop contest, limbo, music, beads, balloons, etc. Ask the staff what day these guys are at the pool. Our suite was huge and easily fit my family of 5 young kids (youngest in a crib). We only stayed 2 nights but easily could be comfy for a week. Our suite was immaculate and had a big balcony. A quick drive to Disney property, restaurants, grocery store, and mini golf. The only negative was bad service at the restaurant for breakfast but the manager comped our entire meal and was super apologetic. Overall the employees were great. If we go back to Orlando will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bucaboy
Reviews.Content: I live in Orlando exactly 6 miles from Parc Soleil and I just want to comment on all of the reviews that talk about how out of the way the resort is. Just because the area around the resort is not built up yet does not make it out of the way! It is probably the most central to the three major theme parks than any other resort! Enjoy the quite area before it turns into the next I-Drive! The resort is beautiful, go before the area gets over developed, it is just on a quite street (for now)! Make a left out of the resort and you are about 2 miles to the best resaurant area in Orlando, Resaurant Row, make a right and you are 5 or 6 miles to DT Disney! The resort and the rooms are some of the best in town!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was FANTASTIC! It's like...”
Reviews.Author: Sisolak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was FANTASTIC! It's like having you're own home away from home. We loved all the space. The kitchen has everything you could possibly need. The washer dryer was a definite plus we washed all our clothes before we packed to go home! The hotel pool is georgous!! Very relaxing after a day at the parks and it never seemed crowded. The parking garage is tight as I read in the other reviews but I think people exagerated a bit. We really were happy to go from the car to the elevator and no valet fees!! The airconditioning is definetly a problem they need to solve!! We just couldn't figure it out. We were either freezing, or the heat would kick on! The noise that thing makes is also uneceptable! We had our 10 month old son with us and luckily he's a heavy sleeper. Other than that small issue, this was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: turtleloverMaryland
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a business trip ( convention ) at the Gaylord nearby. We decided to extend our visit an extra week. I chose this hotel for several reasons; we are Hilton Honors members, it is new- which means clean ! And it was convenient to Sea World , Disney etc. and it was inexpensive. It was close to everything, but not on the "main drag " -( I hate noise !!) I never - and I mean never ! !! expected a suite hotel to be this good . For the same price as the Hampton in - around 120/night : we had a suite with balcony that overlooked the fireworks displays at Disney every night, an extraordinary apartment with full kitchen ( granite /GE profile stainless appliances etc ) Full dining room, living room, huge gorgeous bedroom, and a to -die -for -bathroom. Literally- the size of many New York apartments ! ( I am talking about the bathroom)- the suite is larger than many homes.. parking is free, and there is a shopping center 2 blocks away with a Wynne Dixie grocery story and ABC ( liquour ) store , among other things.In half an hour, I was stocked up with everthing I would ever need for meals. There are 2 pools- one shows movies for kids at night - fountains - outside bar- gorgeous- 4 hot tubs other is facing Disney- 1 hot tub, pool, fountain and lake with jogging path around it. Great little store - carries everything. Word of warning : They are building more hotels around the lake front- be sure to ask about this ! ( My husband and I never went to the theme parks after all- we did off beat stuff- but we returned every night to our luxury apartment and had dinner on the balcony, and fireworks for desert ).. Absolutely perfect ! If you want a quiet room-ask for the fireworks side. (Although I must admit that the soundproofing was supurb.) This place is a total steal, and I am only sharing this with you because I don't need to keep it a secret - I live too far away to be able to go regularly. But trust me- a deal this good can't remaine this cheap forever.

Reviews.Title: “My hotel of choice in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Bulgarian_travels
Reviews.Content: There is an abundance of hotel accomodations in Orlando, but the large majority of these hotels are older, and of lower quality (think Days Inn, Comfort Inn etc. caliber). If you'd like to stay someplace nicer, you have to shell out $200 or more per night, not even including taxes. At $145 per night for a brand new property - the Par Soleil fills the void for a new, good value hotel in the Orlando Area. Locationwise, this hotel is an easy 15-20 min drive from Disney Magic Kingdom; the address they have on their website does not pop up neither in mapquest, nor in my GPS, you can search alternatively for 7903 Palm Parkway. Check-in is at 4pm, which is kind of late I think, but it didn't affect us since we came in even later, check out is at 10am; at my request, they let us stay until 12pm, which scores a brownie point with me. The property is lovely - there are two buildings - One (where the reception is) and Two (opened just a couple of months ago), covered parking (free of charge) with plenty of spots available. There are two pools (the large one has a water slide and zero depth entry point) and two or three hot-tubs, which were large enough to accomodate at least 15 people without any problem. Although there were a lot of people vacationing at the hotel at the time, it never felt really crowded and loungers were always readily available. The pool water was perfect temperature, my compliments to hotel management for not trying to save on this like other hotels do. The hotel has a restaurant with inside and outside seating poolside. The food is good, averagely priced (apps/salads/sandwiches about 8-10$, main courses - high 'teens'), but the service is rather slow and some of the waiters (one waitress to be more specific) could care less about serving you with promptness. The hotel also has a child play area (playground with slides etc. outside) and a great looking montessori-like play room for younger children. I am not sure if they offer child-care services, maybe worth inquiring. We stayed in a studio, which is essentially a regular hotel room and it doesn't have a balcony. The bathroom has only a shower, but is a decent size. There is also a kitchennete area with a mini-fridge, microwave, sink, some silverware, paper towels etc. Baby cots can be provided on request free of charge; we were never provided with bedding for the cot though, even though we asked twice. Wireless internet is no-hassle (just find the network and connect without any passwords or special set ups) and is free; the business center (printing and faxing) is costly - internet usage goes for 25c per minute, 75c per page printed, but I guess for incidental needs is not that expensive. Service (except for the restaurant) was very good, hopefully this isn't just because the hotel is trying to establish itself. Will definitely stay here again during my next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the Disney hotels - this is value luxury”
Reviews.Author: MrsFrogg
Reviews.Content: For the last several years we have shelled out big money to stay on property in Disney and eat in the Disney restaurants, worth it when our children were really small and needed mid-day naps. Now that they no longer nap, we have ventured to the nearby Parc Soleil. Brilliant. The hotel is brand new and the finish on the property is excellent. It is only a 15 minute drive to Disney (if that) and 10 minutes to Sea World (and Aquatica!), plus there are so many great restaurants nearby. The pool area is huge and has a waterslide (see photos on the Hilton web page). In the evenings they show a family movie on a huge screen over the pool. Nearby restaurants we enjoyed... Joe's Crab Shack, Maggianos, Capital Grill, Miller's Ale House. There is also a Whole Foods complex nearby. The hotel suite had a washer/dryer, full kitchen, dining room, living room and separate bedroom - the pictures provided by Hilton were 100% accurate. A note of criticism... the room was immaculate when we arrived, but during our stay I think the staff emptied the rubbish, put fresh towels and made the beds. They did not clean the floors once during our 5 day stay! We bought ice cream in the shop and it had been melted and re-frozen. The staff are generally very helpful and considerate. The parking is free and plentiful. We have stayed in the hotel twice and will definitely stay again - it is an oasis of luxury after a day out in the parks or shopping (Prime Outlets, Premium Outlets and the Florida Mall with Macy's all nearby).

Reviews.Title: “One of Best Hotels EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: epowers1127
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay at the Omni Orlando for the week, but checked out after 2 nites of disappointment & checked into the Parc Soeil. Excellent decision! The hotel & staff were fabulous!! The grounds were clean & beautiful. There was a HUGE, clean pool area with poolside games, a poolside restaurant, plenty of chairs, towels, a waterslide, etc. We stayed in building #2 in a one bedroom suite. The suite was 1000 square feet and had a full size kitchen with brand new appliances & every cooking tool you would need. The bathroom was huge with a separate tub & shower. The bed was nice & comfy. AND, everything was spotless. The staff was extremely friendly..... from checking us in to the waiter, Sean, in the poolside restaurant, everyone was friendly, accommodating & professional. We will definitely be back to the Parc Soleil in Orlando. You will not be disappointed if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Thumbelina44
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite from April 15th to 22nd. From the time we arrived to the time we left we had nothing but great experiences here. Check-in was fast and easy. Our suite was very spacious and clean. We loved the balcony and our room overlooked Disney so we could see the fireworks at night. The kids loved the pool area with the water slide! The games room is a big plus! The parking was a bit tight but so what? We just parked at the end of the row and most of the time there were no other vehicles beside us. The staff were very accomodating and the housekeeping was excellent!! The only complaint we have is that we could hear our neighbours next door sometimes. One night I called security because they were playing music very loud. The security took care of it right away ( within minutes) and we had a very peaceful sleep. We are planning a trip to Disney next year and will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for couples.”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Sun_lovers
Reviews.Content: We chose Parc Soleil for a last minute trip to Orlando to golf based on the reasonable rates and the small number of reviews we read on trip advisor. Unfortunately we should have done more homework. We booked a king studio room based on the hotels photo and thought the size would be adequate for our needs. We also noted the balconies on the building and assumed that all rooms would have these. We were wrong on both of these assumptions. The room itself was clean and relatively new although the furniture is already showing signs of wear. We were really disappointed to discover that we did not have a balcony or even a window that would open. Our view was a construction site. The air conditioner fan was really noisy and we could not sleep with it on and as the weather was really nice it would have been nice to be able to open a window. Temperature control is a challenge in this room. It is warm and stuffy without the airconditioner or the cold air blows directly at the bed if you have it on. The kitchen in this room was a joke. The refridgerator was far too small for even two people. We had hoped to bring in food for breakfast and some snacks but the fridge held very little and did not keep the food adequately cold. There are two sets of dishes in the room. Early in the week we accidentally broke a glass and let the staff know but it was never replaced. Dish towels were taken by cleaning staff and we had to write a note to have them replaced too. The pool area is very attractive and probably the reason for the positive reviews. I think this hotel would be a very good choice for a family with young children as there are many activities for this age group. There were many many youngsters there during our visit and the took over the pool area and the hot tub. They appeared to greatly enjoy the water slide. I was concerned that the staff did not attempt to control the children at all (and most parents were not watching them either) as they ran all over the deck, leaping into the pool or the hot tubs. Very small children (looked about two) were allowed to go down the full sized water slide which would normally have a height restriction. I think this is an accident waiting to happen. We found the rooms to be extremely noisy because of very thin walls. You will hear the people in the rooms beside you and because of the wooden floors you will hear every step the people take in the room above you. We did get an excellent rate because we paid for the trip in advance so we could not go and find another hotel. We did express our frustrations to the staff but they were very young and did not attempt to help us. A suite was not available. When our rooms was not cleaned by 7pm on the first day they did promise to do a better job the rest of the week and this was done. The concierge staff are really time share staff and not very helpful. The young man helping us could not understand why we would not be interested in listening to a presentation for hours to save $100 on a Disney pass. I would suggest couples find other accomodations and leave this one to young families.

Reviews.Title: “NOT what we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: MileHighFlyer
Reviews.Content: Although we understand the vacation club is still in the process of being built it feels as if we were driving up to a project gone wrong. The view of the property from the road feels as if we are staying at a location under foreclosure. Once inside the actual gated area of the property we were not greeted as the bellmen were too busy having a conversation with one another, something I've never expected from a Hilton. The person at the front desk was pleasant when she checked us in, but nothing overly helpful. We were staying in a single bedroom studio (no balcony) the parking in the garage was a nightmare as they squeeze too many spaces together and I witnessed a small child getting out the car hit a very nice BMW next to him. (oops) I'm sure the owner of the BMW would not be too thrilled, especially if he was an owner of this property. Upon arriving to our room we discovered the bathroom shower was barrier free with just an extension of the tile, something I did enjoy--until I took the first shower and discovered water goes all over the rest of the bathroom making it slippery and gross to walk into the bathroom. The Bed was comfortable, but nothing spectacular. The thing that irritated my husband and I the absolute most though was having to use the business center downstairs. They have this very complicated system in which you have to pay for credits to use the computers/printers. It's $.25 a minute and $.75 a printed page. I ask you how much did hilton actually spend on the carder readers? They seriously can't afford each guest a free 10 minutes in their business center? Never would I spend (waste) hard earned money to buy into this timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “By far... The best place we have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: Twiller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Parc Soleil from April 4th ~ April 10th 2010. It was a gift from a family friend for our 25th wedding anniversary. I can not stop bragging about this wonderful resort. The room was Amazing! I just couldn't stop snapping pictures! The poolside view from our 8th floor balcony was wonderful...especially at night! I couldn't get over the water from the tub coming from the ceiling! That was SO cool! We will never forget our 25th anniversary because of the awesome place where we stayed. The only thing I think I would change is...the food in the cafe is expensive. We really like the fact that it was located off the main drag! It was close enough to get to everything we needed. I would reccommend this place to anyone! We had a BLAST!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe my expectations were too high...”
Reviews.Author: samanthajw
Reviews.Content: Based on a lot on online research we chose this resort for our spring break which included our family with 3 children and my mother-in-law. We reserved a 2 bedroom suite which included a sofabed in the living room area to accomodate the 6 of us. PROS: We got a lot of space for the price. Our "suite" was about 1300 square feet. Kitchen was stocked with enough dishes for us to buy a few groceries and save a little money not eating at the resort restaurant or buying anything in the Marketplace store. Great location. It is not in a busy area but is within 5-15 minutes of SeaWorld, Disney, and Universal. The large balcony was awesome. We could put the kids to bed and hang out playing cards on the balcony at night. CONS: Pool was much smaller than we expected and their "interactive water fun" other than one waterslide was waterfalls and a couple of sprinklers. This was disappointing because one of our main reasons for chosing this resort was for our kids to enjoy the pool. A/C was REALLY loud. I had read reviews noting the A/C volume before we went but just passed it off as people being persnickity - it is not. It is very difficult to carry on a conversation in the kitchen when the A/C is on because it is so loud. Parking Garage is super tight! I received several door dings to my minivan this week and it was very difficult to pull in and out of these narrow spots. One would think that Hilton would be expecting SUV's and minivans at this type of resort. 2 Bedroom Suite? OK, maybe I'm just being picky, but what was marketed as a 2 bedroom suite is really a 1 bedroom suite with connecting doors to a regular single bed room. This still gave us plenty of space, but it wasn't laid out in the same way as a cohesive unit would have been. The main problem was the bathrooms situation - the "master bath" was open to the main room to be used as the common bathroom. View? There is a lake with a walking path which is nice, but most of our view was dominated by desolate ground where they plan on building more towers. Kids activites were sparse and several included a fairly hefty charge - at least the charges seemed high to me when I was multiplying them by 3 kids. Overall, we did enjoy this resort, but in the future will probably go back to Marriots. I felt that we paid more for extra space but did not get much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY”
Reviews.Author: AUTISMSMITH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 20th wedding anniversary as a treat paid for my our 4 children - the room was lovely and big - huge bath with water coming from the ceiling! Views over disney we were wonderful with the fireworks in full view. our only gripes was that the fire alarm was not connected - which was worrying as we were in the penthouse! A long way down! Also, the aircon was really really noisy - felt like being in the boiler room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Top notch installations”
Reviews.Author: jdr1000
Reviews.Content: I travel each year to Orlando and always look for new places to stay, for two years we stayed almost in front of this place and wondered how good would be when finished. Never thought the outcome was going to be this nice. The entrance is grand style elegance and installations all the way to the gym are top notch. Service was good and great with kids. Bathrooms are huge and double bedroom apartments fit a very large family. There is one side of the building that has a perfect view of Epcot and Magic Kingdom fireworks every night. Spectacular. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice for families who want luxury accom and space”
Reviews.Author: NadineHakney
Reviews.Content: Just fantastic quality accomodation - so spacious and everything you need [we had a one bedroom suite] Pools fantastic - water slide a hit with the kids and entertainment for children was very good! You must have a car to stay here - we found the deli expensive but the nearest walmarts was only 5 minutes drive and good quality! Customer service was top notch by the front desk and the recreation team. I do agree with the cleaning comments - this area needs a good sort out - it was hard to tell if your room had been serviced and let the Parc Soleil down badly! We were sad to leave and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons on this one - then you weigh if you're to stay-I won't every again.”
Reviews.Author: crumcakessssss
Reviews.Content: Pros: VERY nice pools and hotel room. It's almost like a resort-like atmosphere whereupon they have activities by the pool every day! The pools were heated and the one main pool is very large and nice! Lots of seating around the pool. Cons: VERY VERY VERY poor housekeeping! 3 days in a row beds left unmade, no new towels in the bathroom and no new shampoo or body wash. Every day we had to call to see if anyone showed up in our room to clean and they said yes. My teenage sons room was much cleaner then ours! We had to request they come again to clean and my God we didn't think every single day we'd have to ask for new towels/new shampoo, etc. Honestly we are not super picky people but the Hampton Inn or a Holiday Inn had cleaner rooms!! Many guests on our floor were leaving their garbage outside their door for pickup (which we should not have to do!) and at times the garbage would be there all day long! Hotel pretty on the outside, but the rooms are never clean and replenished. Other guests we spoke to said their rooms were equally unkempt. Also, the parking garage is a joke. If you drive a mini cooper then you are ok but anything bigger and you'd best have good car insurance! SUPER small/tight parking spots. We had a small 2-door rental and we had to back into a parking spot just to squeeze in.

Reviews.Title: “Great new property”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Woodward
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay, all still very new, great studio room very clean, well equipped kitchenette, big comfy bed, great bathroom with big shower. Location is 5 minute drive from Disney but nothing in walking distance, hotel restaurant / deli was ok but a little expensive. My only criticism is that the studio rooms have connecting doors to the suites and seem paper thin, you can hear everything from the room next door Great clean pool area with lots of sun beds and water slide. Would recommend a stay here but in one of the suites not studios.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DanaPointJohn
Reviews.Content: My client originally booked me into a different hotel which was sold out. Boy oh boy was I glad that I stayed at the Parc Soleil instead! This is a two tower hotel that is also a vacation ownership property. The hotel location is a bit remote so you will need a car or take a taxi anywhere you want to go. They have a shuttle that goes between the hotel and Epcot three times each way daily, for $6 round trip. I stayed in the West Tower which opened only six weeks before I arrived. The rooms are large with comfortable beds, 40" flat screen HD television, kitchen and a large bathroom. Some have a balcony. All amenities you would expect are there. The main pool is large with three 50 yard lap lanes, heated to 85º, a slide, a kid's pool and at least three spas. There are no lifeguards so parents will need to watch their children. There was a movie screen set-up on the deck for evening family fun. The restaurant has deck side dining with a full bar and excellent food. The prices are also very reasonable. Not the closest hotel to the theme parks but worth considering on your next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VacaLuver
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel from 3/22 - 3/26 while visiting Orlando on vacation. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. We requested a "fireworks view" room and we had a great view of the evening display at the Magic Kingdom. The view during the day wasn't so great, but was only because the hotel is going to be expanding. The room itself was just fabulous - from the extra comfy bed and pillows, the conveniences of the the in room washer/dryer combo (which by the way - laundry soap was provided), the full kitchen complete with everything that you could possibly need. I really loved the tub with the separate shower...it was very handy for helping my family get ready as quickly as possible each morning to hit the parks. The bedside table even has an electric outlet in the top of it to plug in your cell phone! Loved it! We didn't get to spend a lot of time at the pool as we were on the go, but when we did go it was very nice and clean. The water was heated adequately for my two small children to enjoy it. My only gripes are: 1. We had called for room service but their was none available. I was told we could order from the hotel restaurant and then pick it up and eat in our room. Since I didn't have a menu, I asked for one to be sent to our room. We were all very tired and hungry....the menu never showed up so my husband had to go down and get it. The food was "okay" but plentiful....not a very big selection on the menu. 2. The morning we were leaving we notice our coffee was not replenished. My husband called to have some sent up, but it never arrived. 3. Our a/c was broken - making loud noised. We called to have it repaired while we were gone. When we got back, it was all fixed and we had a cute towel elephant waiting for us on our dinner table. With that being said, all of these items are trivial. This hotel is new and wonderful. We booked early and paid a low $115 per night for our stay. We ended up delaying our flight a couple of days and to our dismay, (should have checked with the hotel first), the hotel only had one studio available for Friday and Saturday nights with a rate of $179 per night....we really needed the larger room for our family, so we ended up going to a different hotel that had a suite available. Next year when we go back, we are definitely going to go the this hotel! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great value; somewhat odd property arrangement”
Reviews.Author: ordinarymind
Reviews.Content: Good news here is that the hotel is new, well-run and reasonably priced (we had a 1BR suite for under $200 and a 2BR suite for a few later nights for under $300--- 2BR was large and could sleep 6 pretty easily). The staff was very pleasant, the pool is great (kids seemed to like that as much or more than the parks!), and the kitchen in the unit was also well organized and one could eat all meals there if inclined to do so. The food in the restaurant is modest but good, and there's a marketplace with light groceries, sandwiches and Starbucks coffee. The bad news is limited--- the property is in an oddly isolated area, but still within an easy drive to all the attractions. The really strange part of this is that the "back" of the property (abutting Palm Parkway) is apparently reserved for expansion--- maybe an additional 5 units are planned? Right now, though, the expansion area seems to be abandoned, giving the property the feel of a swank hotel built in a war zone. If you can, get a room facing WDW and the pool so you can see the fireworks and not the expansion area (i.e., face away from Palm Parkway); our 1BR faced the rather desolate looking expansion area, so we tended to keep the shades drawn. All told, though, great value at these prices and a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: chersollycinci
Reviews.Content: Well, I really have nothing but positive remarks about Parc Soleil. We will definitely stay here again when we come back to Orlando. The restaurant is standard hotel quality. Don't go their expecting to be wowwed. Luckily, their food is a step above the Magic Kingdom. If you aren't happy with their menu and maybe want something lighter, you must check out the little marketplace deli. Sandwiches and wraps are great for noshing by the pool. The bar was pretty great. Buy a martini and they give you the shaker contents too. So, that was like 2.5 martinis for the price of one. Thanks! The pool! My family loved swimming together. Wish there was a swim up bar though! The only valid criticism I have is the quality of the blanket on the pull-out sofa bed. If you have a kiddo who will be bunking on the couch, maybe you can pick them up a blanket somewhere, like at a discount Disney shop. The supplied spare blanket is made of a yellow foam material. My little one did not like the blanket at all and I could not blame her. It seemed very uncomfortable. I called to explain the problem and asked for another comforter. They said they'd send one right away. When the room attendant came to the door, a language barrier prevented the two of us from communicating effectively. He gave us another one of the yellow foam blankets. I wanted a comforter but he told me that all the comforters are being washed and that he'd bring me one when they were dried. Well, we never got one. I felt like I was being lied to, which is why I'm even bothering to report on something so seemingly trivial. Would recommend and will stay again if the price does not go up much.

Reviews.Title: “Just love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Dansweetea
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed if staying here. It is gorgeous and fabulous for the price. I predict prices will rise once all the other buildings are complete. It just enough out of the way without being totally isolated, yet close enough to everything you need including all the parks and attractions. We loved out stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: caratravels26
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights in March and loved it! The hotel is beautiful...the pool is fabulous and we enjoyed having our choice of hot tubs at night. We had one of the smaller rooms (no balcony), but it was still a nice size with a comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The hotel is located close to all the big attractions and it was easy to navigate around. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the concierge was able to book us a nice dinner reservation for a Friday night. The only hiccup was the on-site cafe/grill...the service and food could use a little work. There is a small market on-site that has everything you could want for a reasonable cost. I would definitely go back again and can't wait to see what its like when they finish building the other guest towers!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic aappartments with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: PUTNEYBIKER
Reviews.Content: All is new and lovely here and I enjoyed a time when non of the continuing building works were in progress. Avoid any room in Tower 2, Fouth Floor poolside as the view is of a roof top and underground car park. It has to be realised that if you get a "hotel" room here , it is essentially a condo and there is no option to change room as the owner had sold you that particular time in that room thru reception or a travel agency. there is only one cafe at the moment. Fantastic swimming pools, hot tubs etc. Try to avoid the sales pitch for Timeshare, I was ensnared for 3.5 hours. easy access to all the frightful theme parks

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Witboj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and teenage daughter for seven days. We had a two bedroom, one bedroom being a lockout unit, with a microwave oven and mini fridge. My daughter loved it because she had her own studio "apartment." Kitchen in main unit was fully stocked and the washer and dryer was definitely a plus. I won't repeat what's been written by most of the other reviewers. It's a lovely place, clean, reasonably priced. The rooms are just like the photos on the website. Good location if you have a car. Short drive to attractions. Since we were doing Disney and Sea World, we didn't have time for the resort activities. We do plan on returning to just stay at the resort. We got one call regarding the Hilton Vacation Club, but it was not intrusive. The room was very quiet. Parking was a little tight, but we were always able to find a decent space in the garage. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at a great price. We chose a one bedroom suite which was very large and plenty of room for our family of three. The main pool area is awesome with a seperate adult pool. Staff was great and while there is no room service, there is a restuarant with a bar and a deli/market/starbucks on site. The amenities such as a playroom, excercise room and outside playground were great bonuses. The hotel is five minutes from Downtown Disney and slightly isolated from the busy commercial area which was actually a plus. Easy access to all the amusement parks. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB RESORT WILL SOON BE NO 1 IN ORLANDO!”
Reviews.Author: bigchrissey
Reviews.Content: This is a Top-notch resort which is truly beautiful , Great service but most importantly for what you get its the best value resort I have ever stayed at. If you have a car then the location is ideal but I would not stay here if you have no car. I predict that the Parc Soleil will be No1 on tripadvisor in the coming months if they maintain the current standards and level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: NYblondie09
Reviews.Content: The room is a beautiful spacious 1 bedroom apartment with all new appliances. Its new so of course its nice but they should of washed the towels because it shed when i dried myself off. The only thing i didn't like was it was just a little bit out of the way to get to but once you get there, its a haven. There are a lot of places to eat nearby and a big plus is a 24 hr Ihop! Its also close to all attractions..

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: WWJD?LOVE
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this resort so much we stayed an extra 5 days ! We were there for a total of 11 days and it was the most convienent and fun hotel we have ever stayed at! My husband Blessed us to go have fun in the sun, traveling by myself, as a women, with our youngest 2 children, I never felt that the resort was not secure! Loved the gated entry and felt really safe. The Activity center was perfect for ANY age, so me and our girls 7 & 8 played ping-pong, pool, they had many computers set up so they could play educational games and I could catch up on Facebook! We played board games and WII, and they did crafts and projects with the "helpers" that were so much fun and helpful! At the pool they played many fun games and had fun contests! The pools wer lovely and heated and the sliding board a blast! The rooms were beautifully appointed and i LOVE there was NO carpet! Carpet can get so nasty! It was VERY Clean! Every person we met who worked there was super nice and accomadating! The hotel food was excellent and service was great! i cannot say enough good about this Hotel and will definately stay here again LORD willing! The price was also excellent! So much for a very reasonable price! I have stayed in hotels for triple the price with not half the service! You will not be disappointed if you stay here. Despite the cold weather, the staff tried really hard to make our stay exceptional! Oh and the fitness Center in incredible too!

Reviews.Title: “above board”
