Reviews.Author: Massan28
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place for my wife and i to spend our 3 year anniversary. So many choices in orlando which made it difficult. It was a toss up between World Marriot(too big w far away self parking), Hilton Orlando(geared toward conferences), and Gaylord($$$$$$$$$$$$), and Parc Soleil(isolated resort)..First the resort is isolated but once you get there it a beautiful resort w a lot to do...I will get to it so i am not too wordy Pros: 1. Beautiful landscape and huge suites. Everything you need is in room. Nice tub and shower. Water for tub comes from spout in ceiling. Tight!!! 2. Activity center which closes at 10pm. Includes a variety of board games, ping pong, free internet. 3. Heated pool w three hot tubs to side and a smaller pool for adults only. Nice slide as well. Even in 60 degree weather people were in the pool/tubs day and night. Very clean as well 4. Free parking Cons: 1. Parking space in garage is tight. But if you have a car you don't want scratched or is too big you can park outside(ample spots available) 2. Dvd in the suite was located in living area, not in the main bedroom. Do not think about moving dvd player because it's not happening 3. Walls are thin. A couple of times we heard the folks above us and next to us. Did not affect our sleep. We heard them, that's all. One more thing. Some complain about the dining options. They are limited when you compare Parc Soleil w Gaylord Palms, but there are options for you to choose from. All this considered, I would give 5 stars for this hotel for cleanliness,comfort, nice staff, which are the main things that count...

Reviews.Title: “Brand new condo nice amenities, nice location, too bad housekeeping could not catch up”
Reviews.Author: FChen
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a pleasant stay, other has voice this as well. Very nice amenities, beautiful appliance, nice utensils and complete too. Location is great, staff is helpful. A few cons: Housekeeping could not catch up with this hotel/vacation home. Surfaces was not clean at all during our stay, carpet and floor was not clean by house keeping. Supply was not replenished. I had empty tissue holder for tissue box. This is a first in any of my stay at any hotels. And once, the towel were short, we always had 4 towels as we book for 4 person stay, and at one time there was only two towels available. Rooms were not "cleaned" when we get back before 6pm. You can see dust all over the surfaces, floor were dirty. The reason we rent this place is for daily housekeeping. Should we know we have to clean the room ourself, we would have rented the one without daily house keeping elsewhere at a cheaper price. Beware of advance purchase, we did advance purchase thinking it was a great move to lock the price. To our disappointment, the price dropped by close to $10 per night about 1 month before our trip. well for 15 days, that is significant amount of changes. And there is nothing they would do to console us. All we got is too bad you paid already.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with bit of a rough start”
Reviews.Author: Home-in-TX
Reviews.Content: We arrived to check in at 3:30. Understanding the official check in time is 4, there was no available room when we arrived. We hung around the resort and the front desk was slow to find us a room even once the official check in time arrived. The front desk staff had kind of a strange vibe. It was a feeling as if they were having difficulty fitting us in. Not a great experience to start off the stay. The room itself was nice as was the resort. I did not find the place as luxurious as I expected based on the glowing reviews, but it was definitely nice. The current pricing of about $140 per night for the 1 bedroom units makes the place an incredible value though. The resort is relatively new, so the condition of the property and rooms was excellent. It is a growing resort with space already cleared for several more towers. The resort is nicely situated close to the action but far enough away so you are not looking out over other development. It is about 5 minutes to the heart of Lake Buena Vista and another minute to Downtown Disney. The location would also be very good if you are planning to visit Sea World. You will receive a call about a week prior to check in asking about your preferences such as high floor, low floor, etc. This is really a sales call as the next question is to find out when you would like to have breakfast and hear about the ownership opportunity. I think they were offering a $100 gift card to attend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Place But beware of the Penthouse Premier Title”
Reviews.Author: sto957
Reviews.Content: All of the great reviews are absolutely True ..... We had a Great Stay. We were supposed to stay in the Penthouse Premier but once we checked in and went into our room on the 15th Floor I saw no reason to pay almost triple the points for this unit. I have no idea why people would pay so much more for a room that is the same size as the rooms just slightly lower. So we moved from the prestigeous 15th floor to the 10th. I suggest you compare the regular rooms and The Penthouse Premier rooms prior to checking in and you decide if it's worth the xtra consumption of points. HGVC used to have a "plus" designation and I believe many times it was justified but now this property adds "penthouse" and then an additional "premier" to really milk the points. Did you know that within 30 days a two-bed penthouse premier can be purchased with cash and cost you no more than a regular two-bed unit even though the points are almost triple. This would be a good way to go if you can do it. Remember, we had a great stay, loved the rooms and will return ....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shananigans21
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel at a very good price. We had a 1 bedroom suite which had a fully-stocked kitchen and living room with a balcony view of the pool. The bathroom had two sinks a large soaker tub and a large shower. They have both above ground parking and covered parking garage. There are two heated pools and several hot tubs, a large playground for the kids and a water slide. They also have a gym and a jogging path around a pond. The hotel is only a short 10 minute drive to any of the disney parks, seaworld, discovery cove and universal stuidios. They also have a shuttle to take you to the parks. A plus for you coffee drinkers is that there is Starbucks on site. The staff at the hotel were all quite pleasant and the concierge was very helpful. The hotel was very clean and the grounds were well groomed and landscaped. The pool was also very clean as I noticed it was being cleaned every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for a great room”
Reviews.Author: thorgan
Reviews.Content: Outstanding value and a great room! We had a one bedroom suite that had 3-4 times as much space as the 1 bedroom our daughter and her family had at Disney, with a full kitchen, washer and dryer, two flat panel TVs, an iPod sound system, comfortable bed, balcony and a large bath, for about a third of what they paid! It is not on the grounds, but it is a short trip to the attractions. Plusses: Nice enough workout room. Free wireless access. There is a full kitchen so we went to the grocery store and got food and wine for the week. There is a walking path along a little lake, and the grounds appear to be safe. There is a nice sized pool, a couple of large hot tubs, and an adults-only pool. This is a vacation resort, so there was no maid service (unless you pay extra for it), which we like - no one at your door yelling "housekeeping" at some early hour. Parking is on the lower 3 levels, which makes getting to the rooms very easy. We were one of the first people to stay in the 2nd of their towers, so it was very clean and shiny. Minuses: there is a restaurant next to the pool which we spent some time waiting for service that never came at. The only disappointment of the trip. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were all we could ask for, and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - clean and luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: VernonCT
Reviews.Content: We always research our hotels and this one had high marks - I have to say that it lived up to them! We had a spacious one bedroom suite and it was amazing! It had everything you could need - stove , washer dryer, HUGE bathroom and the tub was so cool! The water comes out of the cieling ( for the tub , not the shower, which is why this is cool! ) The pool is very nice and big - great water slide. IN the evening they have one of those inflatable TV's so they were showing the MIchael Jackson movie out by the pool. The fitness center was very nice as well. Everything is nice and new and clean. The bedroom units are just beautiful. My only criticism, as others have mentioned, is the parking garage - it is small and the spaces are tight which is hard to maneuver luggage out. Otherwise though the staff was very nice - hotel is GREAT - very central location. wonderful stay!! A+++

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice Away from Disney”
Reviews.Author: redink46142
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to stay onsite at Disney, and if you want to spend time away from the amusement parks, consider this time-share/hotel spot. I spent a long weekend at Parc Soleil in January 2010, and this property exceeded my expectations. It's a work in progress, with one tower completed and another one scheduled to open in February. At least 2 or 3 more towers will be constructed over the next decade, yet the property offers a lot of services even though it's under development. Units are set up like modern time-share condos. My 1-bedroom had a full kitchen, huge living room, and enormous bedroom/bathroom. It was more than enough space for up to 4 people for a short stay, if two people slept on the fold-out couch. I loved the huge balcony, the kitchen set-up, the in-room washer/dryer, the hot tubs/pools, beautiful grounds, and friendliness of the staff. Although the Hilton brochure stated that the room would not be cleaned every day, I was pleasantly surprised to find a spotless room when I returned every evening. When the maid realized I was using the kitchen to its fullest extent, she left extra supplies and kitchen towels. Maids also left friendly handwritten notes each day. It was a treat to watch the amusement park fireworks at night from my balcony. The time always varied, and the fireworks were quite a distance away, but I enjoyed the show. I also liked the parking garage - what a great idea! As other reviewers have noted, unless you plan to stay only at the resort property, it's a good idea to rent a car. A few smaller hotels are within walking distance, but I don't know if they have restaurants or lounges. Many fine restaurants and fast fooders are a very short drive away, and it's not necessary to go out onto busy roads to reach them. Other businesses that are 10-15 minutes away include Wal-Mart, US Post Offices, gas stations, mini-marts, souvenir shops, discount malls, etc. Sea World is nearby. Although I didn't try any of the food in the bar/restaurant, other guests said it was quite good. The hot tub/pool areas were very nice, and should become even more spectatular as the property is developed. A minor problem was noted in the room shortly after check-in, and the Hilton staff resolved the problem immediately, with a pleasant attitude. Hilton staff also patiently explained how to get to various places in Orlando and central Florida. I could never get the tap water in the room past lukewarm to mildly warm, but this was also a minor problem. It was so nice to see the sunshine, flowers, and grass that using lukewarm water was not a concern. I'll probably stay at this property again because of the great location, good value, friendly staff, and recreation program.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Patron”
Reviews.Author: MichaelAmy
Reviews.Content: First, I would like to thank tripadvisor for informing me about this hotel. My girlfriend and I planned a trip to Orlando on the Martin Luther King holiday weekend. I purchased the special Florida resident pass that allows access to all the Disney Parks for $99/person. We booked a suite and our requests for a high floor and firework view were accepted. I was very pleased that the room rate plus taxes was the only cost and the resort did not charge extra for parking or internet access. The balcony was enormous with a lounge chair, table and chairs. The bathroom was also very nice with a modern standing shower and a separate tub with his and her sinks. We had a eat in kitchen with state of the art appliances including all untensils for eating/cooking and cleaining supplies. I cannot rate the dining in the resort because we either cooked in the room or dined off the resort grounds. There is easy access to walmart and convenience stores for purchasing foods and many restaurants are nearby including downtown disney. The suite also had hardwood floor living area with couch and flat screen tv and the bedroom had a comfortable king sized bed with a flat screen tv. I also appreciated the ihome apparatus that allows you to listen to your ipod in our suite bedroom. The room was extremely clean and so was the entire resort. The location to the theme parks was approximately 10 minute drive with a car and the signs are very accomodating. It is almost impossible to get lost. Due to the inclement weather, we were not able to use the pool but it was very nice with a waterslide and the resort also had a fitness center/spa. I would definetly stay in this hotel, again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: open2some
Reviews.Content: I am an owner here and this was the first time I have stayed. It has to go some to beat the Grand Vaction Club on International Drive and it does in many ways. The rooms are fantastic with lots of space and home comforts. The pool area with waterslide is fantastic. Its only down side is that it is not complete. There are 5 Towers to be built and to date only one is open with another opening in Feb 2010. Our rep told us it could be ten years before it is complete. They is only one pool bar and although the food is good you have to travel out somewhere to find another restaurant, which means someone will have to drive unless you book a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “THE VERY ,VERY,VERY BEST HOTEL IN ORLANDO!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: I just found the perfect place to stay ion Orlando!!!Parc Soleil is the best of town:large suites,amazing pools(which I regret not enjoying due the arctic blast in January`s firrst fortnight),nice staff,close to all Parks!!!Excellent!!!I`ll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Ins and Outs of Parc Soleil”
Reviews.Author: grasz67
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four (two kids ages 10 and 8). We came to Orlando for Christmas holidays from Dec 20th - January 3rd. Two weeks of Disney! We wanted somewhere to stay with a bit of a "resort" feel, but close to Disney and with kitchen amenities, and a separate bedroom. We found this hotel on the internet, and it looked great. the price was excellent - $169 per night was our rate for a one bedroom with a full kitchen and king size pull out couch in the livingroom. I surfed the net when we were here, just to compare rates for this time of year, and this was a great rate, considering the amenities. ROOM: Very nice, new room. Very large. Very nice bathroom with double sink, separate tub and large glass enclosed shower. Kitchen had everything (although could have used a few more dishes - we were always running out as they only supply 4 of everything). This room would be perfect if it had (a) another closet - there is only one in the bedroom (b) more storage for clothing. There were next to no drawers for longer stays, so the room seemed to be contantly messy and (c) a desk to sit at for computer, etc. It was simply underfurnished and there is lots of room to add a dresser and desk. Balconies were large and very nice with lounger and table with four chairs. Our room faced the Magic Kingdom area, which was kind of neat as you could see the fireworks each night. but this got "old" after the first couple of nights and so I think if I came back, I would ask for the pool view room, which faces the beautiful pool area. Oh, we only had our beds made and kitchen cleaned if we left a tip. I think generally, they just supply clean towels, and only clean once per week. but if we left a tip, we had the whole room cleaned while out, if we forgot, no go! POOL: Gorgeous, well-heated so that the kids could still swim even in the cooler weather. Three lovely hot tubs for the adults. The water slide was a kit with the kids, but it was a bit frustrating in that you never seemed to know when it would be operating. It requires a staff person to attend it and they seemed to come and go without any real schedule. RESTAURANT: Food was good, service ok. It's nice that it is open air and faces the pool area, so the kids can swim and parents can enjoy a cocktail - very "resort-like". CONCIERGE: This was the most frustratng aspect of our trip, as we had a couple of questions about the resort so we called down and were told to go to the front desk for information! My husband and I both had issues with the Concierge and thought it was funny at a new hotel, that they would not be more helpful. NOISE: The walls really are paper thin and we seemed to have a particularly loud family beside us on a few of the days - we could literally hear their conversations! This was only for a few of the nights so is likely luck of the draw in terms of who your neighbours are and how loud they get. LOCATION: Excellent. Close to everything. Walmart just up the road, parks within 10 minutes drive, tons of restaurants. But you would want a car. OVERALL: We enjoyed our stay and, at this rate, we would certainly consider returning again. Of special note was the social staff who made Christmas eve and New Years eve really special for the kids, and were always working hard around the pool hosting trivia contests, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: senoritav
Reviews.Content: Spent 11 nights at the Parc Soleil...regrettably, the weather was cool,cloudy and rainy for the most part. In any case, here is my review: PROS The 1 bedroom suite was well appointed and clean (but for longer stays, i'm surprised there wasn't a larger closet given it was a 920 square foot unit). The grounds were lovely (but there is pending construction behind tower 2...which is yet to be opened). Large pool was great for kids although water slide not suitable for younger ones due to height restriction. Hottubs came in handly given the weather and plenty of towels and chairs Well equipped fitness center Nice 1/2 mile walking path and enclosed playground for kids Close to everything...if you have a car Requests to front desk were handled promptly CONS No pool service..by that i mean, no one ever came to take drink requests, i when i went to order drinks, it took them 20 minutes to deliver (and there were 4 people around the pool) Friends who requested adjoining rooms at time of booking, and then again at check in, never got them ..even though the place seemed less than full No bath robes or magnifying mirror...which is surprising for a Hilton Overall, would definitely recommend the place if you are in Orlando and have a car clousdleey, t

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotel Stays”
Reviews.Author: alikat33
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at a lot of nice hotels over the years (to include Ritz Carlton properties) and this is probably one of the nicest hotel rooms we've ever been in. We got a 1 bedroom suite, which for the price was amazing. Stainless appliances in the full kitchen, comfortable living room, bedroom and bathroom. Everything was new and spotless. The staff were very friendly. (no valet, but they let us park our car in the front anyway) The only sad thing was the fact that hardly anyone was there! It was nice because we felt like we were all alone, but I have to wonder how they will make it. Yes, it's a little out of the way, but for the price, you can't go wrong. Great accomodations for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyBoyMoore
Reviews.Content: Good Points - Great hotel. Pool area superb, activities good, waterslide never got boring and staff are excellent. Rooms are brand new and cleaned every day. Having an apartment with all the mod cons is a real bonus with a yooung family. I may never go anywhere again unless its a grand vacations by Hilton. Bad Points - Only one location. It is however a bigger issue than any of the other reviews have made. You may well be two miles from Disney World but it will cost you 35 bucks in a cab. You can however get the hotel shuttle and it only costs 6 bucks return. It runs on time and only goes to other Hiltons so only takes 40 mins max and Parc Soleil seems to be the first drop off so you're back from the parks in 20 mins. There are three drop off and pickup times. The biggest drawback is the fact that you cannot walk anywhere from your hotel as there are no walkways. You have a major road with no pavements at the entrance to your hotel so you MUST use a car or taxi to go anywhere. This was a real issue for me especially as you have no shop on site so we had to taxi to local walmart and stock up. Apart from location this is an excellent hotel and I would go back but maybe with a hired car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: FlyonTime
Reviews.Content: Wrapped up a 3-day stay at this resort while visting Disney. Here are the good and bad: Bad The hotel provided a “crib” that is a small version of a pack n play that is extremely flimsy. My 17 month old son was able to tip it over from the inside. It had a wafer thin mattress. For a resort 5 minutes from Disney think they could provide a little better We stayed in a 1 bedroom studio suite and were surprised to find there was no bathtub in the room, only a shower. This is great for adults, bad for families traveling with children. Unlike most Hilton vacation properties this one does not offer room service. We were able to get carry out from the pool café. Food was decent but we had to go down and order and then return to pick it up. The walls are paper thin. We were able to hear the guests next to us talk and play nightly (well past midnight). We left the room for 8-10 hours daily to go to Disney. Unfortunately both days housekeeping did not make the bed. We had to call when we got back. They did try to make up for it with a fruit basket. Both days they forgot to deliver the USA Today. Good The property was opened last year and still feels new. The room we had was a nice size and comfortable. The pool complex had two pools including one with a 2 story water slide. The kitchenette in the room was a major plus to store snack and cold food items. The hotel location to/from the Disney resorts is about 15 minutes. If you request a high floor you can see the fireworks from Disney. The hotel offers fun kids activites throughout the day. They played a movie by the pool on Saturday night on a giant movie-theater size screen.

Reviews.Title: “Great time share choice! Parc Soleil”
Reviews.Author: JadeNewBrunswick
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I just returned home from our vacation at the new Hilton property "Parc Soleil" in Orlando. I was pleased to see such a nice resort. We are fairly new HGVC owners and really enjoyed our time at this resort. It was very clean and well maintained. The room we had on the 9th floor overlooked the pools and was a nice view. However we did not have much sun on our balcony at all. The rooms were well equipped with everything you needed to stay comfortably for a week or so. The furniture was nice as well as the very comfortable king size bed. French doors closed off the bedroom from the living room so that we could both relax and watch our own choices of TV. First thing you need to do when going to this resort is book a rental car and look for package deals on the theme parks prior to going. We booked the rental car from Dollar and got a 9 day rate of just under $300. Not bad. On the theme park tickets, we purchased them at the front desk at the hotel and we paid way too much for them. Don't get me wrong...they were very helpful there but you get a much better deal if you go online prior and order a package deal for your tickets. I didn't realize this. The more days & parks you visit - the better the price. There is a Walmart close by to get groceries from which we made many trips to. We ate at Olive Garden on International Drive one night and our server "Jason" was fantastic! Two thumbs up for Jason!!! I have a food allergy to deal with and he was great. Also ate at the hotel restaurant one night and it was good too. Cooked many of our meals in the room. We went to 2 outlet malls "Prime and Premium" which are both nearby. If you like shopping - go there!!! Fantastic shopping! The pools at the resort were very comfortable. Very clean too! Great waterslide. This resort is still under construction as they are finishing up a second tower but the noise factor was to an extreme minimum. Never bothered us at all. Don't hesitate to go there because of this construction because you will really be missing out on a lot. Also had a great gym to workout. Also enjoyed the secure entrance to the resort and the underground parking. Nice. This place is a very nice location if you want to stay in Orlando but do not want to be right in the middle of driving chaos. This place is a little drive from the theme parks buy about 5-10 minutes but well worth it! Really enjoyed this place and the staff were great!! Would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: jake0116
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a four night stay at the Parc Soleil. Having stayed at other HGVC, we were looking forward to this visit. We were not disappointed. We had a two bedroom unit which was nicely furnished and very spacious. Since it was still warm during our visit, we were able to enjoy the pool area and we watched a football game one evening outside on the largest inflatable television I have ever seen! Very well lit parking garage. Could almost see some fireworks from the parks (our unit was on the first floor so it was a little difficult to see) Hilton does a wonderful job of providing great amenities at their resorts! We will definitely return to this location (or any of the HGVC resorts)!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite there yet”
Reviews.Author: TraceyTurnip
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my toddler and husband after 5 days in Fort Myers. It had been many years since we stayed in Orlando, and had previously stayed down the road from this resort. My husband turned back at the cross roads before the resort, and it didn't look like there were any developments that far out. This hotel seems to be the 1st in this area, probably due to the credit crunch, many developments seem to be on hold. Once completed this will be a massive resort. We stayed in building 1 which was the only one open. The view from our room was awful, of waste ground where they will be building, but having said that the resort of the guest areas were really plush. Our 1 bedroom room was really well equipped, and to a high standard. Open plan fully equipped kitchen \zwith washer & dryer, large dining table and lounge with sofa bed. Spacious bedroom and bathroom with walk in shower and freestanding bath. The room has wifi, however if you want to use the internet in the busines centre you will be charged. As this is a timeshare resort expect the calls. I hadn't made it into the bedroom from the front door before the phone was ringing! We enjoyed the pool area which is massive. There are hundreds of sunbeds and 4 or 5 large whirlpools which were most welcome on the cooler nights. My husband thought the water slide was great, although it would have been good to have something for the little kids, my son was really upset that he was too small to go on the slide. The hotel hosts dive in movie nights by the pool, and they leave you a message on your answering service to let you know the details. We had take away dinner from the restaurant which was nice and convenient. Parking is plentiful, with spaces in a main carpark near the lobby or in the basement of the builidng. At this resort I would say you are less than 10 mins drive to Disney, and about 5 mins from Seaworld. The hotel gives you a directions sheet when you check in which was really handy, for finding supermarkets, restaurants, malls etc.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PROPERTY - GREAT STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: castaways01
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely no complaints about this great property. We had several units here for a small family reunion over a long weekend. My son, an HGVC owner in Colorado and Hilton Diamond member suggested the resort. Our group included 7 kids from 3-11 years old, one infant and 10 adults. All of us had a great time and thoroughly enjoyed the property. The units are very clean, well-appointed and comfortable. Kitchens are well-equipped. The furniture is all upscale – everything -- from the patio table to the flat panel TVs. Beds were comfortable and bathrooms huge. Some of the kids slept on the pull out sofas, which were also comfortable. We found the entire staff friendly and very accommodating. We had requested rooms close together and we were all within steps of each other. The pool area is beautiful and the kids had a great time swimming and playing with their cousins. The location was great. There is a back road that takes you right to a small plaza with a grocery store. It was nice being far enough off the Interstate that you didn’t hear any traffic. It’s also close to the Sea World and Disney Parks. The parking garage kept the car cool and loading/unloading was very easy. Most of our group ate lunch by the pool at least one day and breakfast inside the restaurant another. The bar was also a nice gathering place to grab a beer and visit. The food and service good, prices reasonable. I think anyone who would complain about this place wouldn’t be happy anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ladychow
Reviews.Content: We're HGVC owners and have stayed at the other 2 properties in Orlando. Parc Soleil is a little different, but really very lovely and well thought out. The property is enormous and they are still adding many more things. the location is close to Universal and SeaWorld, as well as the highway. Only a few minutes to a Super Walmart to pick up anything you need. There are 2 large pools, one with a water slide. There are many hot tubs, and when we were there, it was not crowded at all. At night they inflate this giant screen and showed a movie one night, and played wii on another. The kids love it. I would have loved to see the activity room completed, but it's fine. The only thing I couldn't understand was that the BBQ grills are charcoaled whereas at every other one I stayed at, they were gas grill. Didn't matter, we didn't grill this time around. Nothing bad to say about it, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: tke_303
Reviews.Content: First off, I have to say, that my overall experience at this hotel was absolutely wonderful. Positively the "tops" in own opinion. This place is brand new, so the rooms, grounds, pool is in tip-top shape. Second, check in was nice and easy. The guard gate was courteous and friendly, and directed us where to go to proceed with check in. The bell men and front desk staff knew us by name as soon as we stepped in the door, I don't know how, but that was amazing!! All in all, the staff was very personable and accommodating to my family, I can't recall a hotel where we were treated like such VIP's!! Third, the rooms are just absolutely impressive. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, which in all honesty isn't a normal room; in fact, these rooms are more like condos! They have a full kitchen, washer & dryer, separate living area, huge bathroom, and luxurious bedroom. I still can't believe for the price, the quality of room you get. I think these rooms should be going for around $250/night - when we paid only $126/night. I think you will be hard pressed to find such an upscale hotel as this in Orlando at any better rate. Lastly, I'll quickly touch on the pool and restaurant. The beach/pool area is great for the kids. The hotel puts on daily activities for children (and the adults too), which keeps them occupied if your just hanging around and not out at the parks. The slide is just like any you'd find at a water park, and there are separate pools for kids and older adults. The pool side restaurant is just as good as any in the Orlando area, and service lives up the Hilton name. I really don't see why anyone wouldn't give this place 5 out of 5 stars, because it just doesn’t deserve less than that.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: krisans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our wedding night here. My wife (then my fiance) had called the hotel earlier and had asked for an earlier check-in and they had said that they will let us do that. The check-in was easy and the front desk staff were very nice to us. We got a very nice room with a beautiful view of the pool from the patio. The bed was very nice and the bathroom was good. Unfortunately we got a handicapped room but we didnt mind it too much. The staff from the front desk sent us a signed card congratulating us and some sweet treats. In the night, there was a movie in a big screen next to the pool. It was very cold (by Florida standards) and so we tried to enjoy it under the covers from the patio but it didnt quite work out. We ate at the Chevy's Mexican restaurant a couple of miles away and it was very close to I-4. All in all we loved this hotel and the staff and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property”
Reviews.Author: mdrockawaynj
Reviews.Content: My husband an I have travelled extensively to hotels all over the world including the Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons and this hotel was better! The service was outstanding, the pool area is gorgeous, the rooms are barely used and beautiful and spacious. I only wish the restaurant had air conditioning as Orlando is steamy! I disagreed with other travellers who said it was hard to find and had nothing near by there are super markets, restaurants etc within 5 minutes. Also very convenient to Disney and Sea World. Can't wait to stay again and see what they add!

Reviews.Title: “A wONDERFUL ADDITION”
Reviews.Author: brianmcstea
Reviews.Content: Brand new HGVC opened in May 2009, so a lot of the facilities not yet opened, but even as we were there quality gym equipment was arriving. This is going to be a wonderful property, you most certainly need a car while you are here. If you have one its so each to reach Walmart, about 4 miles along a quiet road. Disney about 2 miles, Seaworld about a mile, I could see International drive from my room. If you dont have a car I would stay over at the other Hilton HGVC Tuscany on International drive, equally as good but more central. My 2 bedroom penthouse was on a grand scale, 4 lcd televisons, luxury furniture, kitchens and barthrooms, The two pool areas were beautiful with slide for the kids. There is also a walking track around a beautul lake. overal a great stay in a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: TonyMiami
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous positive reviews, I decided to book a three night stay at the Parc Soleil. This turned out to be an excellent decision. The spacious suite (one-bedroom) featured a full kitchen, living roon and balcony. The decor was contemporary. My suite faced the swimming pool area and at night I was able to watch the fireworks at Sea World from the balcony. After spending the day at the diney parks, I would return to the hotel and lounge by the spa-like pool area. I highly recommend this hotel and look forwar to a return visit with family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional quality and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: FamilySkiBums
Reviews.Content: I'm a HGVC owner, so I've had a chance to visit several of Hiltons VC properties. This, by far, is the most well appointed. The property is only in its infancy of development, but it's off to a great start. Accomodations The room far exceeded our expectations, providing a truely pampered experience. While the amenities represent standard fare for a HGVC property, the design and appointment of the rooms was superior to most. Check out the pictures of the master bathroom in our 2 BR (with a flat screen TV of its own!) It is a brand-spanking new property, so there is some expectation of it being in tip-top shape, but we were blown away none-the-less. We stayed at the HGVC at Sea World earlier in the week and could certainly tell the difference, even though the Sea World location is well maintained overall. Amenities We visited during a slow period in Orlando, so we practically had the resort to ourselves. That was a plus, as there was absolutely no issue with getting on the slide, finding a chair or even stagging a cabana. Unfortunately, we felt this may have had a negative impact on the pool-side bartender, as his personality left little to be desired. the pool was uninspired, but the waterslide somewhat made up for it. The exercise room was equally well appointed and looked like it had never been touched. The only drawback with the property being so new and visiting during a slow period was the lack of activities you find at most other HGVC properties. We look forward to visiting when the store and activities center is complete. Parking Covered and convenient with close elevator access from car to room. Need I say more? Location Contrary to several negative reveiws on the subject, this property is perfectly situated, with easy (very easy) access to Sea World and Disney. Universal is a short drive, but that's the case for most of the resort properties outside of the Universal "zone". While the property is somewhat isolated (is that really a bad thing when your trying to get some R&R?), there are a multitude of restraurants, shopping and activities within a 5-10 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: FBIGirl707
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 3 hotels in Orlando during my last business trip and I chose this one when my family arrived. This resort is absolutely astonishing. The seperate pool area for adults was my haven. The service was outstanding, the location is close to all major attractions and Walmart if you choose to stock the kitchen for snacks and quick meals for the kids. The suite was something out of a House & Beautiful magazine and very tastefully decorated. I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fab!”
Reviews.Author: Bob42121
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Parc Soleil for 9 nights and could gladly stayfor 9 more. It was the most enjoyable and relaxing resort we were ever in.5 star standard with plenty of space and amenities. The apartment was spotless and everything was in top condition.A little far out but once you have a car, it's fine and we found it as an advantage as it was quite and peaceful. There is, however only 1 tower in operation and i wonder will the complex become too busy and congested once the other 6 towers are built and in operation. Go soon and enjoy the gorgeous pool! The staff was more than pleasant and helpful.Couldn't find any faults. Sorry to be leaving

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay All-Around”
Reviews.Author: KashmirLZ
Reviews.Content: I'm a HGVC owner and a Diamond Hilton Hhonors member so I stay at Hiltons quite often. Parc Soleil is just a great place all-around. Here's a summary: Rooms - awesome. Just how they're described on the website. Very clean, very new. Beautiful appliances, flat-panel TVs with HD channels, iPod dock in the bedrooms, large balcony, very comfortable beds. Location - I actually thought the location was great. Directly between Sea World and Disney. You can actually get to Sea World in about 6 or 7 minutes, Downtown Disney in about the same amount of time, Disney parks in a little longer. There aren't any other hotels within at least a mile of you, which I kind of liked. There's a Winn-Dixie grocery store about 5 minutes away on Lake Rd. Pool - great, as you can tell by the website pictures. Not very deep, maybe 4 1/2 feet at its deepest point but that was fine, you're not diving in anyway. Waterslide was great and as long as your kid could swim on his own there weren't any height restrictions. Hot tubs were nice, especially at night. Fitness Center - very nice, with views overlooking the pool. Plenty of cardio equipment and some free weights and machines too. Restaurant - covered, but open-air restaurant with comfortable seating, several flat-panel TVs for watching the games. Solid food that didn't seem to be overpriced which was a nice surprise. They'll serve you poolside too. Open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. They have a bar in the restaruant too. Service - excellent, had no issues. The parking garage was a great addition too, especially in the hot Florida sun. I can't say anything bad about this vacation club/hotel. It was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back just for the hotel”
Reviews.Author: shomudro
Reviews.Content: Excellent place. The rooms are huge with everything you need when you go with family and young kids including a washer/dryer unit in each room. The kitchens are fully furnished. The place is new and very very clean. There are two pools - one with a water slide. Disney is just 2-3 miles down. Universal a little more in the other direction. The only sticky point came when my autistic daughter got a little injured after coming down the water slide. She was immediately attended to by the stuff - nice people. But then came big manager - straight out of Hollywood movies (like Get Shorty). He insisted I give a signed statement that nobody was responsible. It finally did not happen since we kept missing each other (I would be out of room when he would call) but I was surprised that he kept insisting even when I told repeatedly everything was fine.

Reviews.Title: “We lovedddd this Resort, planning our 2nd trip for march 2010!!”
Reviews.Author: danieldiaz
Reviews.Content: Well I dont know where to start this place was great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!....it did have a few kinks but overall 9 out of 10 and i'll explain the reason for this rating. We stayed here from 08/20 to 08/25 we booked a King one bedroom Suite .. we arrived at roughly 1 am we were greeted with a smile and Front desk was very niceee and we basically had the quickest check in at a hotel by the time the Rep finished welcoming us she knew my name and had our room keys ready and we were off to our room..... let me start by saying there is only one tower currently working it has 15 floors our room was in the 9th floor #1901 (i requested a high floor with a nice view ) and we got a beautiful view of the main pool and entrance...and what a view that was everymorning just gorgeous pool area. the room was spotlessss....i was clean , very roomy for 2 ppl... the kitchen was fully stocked... with plates,silverware,cups,glasses,wine glasses, along with cooking pots....(by the way the oven is some new convection oven type.....im very tech savy but boy did it take me a few tries to get the damn oven to work lmao but once its working its jsut great lol) the frigde was just great with lots of space so was the dishwasher(you get 2 pack of detergent for the DW, located under the sink) also you get a Washer dryer combination which came in super handy with all the shopping we did we washed everything and came back with all clean clothes.... the living area was great and spacious has a very big comfortable sofa that is also a new type of sofa bed which was veryyyy comfy for a sofabed(we tried it while watching tv and it was great) the tv in the living room was like a 37" plasma and we had a 30" or 32" in the bedroom... do not expect good picture quality from the regular channels if you are not familiar w/HD the normal stations will be a bit fuzzy due to tv connections but once you reach an HD channel (which come included) you will get perfect image quality also in the living room you have an HD dvd player ..... ( i brought my Xbox 360 but could not use it due to internet connection, so i jsut stuck to using the dvd player) now for the bedroom/bathroom.... what a sight the french door leading to the bedroom are great and give it a very relaxed feel to the room.... the bed was omg heavennnn and dont get me started on the pillows... (lets jsut say was tempted to take a few back home lol) yes sleeping here is like floating on a cloud the bed ,sheet and pillows were just fantasticcccc..... the room closethas electronic safe which we used veryy much..... now the bathroom was one of the best features of the King 1 bedroom Suite... VERY MODERN AND RELAXING WITH LOTS OF ROOMMMM.... we loved the double vanity .... the stand-in shower was great u can fit like 4 ppl inside but it was jsut perfect for us 2 lol..... also it had 2 shower heads one on the wall and the other was handheld adjustable ...so 2 ppl can shower with out a problem.... the soak tub.... was totally cool and old world type... was very comfortable tub to lay in (even for 2 ppl) we loved the water spout from the ceiling (falls kinda hard but onces theres water in the tub sounds fine ) the bathroom has a seperate area for the toilet which u can divided from the main bathroom (showers and sink) there also a second entrance from a door in front of the dinnin room .. which comes in handy ..... the balcony was really nice and big lots of space had furniture there was a table for 4 and a nice seat to lay in...... the hotel itself was always clean and tidy the hallway was always empty and clean... the whole time we were there only saw 2 other guest from our floor , they very a nice couple.... now the Pool area...was just great and cool..... we enjoyed both the main pool with the water slide(yes im 27 but there were ppl of all ages ans sizes jumpin down) the slide was very very cool for a resort pool so that was always fun.... the main pool was pretty much empty thourhg the week only on sat and sun did we see a few families and couples with kids in the pool but still it was never croweded.... theres also a second more private pool which mostly i saw being used by adults ... we were always at the pool by 8 am b4 heading out about our days at the parks.... the cabanas are mostly empty until prob midday ..by then the 3 cabanas at the main pool would be taken but there still 4 more on the second pool .... there are alos roughly 3 or 4 spa pools thoughout the whole complex... these are veryyyyyyyyyyyy relaxing after a lonnngggg day of walking....... We were the only ones (from what we saw) who made use of the BBQ grill and grill area.... i loved it.....there are 6 grills for use and a nice spacious bbq area.... it on the back side of first tower (just take the lake trail) this is right next to the the joggin trail that goes around a medium sized lake area..... ohhh yes and now the few kinks i spoke about in this hotel.... BEWARE of the Lanline Internet connection it did not work at all..... if the wireless was wornkin i would not know did not have wireless equipment but the room do come reay for interconnection from the wall socket using and Ethernet cable...this service never worked....there are 2 plug conections one in the bedroom by a nite stand and the second in in the living behind the side table... i had someone from Enginnering come take a look he did best he could never solved the issue he stated he reffered the problem to the engineer who handle land lines but that person never made any contact with us nor left any type of msgs...so we left this problem as unresolved and went about our vacation( so much for carryin our xbox to play on Live) second but this was not a bother at all but would have been great (especially when u are super tried from outside) was no room service from the cafe downstairs im hoping in the future it changes...the only thing they have is they are able to make the charges to your room if you'd like....but thats about it....this wasnt major but we jsut wanted to make note of it..... this hotel is a wonderful and excellent place to stay for all ages .....def recommend it if you want to get a clean modern room and beautiful pool areas..... Now i will mention someone that no one has mentioned.... transportation!!! we did not rent a car.... we used cabs to and from places...First off let me start by saying you can def use this form or travel but renting a car is recommended and i do not say this becasue of the location ...this is located very near all the parks especially Sea world...is literally 5 mins from the hotel.... but yeah we spent alot of unecessary money on cabs.... they charge for evertyhing and if theres traffic and ur stuck boi that meter just keeps charging u.... so yes if you can avoid having to use cabs pls do so also a side note when booking ur trip with the expedia rep in the lobby do not use their transporation it is very well priced 12 roundtrip to and from the park but they are very unreliable on our first day we went to universal studios our pick up was to be @ 5pm.. we were at designated stop since 4:53 pm and by 5:30 still waiting we decided to call the place only to have some very rude indian guy barley understood english when asked what happened to the pickup the guy said " he already did pick up, talk to boss next pickup at 7pm" that was the line he repeated 3 times.... after payin our money and now being made to wait 2 hrs for a next we pretty much had no choice and get on a cab and pay rough 44 plus tips to get back to the hotel......no one took resposiblity and we cannot blame hotel since expedia just works out of a small stand in the hotel.... but yes be veryyy carefull when using their service its called Sterlin Transportation...... they are not very friendly either the guy who did the pick up was a complete A.. and swore he was too good to even say good morning when greeted.... but yeah that was pretty much it hope it helped lol also i will be posting pics soon....took over 900 so i have to sort out the few i can post on here for you guys to view.... anyquestion just send a msg over i'll gladly anser

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: cjd609
Reviews.Content: We stood at this hotel for 4 nights. Yes it is in the middle of nowhere pretty much with nothing else around but once you walk inside you completely forget about it. It is very beautiful. The rooms were very clean and the staff was very nice and friendly, made us feel welcome from the second we walked in. The pools are very nice, the cafe food is great! The only downside of the hotel is no room service. They just opened the fitness center the second day we were there. Its smaller than expected but very nice. Also watch out for the marketing manager. She had called us about the promotion they do to buy shares and get free gifts, BUT you have to make OVER $70,000 annually or you do not qualify for the free gifts. Other than that we had a great experience and I do plan on going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very clean and great staff”
Reviews.Author: twarren
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parc Soleil from the 8th August to the 20th August this year. I couldn't fault it. The room was immaculate and the service was amazing. We were a little worried about booking the hotel as it had only just opened and more development is planned but during our stay we were placed in an excellent room which overlooked the pool and a view of the Sea World fireworks. If you want to know what our view was like and the view of our hotel then I recorded a little video for people back home during the time we were there. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YQquMXjomHA The only bad point was the location. We didn't hire a car initially as we were going to the parks via the Hotel shuttle ($6 return to all parks) and the shuttle was perfect and always on time. The last few days of our stay we decided to hire a car and pick up from the Dollar location in Lake Beuna Vista. I'd definitely recommend a car for this location as there isn't any shops or places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but don't stay in the studio”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan51
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Parc Soleil. It's a beautiful resort - a bit isolated, but only 5 minutes from restaurants, stores, etc. On our first stay was in a one bedroom, which was absolutely beautiful and large with a full kitchen, washer and dryer. In the evenings, we were able to view the Disney fireworks from our terrace. On our most recent trip, we stayed in the studio unit. First, there was no balcony and the room was very, very small, about 1/4 the size of the one bedroom and only about $20 less per night. We were unable to sleep and kept waking up throughout the night because the air conditioning unit was right near the bed and kept coming on loudly. Also the tv was very fuzzy. We had asked to upgrade to a larger room but none were available. Overall, the resort is lovely, beautiful pools, nice restaurant and they recently opened the gym. We found everyone who worked there was very pleasant and went out of their way to make you feel welcomed. We would stay again but not in a studio.

HotelInfo.Name: Parc Soleil by Hilton Grand Vacations Club
HotelInfo.Address: 11272 Desforges Avenue, Orlando, FL 32836
